author: 78825e853c7650c39fc11189148d2583
content:
[h1]《Persona 5 Strikers》——一场在传统领域内的成功探索与革新[/h1]
[b]游戏简介[/b]：《Persona 5 Strikers》[spoiler](女神异闻录5乱战 魅影攻手)[/spoiler]是由P-Studio与光荣特库摩旗下Omega Force团队合作开发并由Atlus发行的一款动作角色扮演游戏，同时也属于本系列的第六部正统续作。但与前作不同的是，本作采取的主要游戏表演形式为类似《真三国无双》游戏系列的实时动作战斗，与传统的回合制 Persona战斗方式大相径庭，因此别样的争议与话题声讨自P5S问世起亦不绝于耳。

[b]剧情简介[/b]：在《Persona 5》的故事结束半年后，主角Joker和Mona回到了东京并与其他怪盗团成员们聚首，打算久违的在暑假期间来一场野营旅行；为了完成这次野营的准备工作，他们共同使用了一个当下正流行的名为“EMMA”的智能AI应用程序。但在Joker一行与Skull去涩谷购买必需品的途中，突然被一位当红偶像爱丽丝[spoiler](Alice Hiiragi)[/spoiler]诱导进了一座被称为监狱的梦境；他们发现了爱丽丝的阴谋并与其交战，却寡不敌众，最终被丢进了涩谷下的垃圾回收站中。万幸的是，他们在探索出口的过程中偶遇到了一位名叫索菲亚[spoiler](Sophia)[/spoiler]的的AI机器人；索菲亚加入了他们的队伍并轻松地带领一行人重返现实世界。

在经历这一场惊心动魄的旅程后，怪盗团成员们都得知了EMMA具有能够使他们自由进出类似之前监狱的虚拟梦境的功能；再加上此时有传言称有部分人们已被监狱中的阴影袭击，并且这间接导致其与现实世界中也表现异常[spoiler](例如无故失心疯的狂暴化)[/spoiler]，因此怪盗团成员们重建了“幻影之心”并立志和这场闹剧背后扭曲人心和社会公义的黑暗势力进行殊死斗争。

[b]内容设定[/b]：前面提到过本作采取的是一种全新的实时动作战斗系统，因此这也成了P5S与P5R及此前系列的最大区别。本作的战斗主要是在玩家控制的主角与敌人接触时开始的，此时如果未被敌人发现威胁，还可以通过发起突袭来获得战斗优势。但是玩家在使用Persona技能时仍将使用基于命令的技能菜单，在此期间的战斗将暂停并允许玩家对Persona技能进行战术定位——如果对敌方造成了严重的伤害，则敌人可能会被击落并造成“全面进攻”从而打出大量伤害。

除此之外，玩家可以组成最多为四个成员的战斗队伍，玩家可以凭依个人喜好来互相替换组合队伍成员[spoiler](Joker为固定成员)[/spoiler]；玩家只能在现实世界中控制Joker，但在探索故事地牢时可以自由控制任何成员。值得注意的是，玩家在探索地牢时应时刻注意警戒度指数器的数值——玩家于迷宫内被敌方发现后警戒数值会上升，并且接下来的警备会更严厉；如果敌人陷入危机并逃走的话警戒度指数器也会上升，此时可利用怪盗同盟阻止；如果地牢的警戒数值达到100％，则玩家将只能被迫离开。当然了，玩家也可以选择通过偷袭敌方并赢得战斗或是改天探索使地牢警戒度下降。

Persona系列的美术风格同样也是使其在众玩家群体中叫好又叫座的重要原因之一，除却那风格鲜明且大胆配色的Persona风UI与人物性格、造型设计，本作在游戏的场景搭建与设计上也下足了功夫。因本作的主要活动地点位于日本，因此游戏过程中常常会将日本的街道实景展现得淋漓尽致，甚至被玩家们戏称为日本旅游模拟器。再在其基础上辅以曲风、种类各异并最终交织成独特Persona风的配乐，毫不突兀地融合进游戏的同时也使得玩家的代入感得到了极大的满足与延申，以至于在游戏通关后常常会引起一阵空虚感，我想大概这是只有优秀作品才能够带来的吧。

[b]游戏总结[/b]：本作将原本已十分完善且成熟的Persona系统与看似格格不入却异常契合的即时战斗系统融合在了一起，从而使本系列达到了一个新的高度与平衡；再加上本系列一如既往的优秀美术风格与游戏配乐，因此无论你是Persona系列的老玩家还是刚入坑的新手都十分推荐此版本。当然如果你是对无双元素或是日式RPG情有独钟的玩家，本作也绝对值得一试，P5的世界永远对你们敞开大门！
 
[b]写在最后的碎碎念[/b]：游戏制作人桥野桂曾经在访谈中说过希望玩家们能够通过这款游戏去思考一个问题：“我们能够为自己、为他人做什么？”这个问题在现如今物欲横流的社会中确实值得每个人去品味斟酌：越来越快的城市节奏、扭曲却习以为常的996工作生活、复杂又不得不维持的人际关系……虚伪与真实似乎越来越难以分辨，但每个人都应当不随大流、保有自己对这个世界的独立思考；我们生来皆不完美，但每个人的出生都是概率极低的完美存在，如果我们无力改变这个世界，那么不如去改变自己、改变身边的人，我们终会活成自己所喜欢的模样。

author: 22e7890b4ebc54babaa81348cee7afdc
content:
P5やってない人やP5のアニメを見てない人は楽しめないと思います。
P5やった人とかにはオススメ。

ストーリーのテイストはよくも悪くもP5と同じ感じ。個人的には若干マンネリだと思わないでもないけどP5楽しめたなら楽しめるはずです。ただし、怪盗団以外の既存キャラは基本出てきません。

ゲーム部分ですがP5の好きなキャラを操作できるアクションというだけ個人的にはそこそこ楽しい。また、キャラによって攻撃方法も違うのでそこも楽しめます。総攻撃やSHOW TIMEといった要素も楽しめるように考えられていると感じました。操作感も多少独特だと思いますが、慣れればそんなに悪くないと思います。アクションではありますが戦闘中でもペルソナのスキル選択時などは敵味方が止まるのでじっくり考えたりもできます。戦闘中にロード（やり直し）できないとか細かい不満はありますが、楽しめました。
ただ難易度NORMALでもアクション得意でない自分としては結構難しく感じました。無双という感じではないです。特にボスは攻撃を避けるのが簡単でないわりに硬くてチマチマ攻撃してると時間がかかりすぎます。アイテムを大量に持ち込めば負けることはないですがアクション苦手な人は…というか1週目はEASYで始めた方が楽しめるかも？

また、ボスが固い割にSPも少なく、ペルソナの使用用途も限られるのであまりペルソナの作成に凝ってもしょうがないと感じました。それを分かってなのかペルソナの種類は少ないです。

価格に関しては高目の値段が設定されてるので若干割高感あるけど内容は（使いまわしもあれど）結構しっかりしてるので高いというのも憚られるくらいの印象。

クラッシュは自分も3度ほどありましたがほかの方のレビューを見るとある程度は回避できるっぽいのでそれを参考に

[h1]結論[/h1]
P5好きで気になってるならやった方がよいと思います。アクション苦手でもアイテム使えばなんとかなります。
P5S出すならP5Rも移植してください。あとP3Pもお願いします。

author: 14b1082a1eaf5627ba63c60952583c32
content:
Hi, I really looked forward to playing this game. Can't recommend it after 10 hours, though. I don't want to continue this. Note: I have not played Persona before, but have watched it on Twitch regularly and roughly know the plot. Also, I'll try to be the devil's advocate here, but don't blame me if I get a little worked up.
Pros:
There's no doubt it has awesome cinematics, cool fighting mechanics and controls well. I like Anime. Occasionally, I'll watch one. It's tiring though, how in every new Anime, most of the same ideas always get recycled. Persona, on the other hand, does a good job to come up with interesting new ideas and the characters all have a unique charme to them.
The palaces are really fun. I like the hidden chests and objects, the relatively unique combat ideas and the Persona system.
I played the game on normal mode and it is very well balanced. Plus, the music is great. I do believe some people are overrating the music, but it's still really spicy.
Cons:
Hear me out; I already mentioned that I like Anime. I, too, can invest lots of my time into deeper story and plot analysis. However, if I wanted to play a visual novel, I just would've. The dialogue scenes are cool at first, but they get so boring. At the same time, neither have any of my dialogue 'decisions' made ANY difference on the plot whatsoever, nor am I really willing to completely 'skip' all of them since then I'd have no idea what's going on. And the plot is what people always praise the series for, innit? I don't think it's bad to have long dialogue sequences, but they really OVERDID IT with the frequency. I've spent less time in dialogue sequences in all Life Is Strange games that have been released...
Furthermore, one is SO limited! I can't underscore this enough. You can't even explore one shop, one sideroad, one small area without any of the characters becoming professor oak lamenting about it 'neither being the right place, nor time'. I have to strictly follow the game's idea of how it wants to be played. It's frustrating. Why, devs? Well, in Pokemon Red (1999) at leat you could enter Pokemarts. Well, ATLUS didn't even bother to animate that in 2021. Again, where is the love? If the game is set in Tokyo, at least try to make it feel like there's a cool shopping experience you can have. The food and medical items you can buy in Persona 5 Strikers are basically all the same (When it comes to TP and SP restoring), they just have different names. By the way, 'Donut-Worry' (restores some health) is the only item/thing in the game that has made me chuckle. Though likeable, the convos are never really... funny. Yeah, the don't have a good sense of humour.
The areas are well designed. The artwork and visuals fit perfectly. In Tokyo and other places like Sendai, however, you'll see the same 9-10 character models all the time. Humans in this game appear to be nothing but strange hollows without even a glimpse of a soul. I just really wish they (the devs) had spent more time creating a world that's actually vivid. I wish they had taken more time to make this a good game.
The skill tree in this game is ridiculously uncomplex (It's the complete opposite to a game like Final Fantasy X). It's not interesting, it's not individual, and it's not really challenging your decisionmaking/brain either. Heck, they don't even make you do a small minigame or the like when you cook for the rest of the party. 
Hyrule Warrios, for anyone who's played that, really sucks at the plot part. But at least I get to PLAY the GAME. And I don't want to wait until I've gained freedom of movement potentially towards the end game. That's simply not a point.
We're in 2021 and still nobody expects your game to be as detailed as, say, the Witcher III (2015). In Contrast, with games like The Witcher existing (not a 60 Euro title by the way), how can you even legitimize putting so few love into your towns that you could basically copy from reality and didn't have to make up entirely.
Conclusion:
I have to add, that the voice acting in this game is superb and the writing too. As english is my second language, I quite enjoy the narrative and style. To be honest, I could probably forget about the cons. Well, if this weren't a 60 Euro game, that is!
I bought this game on Sale (52 Euro for Digital Deluxe) and that wasn't even worth it. I think at it's current state, the game isn't worth any more than 25 Euro, for there is a huge lack in love for the design of player independence. And hence they try to make it seem like your decision matters in conversations, you can't tell me they're not actually trying to establish the illusion that you do have some independence in this game.
Since I'm done with school now, soon to be studying at university and thus am short on money, I'll have to continue this game. I merely don't have the money to buy another one. I'll come back to this review once finished. 
If at all, please keep the comments neutral and respectful. Try convincing me rather than defending your favorite nostalgic franchise.

author: 5b8c47181228523c89cbf29608e9a3e3
content:
[b]P5S将迷人的角色、故事、充满活力的菜单和音乐与全新的战斗系统相结合，将回合制rpg风格的战斗设置为更疯狂、即时的1vs. 1000模式，但这仍然会让你觉得自己在玩《女神异闻录》，或许也能给你带来一次一加一大于二的新体验[/b]

[h1][quote=]
[table]
[tr]
[th]　欢迎关注 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38287879]网易UU鉴赏家培养计划[/url][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]　来这里找优质游戏、开黑日友、白嫖UU时长卡　[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]　加速Steam社区、游戏记得用UU哦_(:з」∠)_　[/th]
[/tr]
[/table]
[/quote][/h1]

[h1]把里面的怪盗团放在几乎所有游戏中，我都会喜欢[/h1]
这些角色的形象都很丰满，现实，也很成熟。并且他们比我们上次见到他们的时候成长了，他们会对敌人流露出同情，而你也同样会为他们的英雄时刻欢呼。我怎么能不抓住这个机会多花点时间陪陪这些孩子呢?更别说还有穿越日本的自驾游呢?

[h1]没有前作经历，也能获得良好体验[/h1]
P5S发生在P5结束6个月后。虽然游戏剧情并没有与P5和P5R相冲突，但其实没有前作的游玩经历也并不会有碍于P5S的直接游玩体验，除非是为了完全理解那些对于过去的不经意引用并在战斗中拥有些许优势，如果是这样，玩过前作还是很有帮助的。

[h1]你将继续扮演近乎沉默的主角Joker[/h1]
你回到了涩谷，你将与你的老朋友——现在是战友的心之怪盗团们一起享受你们的暑假。能力越大自然责任越大，玄幻的事件自然也是接踵而至，迫使我们的主人公戴上了面具，回到虚拟世界，并又开始了他们偷取恶人之心的传统。

 [h1]与众不同的无双体验[/h1]
P5S与光荣为其它IP打造的无双游戏并不相似，与塞尔达无双和海贼无双系列也不尽相同。虽然这两款游戏也都是塞尔达和海贼王系列优秀游戏的无双版，但P5S与之不同的是：P5S所包含的女神异闻录传统要素要远多于单纯的无双游戏，而这也正是P5S最为突出的特色或优点。

在一个典型的无双游戏中，战斗舞台将横跨整个地图。游戏中到处都是敌人，这就要求玩家在一场漫长而持续的战斗中从一场战斗跳到另一场战斗。我喜欢P5S打破了无双模式，将战斗限制在更小的场景中，就像你在典型的RPG中看到的那样。你可以通过潜行和伏击等战术策略性地计划你的交战，让你在战斗中占据上风，或者完全避免挑起战斗。游戏中没有基地需要占领或保护，所以单纯的逃跑也不会让你受到惩罚。

[h1]P5S还取消了一些比较传统的无双元素，但最明显的大量敌人和砍砍砍要素依然保留[/h1]
每个角色都配备了近战和远程武器，你仍然可以使用各种按键组合与一大群敌人战斗。9个可玩角色之间的组合是不同的，学习新的、强大的组合并找到最适合自己风格的角色是游戏的一大乐趣。你喜欢在黑客帝国风格的枪战中插入短刀和飞刀吗?那小丑就是你的菜了。还是说你更喜欢缓慢但毁灭性的打击呢? 那就去试试 "美少女盗贼 "吧。

如果没有了强大的、可召唤的盟友，这些你可以在战斗中用来削弱敌人的力量，这就不是一款真正的女神异闻录游戏了。每个其他人物都有一个人格面具可以召唤，而主角Joker可以同时佩戴召唤多个人格面具，这让他成为事实上最强大的盗贼。但也正因为他拥有所有这些角色，为了游戏的平衡，这让他的连击相比之下显得有点弱。我经常会对他基本的X-X-Y，或者X-X-X组合感到厌烦。尽管其他盗贼的角色通常没有那么泛用，但他们都拥有更多样的组合和连击风格。
 
[h1]战斗可能看起来非常混乱，但实际上它是一种明确且令人满意的组合执行、角色挥舞和全面攻击的华丽芭蕾舞。[/h1]
 
常规战斗是快速的，尖锐的，持续时间往往只有几秒钟，甚至如果你想伏击他们，只需按下一个按钮就能结束战斗。但boss的挑战要更加艰巨，玩家需要先利用机制或弱点消耗掉大量防御值才能对HP条造成有效的伤害。而不像在标准的无双游戏中，玩家可以随意敲击按键，P5S更多的要求玩家在混战中制定策略，也因此我更加喜欢这款游戏。你可以在你的团队成员之间切换，砍杀，追击，射击任何移动的东西，但除非你找到敌人的弱点，否则你不会得到高收益。当你这么做的时候，你将得到一个炫酷华丽并有着爆炸演出效果的斩杀攻击作为奖励，这将真正清除一个房间或boss的最后一段生命值，并最终结束这场华丽的战斗。
 
尽管如此，战斗还是需要经常的重复进行，特别是当你发现很难掌握连击技巧时。而于此同时战斗也是非常耗费资源，使用角色会消耗你的技能值(SP)，如果你经常使用它们去攻击弱点(但你又不得不这么做)，你会在进入地下城三到四场战斗中耗尽SP，这就需要你回到现实世界去购买补给或食物。不过，你也可以使用一个特殊的组合技巧来解决这个问题，即在不消耗SP的情况下部署角色的主要元素攻击。或者你可以通过在检查点轮换盟友来维持队伍的健康状态，这些机制的巧妙加入让玩法变得更加多样，也让不同难度的玩家都能拥有健康的体验

 
[h1]在P5S中，你将以日本各地为舞台[/h1]
每一个新的城市都有着充满活力与魅力的全新场景。我玩P5S的乐趣很大程度上也来源于这次公路旅行。只是坐在舒适的沙发上，却感觉真正的来到了大阪道顿堀街道，看到了两旁陈列着色彩缤纷的陈列品，来到了新关海，我还把那胖乎乎的河豚挂在了我的头上。

[h1]有趣的烹饪系统[/h1]
在每个城市，你都被鼓励尝试当地的美食，甚至为自己重新制作它。烹饪是P5S引入的新元素之一，它很快成为我最喜欢的环节之一。寻找食谱鼓励了你探索周围的环境，与人交谈，参观当地的小吃摊。

也许我在整个游戏过程中吃得并不多，但P5S中的食物听起来确实非常诱人，让我渴望吃以前从未听说过的食物（其实是渴望收集没有收集过的新食谱）。当我听到“御行烧”这样的词，看到它模糊的描述是肉白菜煎饼，我只说了句，好家伙，我想吃那个。这些孩子们不打怪兽的时候，就只会吃东西，我也很喜欢他们。一群青少年的动机仅仅是为了下一顿饭是什么，而不是他们需要为即将到来的战斗做什么准备，这很富有亲和力。这是我在电子游戏中所见过的最真实的青少年刻画，哈哈哈。

[h1]循环的体验让游戏世界的单调被放大[/h1]
虽然我喜欢探索所有的新领域，但我希望游戏能给我更多的机会去真正地欣赏风景。这款游戏非常循环式，让你匆忙地从一个地点跑到另一个地点，将你送入地下城，你几乎没有机会享受过场动画之外的外部世界。在P5中，你可以做的各种活动——拜访棒球练习场、狂吃巨无霸汉堡、算命、学习弹子术等，但在P5S中这些内容都已经被舍去。而当你有机会呼吸新鲜空气时，你的体验却变得非常单薄，仅局限于去某个地方的各种商店购买战斗用品或烹饪原料。
 
[h1]起起伏伏的支线任务[/h1]
虽然P5S缺少社交活动，但游戏中还有支线奖励任务需要完成。比如有时游戏会要求你以特定方式打败特定数量的敌人。你的同伴也会向你提出他们自己的请求，从而获得奖励，用来增强属性和解锁可爱的剧情。

对我来说，这些请求的难度和体验差异巨大。有时候，完成这些任务很简单，因为在收集任务的请求出现时，我已经有了所需的道具数量。其他时候，请求更像是一种彻头彻尾的痛苦。是的，我真的不想再次与boss战斗！特别是当奖励只是一堆可怜的金币时。但有些奖励也值得你去体验，比如比你所能买到的任何东西都强大得多的武器。

[h1]充满意义和价值的新探索[/h1]
可以说把P5S称为无双游戏是不公平的，因为他们之间确实有着太多的不同。P5S的战斗太过流畅和多变，并且有着非常多策略性的女神异闻录要素，这显然不能把其称之为典型的无双。而我认为正是这种战斗拯救了一款原本普通的游戏。
 
[b]在P5S中，光荣探索出了一个新的路线，偏离了常规的跨界方式，也创造出了这款1+1大于2的作品[/b]

author: 6195eb6b9935507a9fefc4a0da53c2c3
content:
[h1] Actual, Super-Serious Persona 5 Strikers Review: [/h1]

[strike] it's ok, i guess. [/strike]



TL;DR: It's a good game, and I don't recommend it for those who haven't played/experienced Persona 5 in any form or fashion.



P5S is a great sequel for both the base and the Royal re-release versions of Persona 5. Admittedly I [i] am [/i] biased, as I fell in love with this game series since Royal's release and quarantine's abundance of free time. 

It has more of the characters that you love and more of the strategies you employed in P5, all wrapped up with fast-paced hack n' slash gameplay and a decent story that adds new characters that I'll refrain from mentioning any further. If this is your first game with the Phantom Thieves, I sincerely recommend that you [i] not [/i] start here, as all the pre-existing characters are already established in this sequel, and the game wastes [i] no [/i] time re-introducing them or their character arcs. If you don't understand what's going on from the beginning, you'll have to catch up on a lot in your own time, or just run around like a headless chicken and beat the h#%l out of the computer pixels with your skillful excellent button pressing.

My first run-through of mastering the game (Finishing the story and completing [b] all [/b] of the requests, side-bosses, etc.) took me exactly 69 [spoiler] nice [/spoiler] hours and so-and-so minutes on Hard mode, though I certainly took my time.

I also went through a Merciless NG+ run (only available after Mastering your first run) to finish my achievements list and unlock more powerful [strike] psychological Pokémon [/strike] Personas, I finished the achievement list at my current playtime (130.0 hours). While I do love this game, I'm not the type to normally enjoy NG+ runs and that more or less remains the same. I wouldn't recommend it, unless you [i] absolutely [/i] thought the game was too easy. Though be warned, it may feel a lot grindier than the normal Easy/Normal/Hard mode runs.

Other notable things worth mentioning:
[list]
[*]I only played on controller, and I recommend you do the same if possible. I'm not familiar with MnK controls, though I hear they're not the best. That preference is up to you, of course.
[*]The music, as always, is a banger. And has been remixed to fit with this game's faster, more action-oriented combat.
[*]The fusion system, the Velvet Room, and obtaining masks work somewhat differently compared to P5/P5R, though personally I didn't find the changes of serious significance.
[*]There are [i] no [/i] Confidants/Social Links, in its place are the traditional RPG-like leveling up of skills, and Combat Mastery by playing different Phantom Thieves.
[*]Speaking of which, you're able to play as any of the Phantom Thieves almost immediately. Each member has their own special variation of combos, and a unique combat skill that can alter your approach to a fight.
[*]Unfortunately, no waifu is canon. But (actual semi-spoiler) [spoiler] a certain 5head bestgirl(?) may or may not get more screentime [/spoiler]. 
[/list]


All in all, Persona 5 Strikers burned my bread, revealed the troof, and stole my heart. I lost the mutual respect of my friend groups after they saw me jump into the Persona sinkhole, and after 100%'ing this game I can tell you I've only sunk in further.

author: f3b79e08a76f5485ac73780ac7a49ccd
content: Persona 5'in büyük bir hayranı olarak bu oyunu beğendim. Öncelikle bu oyundan zevk almak için orjinal Persona 5'i bitirmeniz gerekiyor. Persona 5 Royal'e eklenen Kasumi karakteri bu oyunda yok zaten. Hikayesi Persona 5'in hikayesine oldukça benziyor ancak bu eğlenemeyeceğiniz anlamına gelmiyor. Komik diyaloglar ve yeni yan karakter Zenkichi Hasegawa bu kısımları kapatıyor. Gerçekten güzel bir eklenti olmuş Zenkichi. Oynanışa gelirsek eğer ben ne yalan söylesem sıkıldım. Musou oyunlarını seven biriyim bunun en büyük kanıtı Pirate Warriors 3'ü saat 100 oynamam ve 4'ü çıktığı gün alıp ertesi günü bitirmem. Musou kısmını doğru düzgün yapamamışlar maalesef. Birazcık daha eğlenceli bir oynanış ile bu oyun çok daha güzel yer edebilirdi aklımda. Harita tasarımlarına gelirsek eğer, çoğu güzel. Oyun nereye gitmeniz gerektiğini gösteriyor ve bunu kötü algılamayın eğer göstermeseydi hayatta bulamayacağınız yerleri aramak zorunda kalırdınız. Ancak son boss kısmına 2-3 lafım var. Ben oyunu dürüst olucam kolay modda oynadım. Zaten oynanışını çok sevmedim oyunun bari hızlı bitsin o kısımlar diye kolay moda aldım. Son boss için eğer benim gibi amelelik yapmak istemiyorsanız karakterinizi hayvan gibi fulleyin. Sophie ve Joker'ı kullanacaksınız zaten çoğunlukla savaşta ve bayağı bir SP'ye ihtiyacınız olucak yoksa benim gibi sabaha kadar melee saldırılarla döve döve öldürürsünüz boss'u. Neyse özet geçicek olursak güzel hikayesi ve ortalama oynanışıyla Persona 5 Strikers bir ara oyun olarak güzel olmuş. 8/10

author: b075058355e75662be1753916d4e0ccf
content:
I was pretty hyped to get this game when it came out, in fact it's one of the few games I actually preordered because I knew I was getting it no matter what, since I loved persona 3,4 and 5. Plus I really like hack and slash type games, like Metal Gear Rising and Bayonetta. This however, is neither of those.

This game is a mix of Persona 5 and Musou games. If you like Musou games, you will probably like this, if you don't, but you enjoy persona 5, you might still enjoy it, given that it does differentiate in some aspects

It plays like persona 5 in the sense that you get to wield personas and it adds a somewhat complex layer to the game
However,  it's pretty boring as far as action games go. It's an average at best game covered with persona 5 elements that makes it seem better than it actually is.

 It lacks the polish most persona games have. The bad guys are bland, the main cast interactions feel sameish all throughout the game, the side missions are tedious as all hell, honestly it's a very unrewarding experience. There is no calendar system, there is no confidants, the difficulty is inconsistent... It's just not persona, or a fun game for that matter.

It's not good. It's not bad either, it's just ok! Not worth the $60 price tag, get it on sale.

author: fa25b9a36cd454c6a932f8fd06a0c515
content:
Das Spiel ist eine Quasi Fortsetzung von Persona 5 ist daher nach meiner Meinung eher weniger für Neueinsteiger geeignet obwohl die Story zwar eigenständig ist aber sie setzt in bestimmte Dinge doch Vorwissen voraus.
Wenn man den Vorgänger aber kennt darf man sich auf ein Wiedersehen mit den Phantomdieben freuen das zwar spielerisch ziemlich anders ist aber sich immer noch wie Persona anfühlt.
Die größte Neuerungen ist das Echtzeitkampfssystem bei dem man sich jetzt durch Gegnermassen mit simplen Kombos schlagen darf, dabei ist es trotzdem wichtig auf die Stärken und Schwächen der eigenen Personas und der Gegner zu achten um erfolgreich zu sein. Das ist recht spaßig und geht gut von der Hand auch wenn die Kämpfe recht chaotisch werden können und man schnell den Überblick verlieren kann auch sind die meisten Bosskämpfe auch ein Tick zu lange für mein Empfinden.
Der Schwierketisgrad ist hier zwar fordernd aber meist nicht frustrierend und farmen und grinden ist nur dann nötig wenn man wirklich alles komplettieren möchte. Ich persönlich habe mich auf das lösen aller Nebenquests und dem erledigen sämtlicher optionaler Bosse beschränkt.
Ansonsten entfernt sich das Strikers auch vom dem durchplanen der einzelne Spieltage wie man es vielleicht aus Persona kennt, denn diesmal gehen die Tage erst dann vorbei wenn man mit der Handlung voranschreitet. Das führt zu den etwas komischen Aspekt dass man sich zwar komplett heilen kann wenn man einen Dungeon über einem Checkpoint verlässt und dann gleich wieder frisch gestärkt rein kann ohne irgendwelche spielerischen Konsequenzen zu haben außer ein paar nervige Ladebildschirme. Da wäre es wohl besser gewesen wenn man sich gleich beim Checkpoint heilen könnte.
Ansonsten gibt es spielerisch nicht viel zu tun, wie erwähnt gibt es zwar auch ein paar Nebenquests zu erledigen aber die bieten nichts besonders und bestehen nur aus Sammelaufgaben oder dem erledigen von bestimmten Gegnern.
Die Handlung ist auch nichts besonders und ähnelt dem Vorgänger etwas zu sehr, dafür mochte ich aber wieder die Interaktionen zwischen den Charakteren und die Truppe der Phantomdiebe ist mir mittlerweile recht ans Herz gewachsen und auch die Neuzugänge wissen zu gefallen, nur manche etwas übertriebene Fanservice und Animeklischee Momente hätte man sich sparen können.
Was im Spiel aber auch recht gut rüberkommt ist der Reiseaspekt der ganzen Handlung der für recht abwechslungsreiche Schauplätze sorgt.
Grafisch ist das Spiel vom Design wieder ähnlich stillsicher wie der Vorgänger und die einzelnen Elemente fließen gut ineinander über auch wenn ich es vielleicht einen Tick weniger gut gelungen finden als im Orignal.
Der Soundtrack ist dafür mal wieder fantastisch und bietet ein paar coole Remixe von der Musik aus dem Vorgänger hat aber auch ein paar gute neue Songs.
Die englischen Sprecher machen auch wieder einen guten Job und die deutsche Übersetzung geht zum größten Teil in Ordnung auch wenn sie manchmal etwas eigenwillig wirkt und einen recht offensichtlich Tippfehler in den Kämpfen hat man bis jetzt leider nicht korrigiert.

author: 35c784a935b45ee7ba6063087f9db922
content:
(je tiens à préciser que j'ai beaucoup joué au jeu en hors ligne et qu'actuellement je suis à une cinquantaine d'heures de jeu) .

Gameplay : Ça n'a rien en commun avec son prédécesseur "Persona 5 "Royal" - On passe d'un jeu au tour par tour à un Muso. Ça peut en décevoir certains mais sinon c'est très agréable de faire les combats en temps réel (On peut se déplacer dans les niveaux avec n'importe lequel des protagonistes et on peut enfin sauter !). Chaque personnage a ses points forts et ses faiblesses, à vous de les découvrir et de les utiliser dans les meilleures situations (même si on va tous constamment utiliser Yusuke). Les phases dans le monde réel (hors combat) sont plus simplifiées comparé à l'opus précédent mais c'est justifié dans le jeu et ça n'est pas très dérangeant. (Un petit plus pas des moindres mais on peut refaire les boss déjà vaincus sans passer par des vieux fichiers de sauvegarde !).     10/10

Difficulté : Les phases d'explorations ne sont pas bien compliquées (on peut très facilement se soigner ou regagner de l'énergie après voir pendant les combats. Néanmoins, les boss et certain mini-boss représentent un certain challenge nécessitant de la stratégie et de l'organisation pour gagner.     8/10

Graphisme : Ce n'est pas le dernier God of War en matière de graphisme... et tant mieux ! La patte graphique (style "animé") rend le jeu magnifique et les jeux de couleurs (beaucoup de couleurs vives) sont bien gérés. Mention spéciale a l'interface du jeu qui est toujours aussi unique et réussie !     9.5/10

Histoire : Ce n'est peut-être pas du niveau de P5 mais ça reste très réussi quand même. On a envie de continuer pour mieux comprendre l'univers dans lequel on évolue et quand bien même le principe du jeu est tiré par les cheveux (voyage dans le métaverse, etc.) il reste logique dans son monde. Histoire intéressante et les personnages sont toujours aussi attachants !     9/10

Durée de vie : Je vais une fois de plus comparer le jeu à son grand frère mais ne vous attendez pas à la même durée de vie de jeu que celle de P5. Le jeu est plus court (là où je mettais plus une dizaine d'heures par niveau dans P5R, je mets de 4 à 8 heures dans cet opus). Estimez environ une quarantaine (mot le plus détesté de 2021) d'heures pour finir l'histoire principale sans les quêtes secondaires.     7.5/10

Re jouabilité : Étant un jeu relativement "court" avec une mécanique de jeu dynamique je dirais que si vous finissez le jeu une première fois, il vous faudra attendre au moins quelques mois avant de vous replonger dedans.     9/10

Performances : Le jeu tourne très bien sur mon PC Portable (RYZEN 5, Nvidia GTX 1650). Il m'est arrivé seulement une fois durant tout le jeu d'avoir une chute de Fps (très courte) à cause d'un trop grand nombre d'ennemis sur l'écran et d'un ordinateur portable qui n'a pas les configurations les plus récentes.     9.5/10

Musique : Les musique de ce jeu sont I N C R O Y A B L E ! Vous prenez les excellentes musiques de P5(R) et vous les modifier pour les rendre encore plus epic. (il n'y a pas que des reprises). Les thèmes des niveaux sont tous super ! Rien à redire c'est un sans faute.     10/10

Note finale : (9.06) -> 9/10

Commentaire : Si vous n'avez pas joué à P5 où P5R ne jouez pas à Persona 5 Strickers, c'est la suite du premier jeu donc vous n'allez pas avoir la même expérience de jeu qu'une personne qui a déjà fait le premier. (suite uniquement de P5, ne tient pas en compte les événement additionnels de P5R). Si vous avez du mal avec le style Muso mais que vous adorez l'univers de Persona, je vous conseille de lui donner sa chance (je ne suis pas un grand fan des Muso et pourtant j'ai beaucoup aimé !). Je recommande le jeu !

author: 5bef4fb56596520b8618876f6f89a616
content:
Als Praktikant bei den Phantom Thieves hat man es nicht leicht. Den ganzen Tag ist man damit beschäftigt, durch die Gegend zu gurken und in irgendwelchen Restaurants die Gerichte auszuprobieren, gearbeitet wird da eher selten. Aber was verlange ich auch von Teenagern? Na ja, schon ein wenig mehr. Die Bande sitzt den ganzen Tag in ihren Van herum und quatscht, anstatt die Kraft der Jugend auszunutzen!
"Wir haben einen neuen Monarchen gefunden!", ruft Yusuke und hält die Tür zum Auto auf. Ich seufze und schließe mich der restlichen Gang an, denn ich weiß, was mir bevorsteht: Die nächsten zwölf Stunden werden wir beengt aufeinander hängen und alles tausend Mal durchkauen. Selbst Themen, die wir schon besprochen haben, werden immer wieder aufgewärmt und nochmal besprochen. Obwohl wir alles genau wissen, sagen wir immer wieder, dass wir uns nicht sicher sind und dass wir mehr Informationen brauchen, also teilen wir uns auf und rennen in der Stadt rum, um irgendwelche Leute zu belauschen, die auch nichts Neues zu sagen haben. Alles, was die tun, ist zu bestätigen, was wir bereits wissen, aber aus irgendeinem Grund unternehmen die Phantom Thieves nichts, wenn man ihnen die Lösung nicht in Großbuchstaben auf die Nase schreibt. Der Anführer und mein Chef, Joker, ist da auch weniger hilfreich, denn er hat nur eine Kunst gemeistert: Er ist großartig darin, drei Mal dasselbe in verschiedenen Worten zu sagen. Warum wir ihn immer wieder fragen, wissen wir auch nicht so genau.

Bis zum Abend sind wir in der Stadt rumgerannt und haben nicht wirklich etwas in Erfahrung bringen können, aber alle sind der Meinung, dass das, was wir wissen, ausreicht, um das Gefängnis einer Person zu betreten, die, wie die Bande vermutet, der Bösewicht ist. Das könnte ich denen auch so sagen, aber ich bin nur der Praktikant und mir hört keiner zu. Die Leute, die uns über den Weg laufen und sich definitiv als Schurken entpuppen, sind nämlich ziemlich eindeutig Fieslinge, was man schon an ihren Outfits erkennt, denn die haben irgendwann angefangen, ihre Klamotten zu designen und nicht wieder damit aufgehört.
"Wir haben alles, was wir brauchen", sagt Yusuke und haut auf den Tisch. "Jetzt gibt es nur noch eins zu tun."
Ich freue mich bereits und hole die Waffen der Gang aus dem Schrank, als Yusuke die Hand hebt und eine beschwichtigende Geste macht.
"Nicht so flott, Spring-ins-Feld." Oh nein. "Zuerst müssen wir stundenlang über unsere absolut unnützen Informationen sprechen, dann ist noch ein Fest, auf das wir wollen, und da hinten hat eine Fressbude aufgemacht, die wir noch nicht ausprobiert haben. Außerdem gibt es hier mehrere Fanservice-Stationen, die wir aufsuchen müssen."
Ich sinke auf meinen Stuhl und seufze ergeben. Bevor ich mich versehe, redet die Bande wieder über die vergangene Zeit und tut so, als hätten sie sich dreißig Jahre lang nicht gesehen, obwohl es nur sechs Monate waren. Bis das hier mal losgeht ...

... vergehen noch einmal drei Stunden. Endlich fangen die Jugendlichen an, sich in aufwendig gestaltete Bondageoutfits zu werfen und ich muss zugeben, dass die Leutchen schon echt Stil haben, selbst wenn sie ewig brauchen, um in Gang zu kommen.

Von da an geht alles ganz schnell: Wir springen in eine metaphorische Welt, die sich für cleverer hält, als sie eigentlich ist, und fangen an, wahllos irgendwelche Viecher zu verkloppen. Das reinste Chaos bricht aus, manchmal fällt es mir schwer, den Überblick zu bewahren, doch ich habe recht schnell den Dreh raus und prügele mich fast so effektiv durch die Gegnerhorden, wie die etablierten Diebe. Dass dabei einiges an Komplexität flöten gegangen ist, interessiert mich nicht. Ich wollte mich mit Monstern keilen und genau das bekomme ich geboten, da brauche ich keine unnötig komplizierten Mechaniken. Yusuke bleibt sich treu und labert die ganze Zeit, während ich versuche, mit den Monstern klar zu kommen. Ständig klopft er mir auf die Schulter, unterbricht sämtliches Geschehen und erklärt mir Kleinigkeiten, die ich schon weiß. Das reißt mich aus dem Flow und ich bekomme von mehreren Monstern eins auf die Mütze, da diese nicht damit geizen, Fertigkeiten einzusetzen - es ist recht kompliziert, alles und jeden kommen zu sehen, da brauche ich diese ständigen Unterbrechungen dieser Quasselstrippe nicht. Glücklicherweise sind bei seinem Geplapper auch Informationen dabei, die mir etwas bringen: So verrät er mir, dass mir Futaba über ein Interface die Schwächen der Gegner anzeigen lässt, damit ich gezielt meine Personas verwenden kann, um sie mit den richtigen Fertigkeiten zu immobilisieren. Die Clique hat gelernt, mit den teilweise echt sinnlosen Schwächen der Feinde umzugehen.

Wenn es nur immer so weiterwuchten würde, wäre ich glücklich, aber leider bleibt die Phantomgruppe die Phantomgruppe. Es dauert nicht lang, bis ihnen der Schweiß auf der Stirn steht und ihre Münder sich bewegen. Mit größter Mühe versuchen sie, eine Dialogflut zurückzuhalten, aber es gelingt ihnen nicht. Mitten auf dem Schlachtfeld müssen wir abbrechen, um in den Van zurückzukehren, damit wir wieder über Zeug labern können, dass ein Blinder mit Krückstock herausgefunden hätte. Ich habe inzwischen das Gefühl, dass sich meine jungen Chefs sehr gern selber reden hören. Völlig zu recht, wie ich finde - das große Ganze ist jetzt nicht unbedingt so berauschend und spannend, aber es fasziniert mich und ich mag die Clique, die den ganzen Karren mit ihrem Charme ziehen. Es fühlt sich zwar so an, als wäre ich einer Anime-OVA gefangen, aber ich drücke mal beide Augen ganz kräftig zu.

Wenn ich mir am Ende meines Praktikums eins wünschen dürfte, dann wäre es, dass eine bessere Balance zwischen Gelaber und Gekloppe gefunden wird, aber sonst habe ich wenig zu beanstanden.

****

Persona 5 Strikers macht mir persönlich großen Spaß. Klar hat es seine Schwächen, aber die bügeln die Stärken mit einem großen Eisen wieder glatt. Man wollte das Persona-Feeling einfangen und das ist geglückt, auch wenn die Dialogwahlmöglichkeiten ordentlich in die Hose gegangen sind und es offensichtlich ist, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2470393507]dass man drei Mal dasselbe sagt und es ein wenig anders formuliert[/url]. Ich mag es auch nicht sonderlich, dass meine Freiheit ständig eingeschränkt wird - wenn das Spiel will, dass gelabert wird, wird gelabert. Dann haben alle Läden zu und Seitenaktivitäten müssen warten. Mir fällt ebenfalls auf, dass der Entwickler über die Phantom Thieves zu den Spielern spricht, a la "Hier guck mal, wir haben uns so lange nicht gesehen und da, kennst das da noch?" und das ist arg Meta.

Das Gameplay wurde auf ein Minimum reduziert und erinnert eher an Dynasty Warriors, aber selbst das ist es nicht. Die Gegner latschen auf einer Map herum, entweder überfallen wir sie oder rennen direkt rein. Danach spawnen ein paar Typen, wir klatschen die auf und weiter gehts. Es gibt eine Levelup- und Bindungsmechanik, aber die erledigt sich zum großen Teil von selbst. Viel Einwirkung habe ich als Spieler nicht drauf.

Das ergibt am Ende eine seichte Actionklopperei, die von ihrem Namen und den Figuren lebt. Wären die Charaktere nicht so interessant, hätte mich das Spiel längst verloren - aber so will ich wissen, wie es für die Bande weitergeht, wohin es mich noch verschlägt und worauf die ganze Sache am Ende hinauslaufen soll, denn - ohne jetzt was über den Plot zu verraten - so richtig Sinn ergibt die Sache für mich aktuell noch nicht.

Wer Persona-Fan ist, kann hier bedenkenlos zuschlagen - alle anderen sollten sich unbedingt ein Video drüber ansehen und eine Zusammenfassung über den Plot von Persona 5 lesen, denn ohne Vorwissen ist man hier komplett verloren. Das Spiel richtet sich an Fans und wer als Nichtkenner dazu kommt, muss damit klar kommen, dass er nicht weiß, worüber die Leute da reden, wer das überhaupt ist, was die machen und wieso überhaupt und Hääää im Allgemeinen.

author: 6ef29208a69b56f2aee85da3aaf07d2d
content: The FPS in some parts of the game drops significantly for no reason. Lowering the resolution helps.

author: 436d14be92105bce97f40319e5b42650
content: Persona fans are used to long narrative and strategically choosing what to do in the game. However, in this case, we have a pretty short game (for Persona standards). The game duration should be around 40-50 hours, but the story is really good and worth its attention. For casual players, it is recommended (specially if you played P5 vanilla) a lot of fun and the combat system is fair enough. Adding new characters that have good characterization and development. Something to add... the music is awesome. The new additions and the remastered versions of the old ones are just better. Anyway, long story short, the game has a good narrative, good game-play along with the awesome music, and amazing addition of new characters.

author: 7a5a1b06212457c9bc4d6da004941f7e
content:
페르소나4를 기점으로 PC 이식되기 시작한 페르소나의, 계보적으로 가장 최신이라 할 수 있는 작품이다. 난 이미 콘솔로 즐겨본 만큼 상세히 쓰다간 스포라도 할거 같고, 간략한 소개 정도만 쓰려고 한다.

페르소나 5의 이야기 이후의 시간대에서, 다소 변화한 게임 시스템이 독특한 게임이다.
소위 '무쌍계' 라고 하는 무수히 많은 적들을 상대로 호쾌한 액션을 즐기는 장르를 가져와, 페르소나와 여신전생 특유의 약점찌르기 및 총공격을 위주로 하는 상성싸움, 소위 가위바위보에 가깝다.
하나하나의 적에 대한 약점찌르기와 대처가 주인 만큼 무쌍류라는 의미로 보자면 생각보다 적이 적고 전투의 템포가 다른 편이다. 그러니 무쌍계 게임의 팬으로써 이 게임을 구매하려는 사람들은 약간 핀트가 다름을 느낄 수도 있겠지. 하지만 다소 도장찍기가 되어 있는 무쌍계 판을 생각하면 생각보다 신선하다는 점은 분명하다.

캠핑카를 집 삼아 씹덕이면 이름 한번쯤은 들어봤을 지역을 괴도단이 떠돌며 이야기를 진행하는 점에 있어선, 말하자면 워킹 시뮬레이터라고 할 면모도 있다. 무슨 대단한 그래픽적 디테일이나 상호작용이 있는 맵은 아니지만, 지역마다의 유사 체험으로 느낄 만큼의 '분위기' 정도는 있어 나쁘지 않다. 이런 저런 이야기 많았던 페르소나 5의 커뮤(코옵)지만, 신규 추가된 동료들의 이야기도 썩 나쁘지 않았고, 이 게임에서 다뤄지는 기존 캐릭터들의, 말하자면 애프터 서비스도 괜찮았다.

그리고 으레 PC로 이식된 일본계열의 게임이 보이곤 하는 발적화도 진행 동안은 눈에 띄지 않았다. 이전 제작사는 다르지만 즐겼던 갓이터3가 초반 패치 전후엔 완전 개판이었던걸 생각하면 감개무량할 따름이다. 약간의 크래시 현상은 있었는데, 1.2 버전 패치에서 완전히 사라졌고 1.22까지 패치를 계속 이어오고 있으니 신경쓸 만큼은 아니지 싶다.

시리즈는 5편까지 나왔고, 말하자면 본가인 여신 전생 시리즈까지 포함하자면 긴 세월을 포함한 게임이니만큼, 이 게임의 구매자 태반은 오랜 팬이겠지. 이 게임은 나쁘지 않다. 타인과의 유대가 핵심인 시리즈인 만큼 그 유대를 맺은 캐릭터들의 후일담은 썩 나쁘지 않은 경험이었다. 좋게 말하면 익숙한, 다르게 말하면 지루한 가위바위보 턴제였던 기존 전투와는 달리 약점을 찌르고 총공격으로 휙휙 넘어가는 스크램블만의 독특한 게임 템포도 재밌다. 시리즈 중에서 액션과 강렬한 색감이 특히나 진보한 페르소나 5 기반의 그래픽이기에 더더욱 그렇기도 하고. 

가격대는 솔직히 비싸긴 하다만, 이런 소위 씹덕겜들 가격이 다 뭐 이런거 아니겠나.
비슷한 시기에 PC 이식에 들어간 아이돌마스터도 그렇고, 비싸다 싶으면 세일 때 사면 그만이기도 하다. 씹덕겜들이 할인에 존나게 인색하긴 하다만 언젠가는 세일 하겠지. 안그래?

author: b77ef6859d985ec29134685cdccbc8ca
content:
A noteworthy addition to the Persona franchise, it blends Musou combat with Turn based gameplay really well. It's thanks to Megaten's Press Turn System, which solidifies the foundation of Stikers/Scramble combat.

In addition, I highly recommend using the Persona Legacy BGM DLC (especially if you have played previous Persona games or familiar with their OST) if you have it, you can enable in game on system>config>game settings>change battle music. This made non major boss fights/grinding more enjoyable and refreshing for me since you have to go through quite abit of those engagements whilst playing the game.

author: fdf3e0c3664a512daa3001c8e1678214
content:
Note: I would only buy this game if you've either played Persona 5 or watched the anime https://anilist.co/anime/99693/PERSONA5-the-Animation/ (see side links on the bottom left for where to watch). It will throw you right into the world of Persona 5 without much introduction to any of the existing cast.

This game was pretty darn good. There quality voice acting and plenty of dialogue (corny at times, but that's just how it is - and I love it). The musou-style of combat was pretty nice and felt a bit more complex than other musou-style games I've played as there are a few systems to master. Understanding these systems will be the key to your success: Character swapping, one more's, dodging, weaknesses, and technical attacks will all need to be understood to really feel like you're in control and not bashing your head against a wall feeling like you're not doing any damage.

I definitely recommend this and had a great time playing. I'm going to go back though and finish up New Game+ now and get the rest of the achievements.

author: 04e319a017e8563799bff5b2f3ea7542
content:
Unfortunately, this game isn't very good. Instead of Palaces in P5 or P5R you go into jails, which are all essentially the same thing. They often even have the same music. The fighting system is fine I guess, but it devolves into spamming arts. The biggest problem with this game is that it's just repetitive and not fun. There isn't any social links or much of a game outside of the jails. I had to force myself to finish it.

If you like warriors style games and P5 then check this out, however do not expect much in the way of P5 aside from superficial aesthetics.

author: 5545f75e011c54b79ad0c09452999c65
content:
So I really like the Persona series and am planning on getting SMT Nocturne when it comes to steam. I will fully admit that I am biased toward this series and ATLUS in general. So instead of listing reasons you should get this game I will do a Pro/Con/Depends list.

Pros: 
- Killer Soundtrack
- Fun Hack & Slash Gameplay
- Good Variety of Characters and Playstyles
- Persona fusing has been changed. It now shows specific recipes for personas, even personas you don't yet own.   

Cons:
- Combat/Combos/Abilities take time to learn and you will be going back to the tutorial menu when you forget which combo casts Zio. 
- No Igor or Akechi :(
- I'll admit I'm struggling with coming up with cons, but I recommend looking at my next list to see if this game is right for you.

Depends:
- Direct sequel to Persona 5. This leaves a nice place for players to return to, but could alienate new players. It is worth mentioning that I tried my best to notice when the game made reference to the original P5 and it wasn't super frequent.
- Shorter than most RPGs. My first run was ~55  hours. Keep in mind I did every side quest I could.

Hopefully this encouraged you to get the game. Overall, very fun hack and slash game that I had a hell of a time with. Don't go in looking for something super groundbreaking. Instead go in for a fun, flashy and fantastical game where a bunch of kids go on a road trip. Takes some getting used to, but if my goldfish brain can have fun with this game, so can you.

author: a5ec48d511595bb28ee0d24060e4324a

content:
I will say to get this game if you played the first persona 5 and enjoy the characters and style. It really feels like a natural sequel to the first game which was super nice to come back to characters I loved. I will say the gameplay is super iffy.

At times, its a super fun and competent action rpg. The whole "warriors" type games are not my cup of tea but they did a good job making the whole game feel like its not made by that company.

However they didn't do a good job explaining mechanics of how the action and jrp persona battle mixes in. The game can either be painfully easy or huge diffuculty spikes of trial and error which isn't fun.

Plus the whole thing where characters you dont use dont level up with you until late game is really bad design. They did it in the last game and Royal so I don't understand why they don't do it for this game.

However its a really good game, I just feel the style of game should had either tweaked it a bit more to fit it, or just stayed as a turn based jrpg.

also put persona 5 on steam and switch you cowards.

author: 3a319d115326547b9f24438b3863fb1c
content:
Solid Stories. Passable Port. Overall: I'm having fun with no Frustration. [i]-=Recommended=-[/i]

KB+Mouse can Rebind and it works fine. Mouse Camera control has some Acceleration but not a big deal for me. Good thing is you can disable the Auto-Camera (love this option! but it's still have some Auto Center Camera on some Action which is pretty lame)

Note: Lots of dialogue. could be boring for player who hates long down-time. but you can skip/Fast-FWD most of them.

[update: 21 hours-in]
The game screen constantly filled with Chat bubbles, Onomatopoeia (comic effect words), and many type of Anime/Comic Effects. it's quite Messy. I know it's their Theme but it's too messy IMO.

Gameplays: 
[u]Combat[/u]:
Hard to tell when to dodge (partly cause how messy the effects on screen)
You fight with a Party of 1-4 Characters and can switch between them on-the-fly.
But in the end, it boils down to Spamming - Press Action when prompt and Repeat. pretty bare bone.

[u]RPG aspect[/u]:
You can collect Persona and Fusion them to evolve (somewhat like Pokémon) and they have 8 skill slots. They learn more skills and get stronger stats as they leveled up. Main Character (Joker) can switch between several Persona of choice while the Companions have their own fixed Persona.

The item system is overall pretty awful. the game have small list of Weapons, Armors, Accessories, Consumables. it's a pain to run around looking for the item stores and Vending machine, wasting time and 0 fun.

[u]Summary[/u]
The Story each chapter feel pretty much the same. 
1. You go to one town.  2. There's a bad guy. 3. You talk to a few NPC to collect information so you can go to next step. Buy items around the town. 
4. Enter the Jail (Palace dimension) to beat up Mobs, Collect a few orbs.
5. Come back out to fight 1 mini-boss.
6. Go back to fight Main boss. and Move on to next town.
7. Repeat 1-7 for several chapters

The game is getting Dull over time. but the Style does make some good screenshots too bad there's no Photo Mode. 

Not a great / Not terrible game. Passable Port.

author: 39fbe59dec0555bf81be9d37c7042a21
content:
TLDR: Is Persona 5 Strikers good persona game? Not really. Is it a good action game with light rpg elements? It is, but it caters to specific audience. More below.

Long story short, I have played this game for a while and got bored after second dungeon. I will try to explain what I liked what I didn't like.

1. What I liked:

-The storyline, the characters and the plot are still good. It's one of the most enjoyable aspects. Of course, you no longer need to grind out stats and there are no new romancable characters, your choices barely matter too, if at all. But, it's good for what it is.
-I enjoyed the music, although Royal stuck in my ears more.
-The action can be meaty and fun, but as you progress through the game, it can get repetitive, since it's all about striking weakness, all out attacks and murdering hordes of shadows. 
-I commend being able to translate persona 5 and persona 5 royal combat into action. It works well.
-It is very skill based, what it means is that if you learn a pattern of a boss, you can solo one yourself, similar to Hollow Knight or Devil May Cry.

2. What I didn't like:
-The new dungeons are ... well, a bit meh. Exploration is honestly tiresome and unlike Persona 5, getting around without fighting is not easy. It's not rewarding either. The items barely matter, same with most personas. 
-Being able to come and go into the Dungeon with 0 consequences. I mean, I get the idea, but it only makes the game feel more shallow. It is necessary evil though, as you burn through most of your SP easily.
-Fusing new personas is not fun or rewarding. Most of the time all you need is being able to get a weakness of every enemy. The only exception to that is when you are alone and the enemy strikes your weakness. Healing is better done through allies.
-Bosses are wayyyyy too tanky, as far as I am concerned. I mean, Persona 5 Royal bosses were tough, but fun for the most part (obligatory horrible Okumara's boss fight). They required more strategy than whacking a boss for 20 minutes and dodging their attacks or healing.
-There is no time management. All the dungeons are done in one day and the story won't progress if you don't do them that very day. It maybe fun for some, but not for me.

So, I am not sure how to rate this game. For those who liked Persona 5 for it's rpg elements, plot, characters, they may not enjoy the action focused style. On the other hand, if you like that kind of thing, like dynasty warriors, you will probably enjoy it.

Because of that, I give it two marks, depending on what you are looking for:

a) 6+/10 for those looking for something more meaningful than pure combat.
b) 8+/10 for those who like this kind of thing.

author: a75119c03f4a573d8e28146ecc0e7682
content:
I bought it again despite already having it on Switch thanks to the sale, and I must admit the 60FPS my gaming laptop can muster makes the game feel suprisingly different in a good way!

The game already means a lot to me as the whole setting and idea pretty much broke the chains I had been bound upon in my head by myself during the ongoing pandemic. It even learned me how to control my subconcious mind better along the way.

The gameplay itself is solid. Makes good use of the Persona system and translates it to real-time combat rather than turn-based and even the music remixes are made to complement the change perfectly well! It also just plays a lot better than most Warriors games, with more focus on story to balance out the often repetitive gameplay of these kinda games. It builds more upon a world and its exploration, rather than the 'Select a battle' style most Warriors games have nowadays.

Want a game that can hit you in the feels, and have a amazing soundtrack to go with it along with many other things to love in a RPG, then give this game a go for sure. Switch, Steam, both are good in their own ways.

Oh, and finally: Persona 3 (FES), Persona 5 Royal or just the whole Persona series for Switch and Steam when? I'm not asking this like many others are at every single chance to do so, this is even my first time doing it like this. Persona as a series, despite having watched more playthroughs than actually having played it, still really helped me understand myself more as the games show the way people work very well. Persona 4 touches upon acceptance of yourself and your bad sides, Persona 5 Strikers then goes deeper into that idea and instead goes for the way people become due to traumas or other events they might've gone through in the past and can't let go off.

So another point: If you feel you're struggling with these things, give the series a go (Or a look) and don't take everything at face value. The games have a weird way of showing off the Human mind, but it's actually not all that far-fetched if you really think about.

author: 82cdaf0c8faa54969d039065babce5a9
content:
Jako osoba nieposiadająca PlayStation bardzo cieszyłem się z premiery Persony 5 (jeszcze) Scramble na Switcha - czekając na wersję zachodnią nie spodziewałem się, że uda się ja złapać nawet na PC. Chociaż pierwotnie byłem zawiedziony, że zamiast P5R wydane na Steam zostało P5S, to ostatecznie jestem bardzo zadowolony z takiego rozwiązania. Przeszedłem zwykłą Personę 5, a Strikers jest jej kontynuacją, dzięki czemu zyskałem jeszcze więcej historii niż w przypadku wydania Royal.

Gra jest praktycznie połowę krótsza niż zwykłe odsłony Persony i ciężko ocenić czy to dobrze, czy źle. Główne gry z serii teoretycznie wydają się za długie, lecz nie nużą, ponieważ ilość aktywności i jakości fabuły nie doprowadzają do takiego uczucia. Tutaj wyważono idealnie długość rozgrywki względem zmian jakie poczyniono w spin-offie, bowiem czuć, że P5S jest okrojone ze sztandarowych elementów serii. Ciężko w taki sam sposób zżyć się z postaciami, gdy nie istnieje tutaj system "confidant", brakuje również pobocznych aktywności czy rozwoju postaci. Walka "w końcu" jest dynamiczna i chociaż na początku myślałem, że to będzie duży plus to po chwili zacząłem tęsknić za jRPGowym systemem głównych odsłon, który chociaż statyczny - paradoksalnie wywoływał więcej emocji, a konkretne walki zapadały bardziej w pamięć.

I chyba największym problemem tej gry jest istnienie głównych odsłon, ponieważ przy tej grze nie czuje się tego samego. Brakuje wielu elementów, które spajały te gry w całość i tworzyły niezapomniany klimat. Podróż po Japonii również wydawała się świetnym pomysłem, lecz każde z miejsc dostało za mało czasu i nie zapadło przez to w pamięć jak lokacje w Tokio.

Udźwiękowienie jak zwykle świetne, chociaż utwory z P5 w zwykłych i zremiksowanych wersjach wywoływały najwięcej emocji. Gra działa dobrze, lecz znowu brakuje 144fps. Nie miałem problemów ze stabilnością działania tego portu.

Wcześniejsze akapity sugerują niezadowolenie z tego co otrzymałem, lecz oczywiście jest inaczej. Bardzo się cieszę, że wyszła kontynuacja P5, bawiłem się świetnie i podtrzymuję radość związaną z pojawieniem się tej gry na PC. Nowe postacie pasują idealnie, fabuła nie nuży, kilka mechanik mogłoby trafić też do głównych odsłon, a powstanie tego spin-offa to bardzo dobry krok.

ATLUS i SEGA bardzo otworzyły się na komputery, więc P3F i P5R na Steam to prawdopodobnie kwestia czasu. Oby.

author: ddb8aae1d83b5180b20e4c7675ea2fca
content:
Persona 5 enfin sur STEAM !! Oui mais...pas le bon malheureusement. 

Strikers étant la suite de Persona 5 (et non de la version Royal attention) les nouveaux arrivants peuvent être perdu et le jeu ne nous rappelle bien les événements du jeu précédent donc garde aux spoils si vous êtes là pour l'intrigue. 

Contrairement à P5 Stikers est un mélange d'action RPG et vient prendre les bases de Dinasty Warrior tout en gardant l'identité Persona. Il n'y a pas de contrôle de base comme dans un musou ni à grind nos personnages pendant 15 ans. 
La difficulté du jeu est assez inégale, le début est assez exigeant avec des ennemis bien plus fort que vous et ne laisse pas de place à l'erreur. Il faudra faire attention à chaque combat d'avoir le bon type de Persona sinon la déconvenue est très vite arrivé pour vous et compagnons.

Pour ce qui est de l'histoire en tant que telle elle reste plaisante à suivre mais reprend le propos de P5 sans trop rien n'y apporter au final. Compter une bonne 30h si voulez terminer l'intrigue avec quelques quêtes annexes (attention certaines ne peut être faite que dans certaines villes) sachant qu'elles ne sont pas toutes à faire pour le 100% (au moins 50 pour le succès). C'est tout de même dommage de ne pas revoir les personnages secondaires dans cet opus... 

Côté bande son rien à dire, Atlus nous régale encore avec une OST incroyable et de très bonnes reprises du jeu de base. 

Donc au final est-ce que je recommande Strikers : OUI pour ceux qui ont fait l'opus d'avant et qui veulent continuer l'aventure avec les Voleurs Fantômes et pour qui le côté musou ne dérangent pas sinon pour les nouveaux arrivants de la série passé votre chemin et aller plutôt sur Persona 5 Royal si vous avez une PS4/PS5, après 300hr il est devenu TRÈS facilement mon jeu favoris et venu détrôner tout le monde (sorry Dark Souls) ou bien alors sur Persona 4 Golden dispo aussi sur STEAM

author: 53c926beaeda5796b4cd97411369dd39
content:
Worth it at $40 if you like persona 5.

Strikers is fun and good, it suffers from repetition though. Starting with the good:

Story's relatively straightforward, but good enough to keep you strung along. I'm about two thirds of the way through it, so maybe the last bit will blow me out of the water. If you like road trips and mysteries, you might like it.

Graphics/sound/presentation are all amazing. Nothing takes you out of the game, and the music really serves the fights well. Only issues is that you will hear some soundtracks too many times, and there's no ultrawide support :(

Gameplay is where it gets interesting. Imagine hyrule warriors but every enemy has elemental strengths and weaknesses, and you can collect enemies like pokemon and fuze them into different, stronger fighters (called personas). There's also basic enviromental attacks that do elemental damage. Add switching between characters as well, and the result is good fun. There's an additional amount of depth in technicals, ailments, buffs/debuffs, but you don't really need to focus on them, even in hard mode. 

The problem is that it, like other warrior esc games, it gets repetitive. Boss battles are supposed to freshen it up, but they mostly fight like other enemies but with quicker attacks and bigger health bars. So, you're gonna do a lot of swinging, casting a spell at a weakness, and dodging regardless of the fight, and not much else. It really would benefit with much more emphasis on inflicting technicals/ailments and switching to different personas/party members to deal damage. Then each fight requires using your brain a bit instead of how it currently is. 

Unlike persona 5, there's not much side stuff to do, so there isn't really much to take a break from the combat. Side quests boil down to doing combat challenges, fetching items for party members, or both. A lot of them require you backtrack through previous dungeons too. This game is really only playable for the main story.

It's still fun and I enjoy it, can't see it being worth $60 though. Wait for a good sale.

author: 1c1e4551864d53f5acd3d461d3bb0472
content:
I have beaten this game twice. While it may not have been on the steam version, I am working on that right now.
Persona 5/Royal is my favorite game of all time. So when Atlus released this, I was exited as hell. I will now say a few things my sister has asked me about it (Also a persona fan)
Worthy Sequal? Yes
As good as original or Royal? Close but no
Worth it to play on anything its available on? Some better than others but overall yes.

Now onto the actual spoiler-free Review.
While it is different from the Turn-Based battles of the series, it's still a very good game. As I have played some hack and slash games, While I may be a bit biased on this decision, Persona 5 Strikers is my favorite of that genera due to the characters, story, and overall feeling of the fighting. Its nice to have different abilities and still have it feeling like the main series. I still highly recommend playing P5/R before playing P5S if you can.
The controls are easy to understand. I personally played with a controller as thats what I use for hack and slash and persona games in general. (Xbox One and Switch Pro Controller for more background) While I dont think its impossible to play with a keyboard and mouse, it would be harder as you only have 8 ways to move. But play how you want to or have the ability to play with.
Overall, Recommended. With a few aceptions. If you have played or watched a full playthrough of P5/R.

author: 8e58194ed69a5a08a983f744482b197a
content:
- Persona 5 Strikers is an amazing follow-up to Persona 5/P5R. The Dynasty Warriors combat works so much better than expected, and combines perfectly with Persona's normal turn-based RPG mechanics. Unfortunately, there is not any connection to Royal's added content, but it doesn't detract from the game. 

- The story is really good, with all the new characters feeling right at home in the world. I really enjoyed traveling around Japan with the Phantom Thieves. The story is shorter than P5R's, but can still last a good 50-60 hours if you plan to do everything. 

- Of course, the music is perfect, as always with anything Persona. The music has shifted towards a rock theme instead of jazz, and it works perfectly. The entire OST is incredible and gets stuck in your head for weeks after you finish. We've also been blessed with several new vocal tracks from Lyn.

- I highly recommend this game to anyone who played and loved the original Persona 5. If you haven't played it, it's still a fun game, but you really need the prior knowledge to get the full experience.

author: 398058c7960750b0994e43c2d07f64ad
content:
I really enjoyed Persona 5 Strikers. At first I didn't expect it to work out in this format but in the end it was really fun. The ability to change characters and fight with different styles helps keep the combat a little bit fresh. You might get bored of repetitive combat but it goes by fast. Getting the bonus BGM from the deluxe edition helped with fights to add more variety too but that is more money to be spent.

I did not have any crashing problems as I played like other people seem to have had, the most recent patch might have fixed that. Some of the CG cut scenes in the beginning had some crusty frame rate but towards the end I noticed it got better. Gameplay was smooth the entire time. 

I paid $76 USD for the deluxe edition. I felt like it was worth it for myself, as I am becoming increasingly invested in the persona games. If you're just a casual fan that is not super invested then maybe getting it at $40 or $50 might feel better for you.

It is a direct sequel to Persona 5 though, so you might want to play that beforehand. Currently, Persona 5 / Royal is only available on the playstation. Hopefully Atlus will port Persona 5 to PC later on.

I have beaten the game and all I say is Atlus has done it again. They brought us a epic game called Persona 5 not once not twice but three times and all of them are great Persona 5 Great game and Great combat system, Persona 5 Royal same game as Persona 5 but with more to story and new combat types, and Persona 5 Scramble (Strikers) completely new combat system and still nailed it.

author: 7dda51c92aac597a87e8b1fdc0d8af72
content:
Spoiler free.

I think its been stated multiple times, but you MUST play Persona 5 or Persona 5 Royal before you play this game. Well, I shouldn't say "must" but the impact and fan service in this title is so spectacular if you've played the first entry in the series. Without it, you will 100% be missing out, both on specific story sections, and character (further) development.

Let it also be noted that this game appears to follow Persona 5 more than Persona 5 Royal, due to missing added characters from P5R and specific portraits pulled from P5 rather than P5R. P5R also had a couple story changes, but nothing that should make you want to play P5 over P5R. Pick either one, play it, and then play this amazing game. Don't let the Musou battle system scare you away. This battle system is miles better than anything Dynasty Warriors has done since its creation.

+ The Battle system is fun and skillful. Each character has abilities to learn and unlock and a specific playstyle. Each playstyle can be extremely useful or largely abused (against you) depending on which and what type of enemy you are fighting
+ Tons and tons of Personas for our Protagonist, just like in P5/P5R
+ Throbbing King of Desire returns. If you're not sure about this reference, avoid looking it up in public
+ Great story. Great Characters. Same feeling and writing style from P5/P5R
+ Same great music
+ Post game content
+ Returning entity from P3 (don't look it up)

- Save Often. Crashes from time to time/infinite loading screens. I think the 1.02 patch fixed most of this (at the time of posting this review 4/27/21) as I was having much less crashing upon it's implementation, but not entirely resolved.

author: 6f60fe4d1e8b57a19397667322b142c7
content:
Truly remarkable continuation of beloved Persona 5.
Strikers is a direct sequel to the last entry of Persona series made by Atlus in terms of plot. However the genre this time is different which mostly reflects in combat, which has moved from classic turn-based style to ripping and tearing dozens of enemies at once.
The game is as stylish as its predecessor, but not as complex and long.
The characters we all know and love remain such throughout the whole playthrough. In addition we get two completely new companions, who are an excellent addition to the famous cast. Persona 5 Strikers is a roller coaster of emotions from start to finish.
Definitely recommend this product to anyone who's familiar with the series and is open to some innovations to the formula

author: 1f7bd7a4f0275d069bc63a1d1f6f2949
content:
Great take on a warriors style game that exudes Persona's style and charm. This game will definitely be confusing story-wise if you haven't played the original Persona 5 seeing as there are plenty of references to it's predecessor.

*Slight Story Spoilers*

The game follows the same story structure as Persona 5, and will leave any players who played the previous vanilla Persona or Royal with a bit of déjà vu  by the time you get to the climax and ending. And of course, the story uses the very traditional character trope where there is an abnormal teammate who does not know who or what they are (Used in both Persona 4 Golden with 2 characters, and with Morgana in Persona 5). If these story beats do not deter you, and you like the warriors style combat, you'll enjoy this game overall as I did.

author: 69d2e6ba7be858258c3eded093447008
content:
It's Persona 5's sequel - Lite Edition.

The gameplay is very much like Persona 5's, with a lot of the same. The game is still split in 2 sections, the Metaverse and the  real world. 

The gameplay in the Metaverse is mostly the same as Persona 5's, except for the combat. You'll navigate around, hide in corners and ambushing enemies the same, but instead of turn-based combat it's a Dynasty Warriors style. The fights don't span the entire map like other entries in the genre, but are instead in small, restricted areas. Most of the Persona fight aspects are still there, using Personas to attack, taking advantage of elements, all out attacks, and the like. Ambushes against weaker enemies usually ends up with an immediate All-Out-Attack and winning immediately, though tougher fights do take more time as expected. While fighting, you have 3 teammates with you, which you can control both in fights and while exploring the dungeons. Each teammate has a unique playstyle too.

In the real world, things are very dialed back compared to the full Persona games. There are no Confidants/Social Links, and most of the confidants from 5 are gone, but not unmentioned. There are no romance options, either. There's no stats to build. There's no time limit on completing the dungeons, you are free to leave and re-enter them as much as you want as opposed to progressing to the next day as is usual. Most of your time in the real world is spent either shopping for items, completing tasks for rewards like new weapons, or just doing story-related tasks such as getting info on the next dungeon boss.

The story itself I have not completed, but from what I have played it is very enjoyable. The game is very much a sequel to Persona 5, the original version, not Royal. It's nice to come back to the Phantom Thieves.

Overall, while the Metaverse side is quite fun and familiar, the real world side feels lacking and leaves me wanting more. However, I'd still recommend this game. It's still a fun game and the team is as enjoyable as ever, but playing the game makes me want to revisit Persona 5.

author: 699ab6e1e53b54bd963b1dfbd77b5969
content:
A fantastic continuation of the P5 story, though you'll need to have played the original Persona 5 (on PS3) or Royal (on PS4/5) to understand what is going on at all -- as of writing, there's no native PC versions of those games. so maybe hold off on buying this until you find a way to play those.
Story-wise, the game is more of the same, at least at a glance. Go into Metaverse and change the hearts of villains. However, there are a few twists and turns regarding it this time around that significantly change how it feels, but I will not spoil the specifics.
In terms of gameplay, well, this is an action game, not a turn-based RPG. Despite that, it's an excellent translation of traditional Persona gameplay into this new genre. However, you need to be ready to actually rely on melee attacks and items instead of just spamming spells this time around, because the game will drain your SP like there's no tomorrow otherwise.
As far as social links are concerned, well, there are none. This is understandable, since you are supposed to already know the characters well enough for this not to be necessary. There are still a few optional sidequests that offer little bits and pieces of character development here and there, but for the most part the game is focused on the main story -- that's not to say that no development occurs [i]during[/i] said main story, though: it certainly does, especially for the new characters.
Also, Sophie very cute.

author: d69a5aa0da2350afb6b3908f8ed31c61
content:
Persona 5 royal a été pour moi une très bonne experience puisque c'était mon premier persona. Il était tout à fait normal que je me prenne l'opus Persona 5 Strikers.

SYNOPSIS:
Nos héros ( Morgana et joker ) reviens à Tokyo plusieurs mois après les événements de P5. Ils retrouvent donc toute la troupe des voleurs fantôme pour passer des vacances d'été qui bien-sur, se verra interrompu par de nouveaux environnements ( ben oui Atlus nous pond pas un jeu pour ce gratter les boules sur la plage et bouffer des glaces xD ). De nouveaux cas de métanoia font apparition et les voleur fantôme sont sous les feu des projecteurs. Vous allez devoir enquêter sur qui tire les ficelles. 

GRAPHISME:
+ Franchement c'est pas ouf ( c'est dégueulasse ) mais la direction artistique est toujours aussi magique ( les graphisme ne 
   fait pas un jeu ). 
- Cela dit il y'a pas mal d'aliasing même quand vous mettez l'option aliasing " ON "

BANDE SON:
+ une érection légendaire !!!! ( j'aime beaucoup le coté jazzy ) surtout que des morceaux originaux ont été remaké à la 
   sauce guitare électrique.

GAMEPLAY:
+ Comme dans un jeu MUSO, vous faites des combos à la différence prés qu'il faudra prendre en compte la faiblesse des 
   ennemie comme dans le jeu de base en changeant de persona qui se fait de manière très fluide !
- Le bouton d'action Y ( je joue avec une manette xbox ) est sollicité pour beaucoup de chose et peut vous faire effectuer 
   des actions dont vous ne vouliez peut être pas ! ( je sais pas si c'est français ce que je viens d'écrire ).

Conclusion:
De mon avis personnel, il manque un petit quelque chose que Persona 5 avait mais bon.
Fan de PERSONA FONCEZ !!! sinon pour les autres personnes qui ne connaisse pas trop, je vous conseille de faire Persona 5 avant tout car le jeu est assez bavard ( un JRPG quoi ) et ne plaira pas à tout le monde étant donné qu'il est assez spécial.

Si vous voulez un format vidéo la voici : https://youtu.be/ZrAn_Hj7DP0

Merci de m'avoir lu !

author: 67e9fd1d6d5a5608a76df93f29528aa5
content:
Eh, I don't know. It's Persona alright, but they took out the turn-based nature and the multiple different endings, and kept everything else. Yeah, fusions, cards, status effects, and type weakness/strength are still in here... not to its credit.

The levels, despite having shadows patrolling around, are just sorta... Empty and uncompelling- there's nothing to search for unless you want some cards or sellable junk. If something spots you, you're forced into a battle unless you run away fast enough, and it's always a group of enemies that you'll Yakuza-fight away with whichever character you've chosen to play as.

Here's the bad thing, though. It's a hard game unless you set it to easy. Why? Literally in the first Jail, you'll find out that the characters are all squishy as hell and get afflicted with status effects constantly. It's extremely annoying, and they'll all usually die while you're trying to take something down. It made me realize that the turn-based system is REALLY needed if you have all these systems in play, cause otherwise you get this game where everyone gets randomly spammed with whatever until they die. The swarming makes it impossible to counteract, too. Oh, and there's tanky damage-sponge enemies aswell.

author: 516321e45a575cce86cd22afb518931f
content:
P5皮無雙(?) 齁勝

更新於2021.06.28
目前打第4輪，第一次打risky，前3輪分別以easy, normal, hard各通關一輪。於第4輪中途完成所有成就來發文更新
(P5S也是我第一款steam全程就達成的遊戲，特別紀念一下)



=======================   以下可能有雷請警慎觀看  ==========================



這是款P5皮無雙--從PV看起來是這樣，可是就個人體感後一段時間後發現，應該要倒過來，是無雙皮P5才對：屬性相剋、總攻擊、ShowTime等因素，都是掌控要點(如果沒有努力農面具的話更要注意)，特別是到第4輪正式開始risky更是如此，尤其是屬性相剋。
遊戲體驗上，因為需同時注意屬性、ShowTime值、旋轉視角與敵人數量等等，因此畫面上剛開始可能不是很習慣，需要點時間適應。也由於跟光榮合作，相較於較為知名的三國無雙，本片的無雙可能沒這麼強烈--或者該說是開始沒這麼無腦割草(個人有買真三7、大蛇3U，那個無腦割草感在這邊可說真的有差距)，需要成長到後期，如果人格面具養成有方，才能較為感覺出割草爽感。
劇情上，接續自P5無印後，因此對於無印P5的人來說，很多劇情大綱是不清楚的，因此推薦想入坑的朋友先玩過一輪P5或P5R了解一些名詞解釋：主角團們的劇情、人格面具、怪盜團、殿堂等等(個人P5無印通關1輪、P5R通關2輪於第3輪中暫停了)。由於怕涉及暴雷，因此不多加透露，可以說明的是「對P5粉絲」來說，作後續「fan disc」，個人認為絕對是及格。劇情上個人最為喜歡主角群之一的善吉(Wolf)的個人線，做為一個對家人的愛與責任，碰上身為警察的正義，並且在這中間遇到的掙扎，可以說描寫得令人感到驚喜。善吉的腳色存在，也對怪盜團的成員是個正向的回饋--在行俠仗義的同時，當仗義不是完全如他們所想的「邪惡」，那你們的作為又是如何？透過與某BOSS之間的問答，加深身為玩家的思考。
獎盃成就由於玩至第4輪才正式拿到最後一個獎盃「BAND 99」，已經破百小時(第2、3輪跳過劇情，因此時間較短)，因此個人玩法偏向是農系玩法，也就是將人格面具農好、武器防具都需農到該點時最強裝，才會去推BOSS。也因此，在打第4輪開始時，個人可以負責任說，risky與hard絕對有很高的難度差異，因此沒有農到5維99的面具之前，較為不建議開啟(個人手殘黨，要主角HP/SP 999 + 五維99無弱點面具皆出才開啟第4輪)；當然，也許有人將黑暗靈魂當無雙割草，這類玩家我在此一拜。

曾經，有一個少年，潛入大眾的無意識之海，並反抗毀滅；
曾經，有一個少年，潛入大眾的無意識之海，使迷霧散去；
曾經，有一個少年，潛入大眾的無意識之海，盜走了世界。

從P3到P5，ATLUS用不同的角度，敘說不同段精彩的故事。謝謝ATLUS，讓我有機會玩到這麼好玩的遊戲。最後拜託P5跟P3上steam一下好嗎QQ，不求P5R或P3F，上一下無印也好OTZ。

Kinda late on this since i last purchased but since the game had a patch. I wouldn't know if how much of my criticisms have changed. I think that this game is pretty neat, I wouldn't have had put as many hours as i have put into it if I didn't enjoy it. 

Parts of the game could have been better, though a lot of my criticisms have been already addressed by a lot of people though I'll say that how leaving the dungeon and coming back to restore hp and more importantly sp is kinda dumb that it just doesn't heal automatically, I guess its to have the feeling of during new game plus or whatever the player can feel like they didn't need to come back and rejuvenate but doesn't really feel like its needed aside from possibly needing to stock up on items which could just be done anyways.

The story is fine I liked parts of it can't say I'm too much of a fan though even if it is just mostly dumb fun, I like some of the new characters but that's about it. 

The game would crash on me a unusual amount of times for almost no explainable reason, I detected a pattern some of the time with like traveling between the velvet room and back or like leaving the game on in the background for a realllllly long time and then it would crash after some transition back to the real world, but other times i really couldn't explain why like during story events, so I just got used to save somewhat often since it barely takes that much time.

I got a unusual amount of time trying to assemble some heavy hitting personas (even if lucifer is just the best for dealing with large groups) and figuring out a lot of the different combos that come with those personas and even different party members, its all built pretty well. In the case of joker though being able to switch out to a persona that nulls or absorbs a attack was pretty satisfying though it also kinda feels like there's not really a reason not to freeze time to null a attack instead of like dodging or something, due to how most attacks don't really move when you freeze time and select a different persona, aside from some attacks acting during that time but barely ever happens. I think if a sequel or a different SMT spin off as there could be a lot to expand on here gameplay wise. 

If you like this series there's not really a reason to not get the game but just gonna say I'd wait for a discount because despite all the good I don't think its worth 60 bucks, and I especially don't think it was worth 70 bucks even if I got to access it 3 days early and some music dlc/extras which in all honesty ain't much : P (Or you could just buy it anyways). ~~I'm sure I'll complain about the price of things more as soon as nocturne hd comes out~~

author: e7889f03848950cc86496ba5564fca9f
content: Persona 5 Strikers is still Persona, but instead of Turn based you get Warriors-style hack-n-slash battles. Atlus and Koei really made this game work amazingly, perfectly translating the persona 5 battles into warriors style. The game just as stylish and the writing is just as good, if not better then Royals. All the new music and remixs feel great and unique while still feeling the same. Although the game has some issues running on PC, it still runs well enough to play. The Digital Deluxe in-game DLC I find really adds to the game having the older music from the series' past. Although the Deluxe's bonus content is just a unity project, which means you don't get the soundtrack directly as music files. Atlus actually updating this game on PC to make it more stable is great, just wish they'd fix the optimization issues it has.

author: 6a3c6f7722ae555087ce060353ad3d04
content:
I wasn't convinced about an action-based Persona game, but having completed it, I couldn't have asked for a better spin-off.

The game previews show Joker facing off against massive swarms of enemies, giving the wrong impression of a musou-like hack-and-slash. Those big brawls are there, but most mob fights are far more similar to a traditional persona confrontation, against a handful (around 10) enemies with different weaknesses, and we could always pause the action by holding down the right bumper, so it's a real-time with pause action game.

Everything takes place within the summer holidays, so Strikers is shorter in both story and character development, but the main cast is as likable as ever. The timeline is a direct continuation from the original P5, but it's somewhat jarring that the other characters seem to have forgotten their relationship (if any) with Joker. Also, considering that the Phantom Thieves are already embedded in the public consciousness and they're stirring up quite a storm this time, it's awkward to not hear a single peep from their outer circle of confidants. The Mishima we know would have gone ballistic from the stuff they're doing this time around.

Gameplay-wise, party members mostly reprise their original roles in P5. For example, Skull is still a powerhouse in boss fights; he's actually better than Joker until Joker's personas are fully developed. Mona is still a reliable wind hitter / heal battery, and he can transform into his van form to road rage into enemies again and again. Fox's playstyle centers around countering single physical hits with his own, and a few members can imbue their normal hits with their native element, bypassing physical resistance or immunity. Ammo fully regenerates after every fight. Noir (when mastered) can shoot for free, and certain members have ways to replenish mid-fight.

This time around, the Personas and fusion system are a bit more interesting. Having come from the original P3 and P4, it was far too easy in P5 (and P4G) to put any skill into any persona, rendering the nuance in inheritance slot limitations, elemental restrictions, and multiple fusions completely moot. I'm pretty sure everyone's glad that random inheritance is gone, but P5's system made it such that personas without unique skills are only as good as their innate resistances or growth potential i.e. the lower their initial level, the better, so many personas that start at high level, e.g. Messiah and many arcana capstones, are no good. It made no sense.

In this game, there are no personas locked behind DLC, and on top of the 8 skill slots, each persona has up to 3 combo skills that cost no SP or HP. These are innate to each persona, and they restore personas' much-needed identity. For example, want to combo into a free maziodyne? Thor is our only pick. Mara has its own unique combo-only severe fire skill called maralagidyne. Skill cards are still there, but they cannot modify these combo skills, and the best ones only drop at the very end of the post-game of NG+, so if we want good personas earlier on, especially when just going into Risky / Merciless difficulty, fusion is the way to go. There's also no limit on persona stat growth, so if we have the resources, there's no problem enhancing all stats to 99.

Defense passives such as absorb element that are traditionally extremely powerful in turn-based persona, are not very relevant here, because we could just switch to another persona at any time. Enemy moves are clearly telegraphed, and baton pass, showtime, as well as all-out attacks all confer generous iframes, on top of dodge roll. That's before factoring in the omnipotent orb. It's a very interesting change-up in terms of how an end-game persona is supposed to look like.

There's also surprisingly little grind in this game, which is really welcome. I'm sitting at 100% completion with about 100 hours on my file from just playing through normally, and Joker's personas and four other members are already all maxed out. If you want to max everyone's stats with incenses, that will take a few hours fighting the reaper on Merciless difficulty (he drops 75 incenses in one go). Or if you absolutely need some skill card, e.g. any drain card. For that, good luck, because some of the drop rates are really, really low.

As for things that could be improved, a persona's combo moves aren't shown in the compendium, so the only way to know is to try them out or look them up. Analog movement is also really iffy even when using a controller; your character is locked into 8 directions of movement. It's bad when moving around, but surprisingly enough, it doesn't get in the way during fights.

As a separate issue, once Joker's personas get powerful enough, it becomes possible to just endlessly stunlock most bosses by inflicting burn, freeze, or shock, and then literally just doing hassou tobi / vacuum wave over and over with knockdown style and technical adept. That's... a really boring way to play the game, but it's also the fastest way to bring down the boss. That's no good.

Here's to a simultaneous PC release for P6, eh Atlus? Maybe include a difficulty option to disable skill cards for fusion purists.

A few tips for Risky / Merciless difficulty: Start with at least a good persona or two, e.g. Yoshi, and max Navi's HP first, for the defense sections. The best way to spawn treasure demons for money and skill cards is to just move around or change zones when alert level is in the red, after clearing at least one group. They have a distinctive way of scooting around the minimap, and they give off a continuous tinkle even when not in line of sight. In the final dungeon, treasure demons give 750k yen with the money accessory, and you should be able to get one to spawn every 5 minutes or less. Dire shadows are best for bond points. For PP, just keep enhancing and dismissing the same persona over and over.


Bottom line: Don't miss this if you're a persona fan.

author: dbfc3c46be755b87b8c3229678a72d36
content:
因為一開始老成員就全員到齊，所以熟悉每個角色操作花了點時間（平時動作玩得比較少）
熟悉以後就感受到製作組的用心（因為才開始能看清角色的動作(●｀ 艸 ´)
好像。。。看某篇訪談說，一開始是無雙，但是後來開發越來越朝動作遊戲的方向
風格還是很爽快的（怪盜團就是要耍帥！），加上偷襲和弱點攻擊，玩起來很不一樣

面具合成系統簡化，還有升級技能的提示，對我來說方便很多，可以少一些思考的時間
還有在進入下一階段劇情前可以自由進出迷宮這點，
雖然有點不習慣，但是很方便，尤其一開始還不熟悉操作時，對我這種常大量損血耗魔的新手很有幫助
簡化後形成的Band系統也很不錯，對話選項基本不用一直確認攻略了，其實也比較符合動作遊戲的輕快走向。

畫面是沒有Royal強，但是PC版可以調整優化已經很感人
翻譯也很好 連小劇情讀起來都不出戲
作為續作我覺得劇情很可以的 比較輕鬆一點 （新角色都很優！
各地的景點和場景人物細節還是很棒啊
還有Joker廚房的選單和終於穿上去的浴衣。。。製作組你們太懂了(*´艸`*)（雖然廚房只有選單但是沒關係！還有小劇情！）

很用心的續作
收尾借用一下可愛的雙葉的話:
「いい、満足だ。」
