author: 129bcc6ac2db58ca8e157338b6469df0
content: Gameplay wise, probably the best musou ever made? At least that I've played. It's a great playing action RPG that incorporates key elements from the Persona 5 gameplay loop (dungeon crawling/elemental based combat system) elegantly into an Omega Force game. It's Persona 5-2 alright. If you enjoy those characters, there's plenty of content for you to enjoy here.

author: 5b60d56d1f4053b8998560bca69a2402
content: I just beat the game a couple days ago and my only complaint really is that it seemed like it was a little too short.  That and the crashing problem but hopefully they can update it and fix that.  The game crashed for me about 10 times but luckily I didn't lose too much data.  Other than these two things, I really love this game!!  It is so much fun to play.  Just walking around and enjoying the scenery and the music is fun.  The fighting is also fun.  I'm still working on doing the extra stuff so I'm not completely finished yet but I have to say that I think this game is so awesome.  I was looking forward to playing it for the past couple of months and it did not disappoint in the least.  I did play Persona 5 a while ago so I know everyone well and it's really cool that they made this so that we can see them again.  Everyone is just as cool as they were before and there are a couple new characters who are also very cool.  The voice actors are all very good (I use the Japanese).  The graphics are also very good.  It's very shiny and bright.  Overall, I will give this game an A+++++.  I will keep at it until I get everything and then I'll probably start over.  I think it's nice that they give you the option to select your difficulty level.  Next time I play, I will try hard mode.  I don't suppose there is any chance of them making another sequel but I can dream.  Anyway, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes Persona games.  I am a die hard Persona fan and this game rocks!!  It's Showtime.

author: bc0ab28a339f57968ee07e5691e228ec
content:
Alright, so you can enter into this game with no knowledge of the P5(royal not needed) and be fine, you can understand and like this story, it just improves it if you do know.

Game play, first ever muso(idk the spelling of the game) I've played that I feel challenged in from something other than more hp. You actually have to use your brain while playing. Also although not a turnbased game like mainline persona games, it translates the persona turn based elements very well in gun and skills.

Story, so far characters have been great, entire cast is back, with 2 new main characters who are both interesting. Charters feel exactly as they should be and story is intriguing, and it's neat how with the jails it seems each jail owner didn't make it through desire, but trauma, so it makes the villans more interesting.

Also it's basically P52, which is funny because in one of the trailers a 2 almost appeared after the "5" and then "S" butted it out. It is a sequel.

Visuals, Looks like a persona 5 game, but not only that the jail aspects are really polished, not only does each jail seem unique, the quality of the details is amazing. Other muso games seem to not care all that much, but this one just random buildings may have defined shops and markets or be their own specific thing. It's not just slightly different colors. Nor is it copy and paste. Though this does come at a cost. It's not one big map but many decent size areas per jail with load times. I'm on a gaming laptop and can run it at around 1.5 resolution, max graphical settings, 60 frames non combat(btw max cap is 60, so wait till someone mods it for that to change) which lowers to 40 in hectic combat(which I never actually notice, unless i'm looking at my fps number). I say all this is because between each area it's about 10-20 seconds. Which isn't short enough to ignore nor long enough to alt tab. This is my biggest complaint with the game and that's saying a lot. 

All i can say is compared to muso games this is probably the best(although i've heard hyrule warriors was made by the same studio so maybe that's just as good) in every department.

I would recommend buying this game at full price even if not a persona fan. 

Not a giant downside to me but the social life aspect is toned down a lot. P5R was I'd say 25 percent social life, 60 percent game, and 15 percent cutscene, this is 65 percent game, 25 percent cutscene, and 10 percent social life

content:

author: b65f668a600b5c349ea4e608d4bb8456
content: Persona 5 Strikers has no business being as good as it is. For anyone who enjoyed Persona 5, I can't recommend this game enough. It definitely ties more into Persona than the Muso genre as a whole and I was hooked after the first few hours. The new characters are great additions, so much so, I am kind of upset they weren't in the original game to begin with. If you were on the fence, thinking this was going to be a typical button smasher, you're in luck because it's far from that, as it mixes in a lot of Persona elements from it's turn based style of game. It might not be for everyone, but for anyone just looking for another fun adventure with the Phantom Thieves, P5S will not disapoint.

author: ecdaccae4e65549eb9f1ddd9c620b3c8
content: The game is great but not quite the musou game that you'd expect. In this one you'll mostly be exploring dungeons and talking with people in between. You also start combat like in Persona 5 rather than have all enemies on the map at all times, so neither battles nor zones are as big or open as warriors titles usually are. If that sounds good then go for it since this is probably one of Koei's best games, but if you were expecting a traditional warriors game you might be disappointed.

author: 4625d07afb535d8e97354d17c3d206e9
content:
Ein wunderbares Spiel mit einer super Story !
Wer Persona 5 gespielt hat der wird sich gleicht freuen alte Bekannte wiederzusehen .
Die Story knüpft nahtlos an Persona 5 an ( nicht an Persona 5 Royal ) und wird wohlüberlegt und spannend weitererzählt !
Als Fazit würde ich sagen ein guter Kauf für alle die ein gutes Spiel zu schätzen wissen.

author: cb308dd2978e5870821ef10cc9a71aee
content:
Worthy of being called a sequel, the Musou style combat was a refreshing change of pace while still keeping familiar elements from persona games. Really enjoyed the story, characters and new music. Hoping Atlus does more experiments like this in the future, I think the series could do well with it. Definitely play Persona 5/The Royal before starting this, as you will be completely lost on key plot points if you haven't. Other than some crashing issues, this version is fantastic and I'm excited to see the rest of the Persona franchise make its way to PC.

Would die for Sophia and Zenkichi, 11/10

author: 7d3d0ec4cb725f67849243eed0873356
content:
Game doesnt work. Tried putting my setting to fullscreen. Got my first crash as soon as i start new game. What's worse is that after you force quit the application, you can't even start the game up without a black screen to change the game back to windowed. If someone has a fix for this, please help. Otherwise I definitely cannot recommend this game at all on PC

EDIT: I finally got it working after I uninstalled it, and deleted all my P5S files from %appdata%.
If it weren't for the issues listed above, this game is definitely fun to play if you enjoy any of the musou games. Its kind of a mix between something like Kingdom Hearts and the Warrior series. However, based on the fact that I cannot play this game in fullscreen and many crashes in between gameplay, I still cannot recommend it YET. Until they fix it these core issues, I would 100% recommend this game to those who want to sit back, relax and play a hack n slash Persona game

author: 0c59e328320c5e6599d3f450302f6dbd
content:
The game provides a far less richer experience than its predecessors, the graphics, dialogues and cinematics aren't bad and to see the whole gang back together is certainly heartwarming.
However the RPG elements clash constantly with the fast paced hack and slash/"Warriors" type gameplay style, making battle a bit of a chore at times, the levels and foes tend to be quite repetitive and the whole infiltration part has been severly dumbed down if there at all at times.
The bosses which were so elaborate and well written are also nowehere to be found and in their stead we have only oversimplistic ones whose motives are easily discerned in a rather anticlimatic fashion.

author: 7fb36e249065597892503212d14a031a
content:
[quote] *中国鉴赏家同好会[开发者邀请]评测 
*开发者邀请评测由开发者邀请同好会成员免费测试游戏的方式，最终产生的玩家评测，故该评测仅作为参考，望读者理性阅读，谨慎购买。 
欢迎加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/jsjthh]中国鉴赏家同好会群组[/url]&关注我们的鉴赏家[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/27093039/]中国鉴赏家同好会[/url][/quote]
[h1]流畅与爽快齐飞，战斗共剧情一色
论光荣如何在别家IP重拳出击，在自家真三八唯唯诺诺[/h1]
毋庸置疑的是，P5S是一款不可多得的好游戏。（尤其是当我看完3月8号EVA以后，已经发誓不再当二刺螈的我更觉得P系列无敌。你说P系列也是二刺螈？没听说过（于谦脸）。）
它作为P5的续作，无论从玩法和画风都保持了甚至在某些方面超越了原来的水平。它将无双和ARPG结合的很好，看似无双其实本质上还是ARPG（JRPG？）游戏，因为玩家面对的诸多敌人并不像普通无双那样容易解决。所以，你玩这游戏是很难玩到割草的感觉的，或者说，割到无聊然后AFK的可能性是相当低的。（也许是我太水了，但是一开始没玩懂的时候让我觉得跟仁王一样，之后就好多了。）
[h1]画风[/h1]
自从P3以后，Atlus的御用画师副岛成记已经和《女神异闻录》捆绑在一起。（副岛你做的好啊！杏女士太好康了！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！）如果想先看看他的其他作品不妨可以先玩玩《凯瑟琳》，我觉得副岛很好地做到了“背叛”粉丝这个行动，但是他的“背叛”是能让粉丝自己能明白“原来是这样”，所以他才如此可贵。（而不是某痞子那样夏姬八画，怨念.jpg）。
这种奇怪和新潮的画风是副岛从时尚杂志和平时的观察中凝练出来的。所以这样的画风有着明显的指向性和独特性。
此外，这样的画风被应用在即时制战斗中，窃以为是有一定的视觉问题的。酷虽酷，但是没有习惯之前，着实太光怪陆离，这样的画风被应用在回合制中是相当不错的，但是即时制需要玩家在规定的时间内做出一定的动作，否则就会挨打甚至遭到重创，这样酷的画风和配色，在有着复数敌人的情况下，有时候真的可谓眼花缭乱。
我并没有在说副岛的水平不行，他笔下的凯瑟琳确实大，高卷杏女士真的好看，雨宫莲还是一样的帅，只是用在即时制有些不合适罢了。要是单说之后的服装设计、CG和各种对话和过场，那也确实是没得说的两个字——好看。借用攻壳的评价这灵动的设计、大胆的色块、毫不收敛的光污染和六亲不认的角色Pose还是那个味道。只不过进入“无双“战斗以后，有时候产生一定的阻碍视线的效果。
[h1]玩法[/h1]
[b]作为一个海贼粉，如果《海贼无双4》没发售前，我愿意称它为最强的无双改编游戏。
它确实做到了把无双当作工具而非目的去使用。否则阿特拉斯也并不需要去设计其他系统，只要让玩家一通操作扫干净地图上面的敌人即可。[/b]
看似无双，实则ARPG，我是选择Hard难度开始游玩的，我原以为即使是Hard难度已经玩过高难度真三国无双的我应该水水没问题，没想到，这个战斗系统还是相当值得研究的。先不论C技的各种衔接和属性之间的克制，就说说敌人的设计。之前打过的小BOSS都会成堆出现在之后的普通的遭遇战中，而且不愧是心之怪盗团，如果不是你偷袭敌人就是敌人先手让你进入不利状态战斗，而且敌人也会给你上各种Debuff，还要关注同伴的各种情况，就我个人的情况而言，如果前期不是偷袭进入战斗，很可能就是一波重创，甚至团灭。
总的来说，你，很强，敌人，也很强。潜行先手进入战斗你可以轻松取胜，不小心进入埋伏则会到处吃瘪。这样的体验作为《真女神转生》的衍生作，《P5》其实已经找到了紧张和难度之间的平衡点，即使是这作《P5S》也是一样。如果玩家要是抱着去割草的心态，其实是会被打的妈都不认识。敌人AI是如此的称职，就盯着你的弱点锤让你强制倒地。你说要用SP，对不起，用完以后要不吃药要不回现实补充，未知的敌人和迷宫长度会让玩家用SP时也要谨小慎微。
还有一个需要注意的地方，在教学曾提到，在攻击换人的一段时间后，无双槽是有一定的增益时间的，而正常累积速度是相当的慢，所以其实光荣和阿斯特拉是在鼓励玩家“换手“操作”的，我想这就是为什么《P5S》能如此流畅的原因之一。除此以外，场景的道具利用，友情换人，和前作就有的换人动画都让整个战斗流程十分流畅。
先手偷袭plus总攻击
人格面具触发弱点
一键追击后换人
利用场景追击
换回起手的人的人格面具
无双槽积累满放大招，来，就说流畅不流畅吧。
但是，我总是要来个但是。眼睛其实会很累，这也是我之前提到的画风问题，有时候六亲不认的光污染属实对操作有着一定的视觉阻碍。但是其实也并不能掩盖优点散发出来的光芒。
综上所述，P5S的难度不算十分的低，在某些情况下，或者说刚上手时是具有一定的挑战性的。
[h1]剧情[/h1]
我这么说吧，之前同期发售的是“乔尔米勒的奇妙冒险”，这游戏的剧情能挺过那段时间没有被喷，从侧面说明了这是即使是粉丝也能买单的剧情。从开头到结局全程无雷，气氛轻松欢快，前三个Boss对应了无印本篇。再说了，神（bushi）说过“有了苏菲亚就有了一切”，全方位无死角，功能完善，可爱会说话的AI谁不喜欢，我tm社保，玩P5S就是为了玩到苏菲亚啊！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！（发出死宅的声音）（路人女主芳泽：我TM。）
回归正题，《P5S》是《P5》结局后的半年。应该是默认了大家都已经成为了九舰提督，所以这作没有像《P5》那样的泡妹系统，所以，见不到芳泽霞，妹抖班主任，更不用说药神、占卜师、酒鬼和棋魂某某了。（大悲，不过占卜师的声优是Passing了，默哀一下。）但是我之前说过的苏菲亚站了出来！这个酷似米其林轮胎的人工智障显然会给玩家完全不同的游戏体验。久野美咲可以把苏菲亚蠢萌蠢萌的性格表现得淋漓尽致，即使是樱小姐在场，她的营业声线相比之下也是质量过关丝毫没有被比下去的感觉。（顺带一提，还有某个无能大佐的两任声优。）
这次剧情没有局限在本篇的东京地区，我们的主角团会利用暑假时期进行自驾游。（之后还可以选人坐摩天轮，显然我是男子组的，两人一猫，赚到（bushi）。）这P5S显然具备了《佐贺偶像是传奇》的功能——旅游宣传。[b]此外，我是极力推荐新玩家补一下甚至直接云一下前面的剧情，否则对于P5S的剧情体验一定是大打折扣的。[/b]
[h1]音乐与地图[/h1]
Life will change+Rivers in the desert，这两首配上无双的操作，你就是雨宫莲！有很多无印的BGM和一些电音版，老玩家应该会倍感熟悉，即使是新玩家也会沉迷于这样的“酷”的BGM，这种感觉就像你在Payday2里开一把可潜入可强突的图时，不小心被发现以后突然进入Razormind的高潮的感觉一般。cnm，燃起来了，兄弟萌。《Keeper of lust》的Remix版出现的时候，其实也就是意味着偷“薪”怪盗团来了，还是乖乖掏钱为上。
[b]当然，如果是新玩家完全可以先听一听OST，看一看番剧再来考虑是否入坑。[/b]
[b]至于地图，由于是无双，场景必定是较为宽阔的，但是光荣在自己真三八做的东西大而空洞，在P5S里却是一点没有这个问题，你要说这迷宫不如《P5》，问题是《P5》的迷宫是天花板水平，比它水的多了去，光看《P5S》的迷宫设计，诚然，它没有同《P5》一般丰富的攻略方式，也容易审美疲劳，但是放在市场里还是数一数二的，时不时出现的特殊互动和解谜，各种有趣的横版关卡总是能给这地图攻略平添一些趣味。[/b]
但是，我又来但是了。我玩几个小时的时间内，光剧情就占了大半，我就想砍个怪，现在喧宾夺主，战斗才是插入部分，看番是大头。（笑）
虽然我也乐意看到怪盗团们的互动，但是这确实有些用力过度了。
[h1]总结[/h1]
光荣在自家IP唯唯诺诺，在别家大作重拳出击，真三八的大而空洞在这里并没有体现，反而是真的把无双作为工具来使用，而非目的，所以流畅与爽快齐飞，战斗共剧情一色。
无论是无双玩家还是ARPG玩家都能在这游戏中寻找到属于自己的乐趣。老粉丝更是推荐，它绝对不会辜负你的期望。（不过老粉丝应该都已经玩过了吧）新粉丝可以去补一补番剧，窃以为，如果去补游戏实况，时间可能有上百小时，不妨先看看番剧了解个大概，然后再考虑入手。

author: 2cb3536120185415820706a69412d0c3
content:
Pretty fun hack-and-slash experience that still makes you stay on your toes via the Weakness and Strength etc. system. The story was pretty good but felt a bit restrictive with what the player can do on their daily life, something older fans may dislike but isn't that big of an issue. 

Graphics are alright although it did have some optimal issues (game crashing whenever leaving the Metaverse or frames dropping drastically out of nowhere).

Characters are solid still including the newer ones that were introduced for this game. Their backstory really show how and why they ended up like how they were in the game and it really showed how much resolution they have achieved by the end. 

Controls on the other hand were very complicated in my opinion (on keyboard) so a controller is highly recommended as it makes the game way easier (and it solves the massive frame drop issue if you disconnect it and reconnect it).

Story was alright, the way it introduced the villain's backstories really makes you feel for them and want them to change for the better. The story could be better in my opinion but given the circumstances (in game time restrictions) 

overall, again, a nice hack and slash anyone can play. Although I believe that the experience is way better when you have played Persona 5/Persona 5 Royal. Still a game anyone can pick up and give a try and be welcomed to the series

author: bba47675bda954e6b49bb9831a05a2f0
content:
Soundtrack and visuals are every bit as good as Persona 5, which is to say among the best you'll see (and hear). Real time combat works great. Story is good, though a good part will be lost if you haven't played Persona 5, which you should anyway (if you don't own a PS3 or PS4, it works flawlessly on RPCS3 (PS3 emulator) as long as you have a good CPU). The only bad thing about it is there isn't more of it (it's still 40-60 hours, and it's all great). There's also no New Game+, though I wouldn't be surprised if it's patched in later as you can save your clear data.

Overall, this is easily one of the best new games I've played in the last 5 years if not longer. If you've played Persona 5, you'll probably love it, and if you haven't, then what the hell are you waiting for?

author: 6980c098494752729e60fdc893aed578
content:
I think this is a great game. I've enjoyed it quite a bit.

I can't recommend it though. There's a game breaking glitch that just won't let you continue through the game past the 5th boss. I want to recommend this game. It's great. But the fact there's a glitch that won't allow me to continue the game means I can't. If you have a PS4 or Switch? Sure. But don't buy it on PC, you run the risk of never being able to beat it.

author: a45b11d23be55caa911ee98d048c98e8
content:
It's like I never left!
The gameplay took some getting used to, and can sometimes feel like just mashing buttons and downing consumables, but the story and the character interactions are all still there and are the main attraction for a Persona game anyhow. If you liked the story and characters of Persona 5, then this is a great continuation.

I have had the game crash on me about three times over the past 30 hours of playtime. Just remember to save when possible.

author: feccea4b33a75d849171834b27dfbbd5
content:
I absolutely reccommend this game.  It's insane how much this feels like the original Persona 5.  With a few exceptions, the entire game feels exactly like the first game did; menus, dungeons, boss designs...  It's incredible.  I was expecting a musou game more in-line with the others I've played; Hyrule and Fire Emblem Warriors.  Gone are the big battlefields of those games, replaced with small, tighter skirmishes that fit this sort of game better.

This game would be nearly perfect in my eyes, except for one thing: Denuvo.  Denuvo made my game crash more than a handful of times.  It was a serious drag each time I had to reload and go back sometimes to upwards of an hour.  Sega needs to remove it from the Steam version ASAP.  I had a friend who gave me a launcher without Denuvo, and in those last few hours of gameplay, not only did the game run better and load faster, but it didn't crash once.  

That aside, if you liked Persona 5, absolutely give this game a shot.  It was the sequel I didn't know I could have.

author: 54a843d9160f5aa499064fe519ff4a88
content:
A fun muso game with a familiar cast and world with the same staples Persona 5 is known for such as it's great sound track and its style is also faithful. Combat is enjoyable and the way combos expand the more you play as each character is a good way to get you playing everyone and seeing each thief's arsenal while in combat. I really liked seeing the existing cast interact more in what felt like a more natural way. With new cast members thrown into the mix, it only strengthens the character line up within Persona 5's world. Certain characters however do end up boiling down to their singular trope such as Futaba being more egregious or Makoto doubling down on her motherly role within the group. 

Overall story was interesting enough to keep me wanted to see how it would progress. However, there were a few moments that felt repetitive in the game play when it came down to locations. Some areas feel copy/paste of one another which is a bit of a let down considering what potential could have been met.

The main negative however that I'd consider the real reason behind whether this game is worth getting on Steam is that it crashes. Not just once or twice but multiple times. Personally, it crashed 15+ times but some friends have had it crash much more or much less. It is not a great port over onto PC and with these issues being so irregular, be prepared to what you could end up dealing with.

author: b9c1a14eca81521d9a8e21d1215ec361
content:
Meiner Meinung nach ist Persona 5 Strikers ein angemessenes Sequel zu Persona 5. Nach knapp 40 Stunden ingame, denke ich, dass ich eine ziemlich allgemeine Meinung zu diesem Spiel abgeben kann, also tue ich dies nun:
Ob man denn nun ein Fan des Mouso-Kampfsystems ist, sei mal dahin gestellt, doch ich finde, dass dies perfekt zu dem Spiel passt und nicht "erzwungen" wirkt. Die Kämpfe sind flott, interessant und zumindest auf Schwer auch einigermaßen anspruchsvoll (habs nach ca. 10 Std Spielzeit von Normal auf Schwer umgestellt, da es mir zu leicht war). Das der Schwierigkeitsgrad für mich auch ein Negativpunkt ist, darauf komme ich später nocheinmal zurück. Fahren wir erstmal mit dem Gameplay fort. Tja, Gameplay ist bei Persona Spielen ja so eine Sache... Obwohl man ganz klar sagen muss, dass die Fülle an Dialogfeldern nicht ganz so ausufernd ist, wie im Hauptspiel oder in den vorigen Hauptspielen der Reihe. Das Gameplay ist ein weinig mehr im Vordergrund, vorallem in den Dungeons wird man nun nichtmehr mit Textnachrichten zugemüllt, die man sich schon 5 mal durchgelesen hat. So habe ich bisweilen das Gefühl gehabt, dass man ein wenig mehr Freiheit hat, mit dem was man tut. Und tun kann man ähnlich viel wie im Basis-Spiel: Einkaufen, Velvet-Room (Persona Fusion), Requests machen und Kochen (!). Allerdings sind auch einige Dinge gestrichen worden und damit meine ich vorallem die Confidants/Social Links. Da ich mich im Vorhinein nicht so mit dem Spiel im Detail beschäftigt hatte (Spoiler dies das) kam diese Änderung dann schon ziemlich überraschend. Statt dem bekannten Leveln der Freunde und Bekannten hat man nun eine Art Wertetabelle, die einem Buffs gibt wie bspw. stärkere physische ANgriffe o.Ä. Für diese "Wertetabelle" benötigt man Bindungs-Punkte, welche man als Belohnung durch erledigte Requests von Freunden oder einfach durch das Fortführen der Hauptstory erhält. Ob dies einem gefällt, muss ein jeder selber sagen, ich finds nicht schlecht, trotzdem bevorzuge ich lieber die guten alten Social Links.
Da ich es eben gerade erwähnt habe: Die Hauptstory! (No Spoiler)
Als allererstes sei gesagt: Die Story hat nicht viel mit der von Persona 5 zutun, lediglich kleine ANspielungen und Namen werden beiläufig erwähnt. Im Grunde kann dieses Spiel also auch von Leuten gespielt werden, die Persona 5 im Original nicht gespielt haben. Trotzdem rate ich, dies getan zu haben, da es ansonsten ein wenig Verwirrung geben könnte, insofern man der SMT-Reihe gegenüber fremd ist.
Es ist also eine komplett neue und eigene Story, mit einer deutlich kürzeren Spielzeit als die des Originals.
Welche von beiden nun besser ist, kann ich nicht beurteilen, da ich das Spiel (wie gesagt) noch nicht beendet habe, trotzdem finde ich, dass die Strikers Story interessant ist und mir persönlich unter Umständen vielleicht auch ein wenig besser gefällt als die von Persona 5. Aber gut, das ist Nebensache.
Kommen wir zur Technik, ehe ich auf die Negativpunkte eingehe: Das Spiel ist schön... Es ist wirklich schön. Zwar nichts was dich rückwärts vom Stuhl haut, aber durch glatte Kanten, gute Lichteinstrahlungen und schöne Charaktermodelle (zumindest in näherer Distanz!) sieht das Spiel ziemlich gut aus. Die Framerate ist allerdings, zumindest auf meinem PC, hier und da ein wenig inkonstant, pendelt immer zwischen 40 und 60 FPS, je nachdem, wie Effektgeladen die Combo nun einmal ist. Bisher haben mich diese Drops allerdings überhaupt nicht gestört, ich hatte fast dauerhaft eine zufriedenstellende Framerate und kann mich dessen nicht beklagen. Wenns nicht läuft, dann sollte man halt an den Einstellungen rumspielen.
So, nun noch ein paar Mankerl, die das Spiel eben so hat im Schnelldurchlauf:
1. Ich weiß nicht, ob es an meinen Kopfhörern liegt, aber ich finde, dass das Spiel an einigen Stellen eine extrem leise (englische) Vertonung hat. Einige Wörter werden quasi geflüstert und wen darüber dann irgendein Soundtrack läuft, der im schlimmsten Fall so gut ist, dass man mitsummt, dann kann man nunmal nicht mehr so richtig hören, was Yusuke denn so von sich gibt. Und es ist nichtnur bei ihm so. Dieser Fehler könnte allerdings auch einfach an mir liegen.
2. Abstürze: Ich hatte bisher 3. Einen direkt am ANfang des Spiels nach der ersten halben Stunde circa (ohne zwischendrin Speichern zu können) und 2 dann zwischendurch. Ist zwar vielleicht etwas doof, aber mich haben sie nicht gestört, da sie an Stellen kamen, an denen Crashes nicht allzu schlimm wären.
3. Levelkurve/Schwierigkeitsgrad: Wie am Anfang geschrieben, habe ich das Spiel auf Normal begonnen und bin kläglich im ersten Dungeon verzweifelt. Du hast einen Kampf gemacht, 2 Mal dein Persona angreifen lassen und die SP waren weg. Dieses Problem zog sich bis zum ANfang den 2. Dungeons, denn auf einmal kamst du durch den gesamten Dungeon, ohne einmal SP nachzustocken (mit denselben SP-Ausgaben wie im ersten!) Dies führte dann dazu, dass ich auf Schwer gewechselt habe und nun eine gute Balance zwischen dem bekannten SMT- Schwierigkeitsgrades und einem frustfreien Spielen empfinde. Zwar gibt es hier und da kleine Passagen wo die Entwickler ein wenig übertrieben haben (ja, ich meine dich und deine Hacking-Fights Futaba!), aber alles in allem gebe ich die Empfehlung dieses Spiel auf Schwer zu spielen. Achja, dazu kommt, dass ich wirklich wenig erfahrung mit Mouso-Games im Vorraus hatte.
4. Ist dies ein Persona-Spiel? Mein letzter (und größter) Kritikpunkt geht an die Neuerungen des Spieles, mit denen alte Traditionen gebrochen wurden. Und bevor ich ein paar davon aufzähle muss ich einmal erwähnen, dass ich sämtliche Änderungen gar nicht so negativ sehe sondern die Innovation darin erkenne und es als das Prinzip in einem Spin-Off anerkenne.
Also: Keine Social-Links, stattdessen "Bindungsleiste", keine Zeiteinteilung (ja richtig gelesen, es sind festgeschriebene Tage, man muss nicht inerhalb eines Zeitraums einen Dungeon gecleart haben, zum Teil recycleter Soundtrack (überhaupt nicht schlimm xD)
... Mehr will ich hier jetzt nicht schreiben.

Schlusseindlich sieht man glaube ich, dass Persona 5 Strikers unter Umständen ein sehr kontroverses Spiel sein kann, doch mir macht es Spaß so wie es ist und ich kann es absolut jedem empfehlen, der Persona 5 gespielt hat. Spielt dieses Spiel, genießt Gameplay und Story und bildet euch eure eigene Meinung.
Ich habe hier jetzt alles gesagt, was ich als wichtig anerkenne und kann dieses Spiel nur wärmstens empfehlen. Atlus und Koei Tecmo  haben einen guten Job gemacht. Einen richtig guten Job!

author: 5e010dfc45f15c2e9377fb0d772a5764
content:
[h1]小编娱乐项：什么是P5天下第一？P5、P5R和P5S又有什么区别呢？[/h1]
最近P5天下第一很火，那么P5天下第一是什么呢，P5天下第一是什么意思呢出自哪里？接下来就和小编一起来了解一下吧。这就是小编给大家分享的P5天下第一是什么。希望大家看完这篇由小编精心整理的内容后，能对相关知识有所了解，解决你的困惑。
正解：P5即为女神异闻录5，P5R即为女神异闻录5皇家版，P5S即为女神异闻录5衍生作品，（称为续作也不为过）。P5天下第一的意思就是P5天下第一！（震声）
Sega搞快点啊，P5也上个steam？（做梦） 

[h1]这个无双不无双，型似无双神不是[/h1]
欢迎来到万物皆可无双之女神异闻录X光荣无双。作为一个上次尝试过塞尔达X光荣无双的玩家，其实笔者对本次的P5S并没有抱太大的期待。毕竟上一作塞尔达无双灾厄启示录虽然在角色招式设计和契合荒野之息上做到了尽善尽美，但是老套的大地图求援跑路加上令人发指的帧数（和老任机器不给力有一点原因）还是差强人意。
不过这次的P5S给笔者带来了不一样的体验。首先是相当到位的优化，在同屏多敌人时候也可以保持稳定不掉帧。游戏取消了救援跑路，取而代之的是感叹号寻路，再完成无双战斗完成任务推动剧情。其次本作后期的BOSS大多需要玩家攻击其弱点破盾(有点类似塞尔达无双中小boss的护盾)倒地再触发必杀。游戏在打BOSS时并没有一般无双游戏的爽快，反而需要玩家进行弱点攻击，一步步刮痧击败对手。

[h1]粉丝作？价格确实很粉丝[/h1]
先不谈本作是不是粉丝向作品，笔者只能说这国区419的定价确实非常粉丝向，这简直是妥妥的割韭菜啊。
那么本作必须需要玩家玩过P5才可以游玩吗？答案并非如此，在笔者看来，了解一些P5的剧情与人物后再游玩本作也不会有太大的问题。精致的人物建模，过场CG，时不时出现的福利环节，跌宕起伏的剧情，强烈的打击感，加持前作的优秀BGM，完全可以让一个日式RPG游戏爱好者欲罢不能。就算本作是无双，也可以打出不同的风格。

[h1]开着房车去旅行，是青春啊！[/h1]
游戏的剧情发生在P5事件结束后半年。为了洗清怪盗团的嫌疑，男主和团员们再次相聚一堂，调查并制裁在里世界中通过悔改而控制人心的王。不过在游戏中，怪盗团为避人耳目无法使用公共交通工具，于是他们借到了一辆房车开始了难忘的暑假周游日本之旅。三男四女一猫的旅行即可开始，不容错过的泳装福利以及澡堂福利也在等待着你~

[h1]美食旅行鉴赏指南[/h1]
怪盗团每到一个城市都有该城市特有的建筑，美食也各不相同，甚至玩家在自动零售机中购买的饮料也会随着地区的变化出各种不同的品种。（有些菜谱以及食材只能在特定地点供应，白金党必做任务）本作也完全可以给想去霓虹旅行的玩家一些专业的美食指南。

[h1]人之初性本善[/h1]
在游戏中，所有的王都并非自私自利，他们大多数由于心灵创伤而被利用最后剑走偏锋，在怪盗团击败之后，往往会出现柯南中的教科书式认错法，一哭二跪三忏悔。游戏中所表现得惩恶扬善那种爽快感让人大呼过瘾，心理创伤的故事也让人唏嘘不已。加之游戏中对新晋角色的戏份拿捏相对到位，感情戏完全可以引起玩家的共鸣。最后再联系实际生活，对社会中出现的那些不良现象作出反思，发人深省。[spoiler]（主题升华了）[/spoiler]

[h1]总评[/h1]
+精致的立绘与建模
+热血BGM再度上线
+懂得都懂，福利拉满
+路上观察学之霓虹美食大赏
+多样化的对战方式
+跌宕起伏的剧情
+P5S也可以天下第一
-价格略高
-闪退总是发生在不经意间，请及时存档！！！

author: 7bd3331c2ea15cf5b6c638885fdba046
content:
"Persona 5 Strikers" est un jeu d'action "Musou-like" (que l'on peut résumer sommairement en l'affrontement d'une horde d'ennemis en temps réel), suite du j-rpg "Persona 5"/"Persona 5 Royal" (une amélioration du jeu de base conçue simultanément à P5S). Tout cela est un peu confus, surtout pour les joueurs voulant essayer d'aborder l'histoire de P5S sans connaître P5. Disons-le tout net, si vous êtes dans ce cas de figure, vous n'apprécierez pas ce jeu à sa juste valeur.

En effet, P5S est un bon jeu avant tout grâce à son univers et ses personnages. Sans rentrer dans les détails, cette histoire tourne autour d'un road trip du protagoniste et de son équipe afin d'enquêter sur des phénomènes similaires à ceux rencontrés durant leur aventure précédente. Il est donc presque indispensable de connaître cette dernière pour reconnaître les différentes références, clins d'oeil et autres easter eggs. Le scénario est suffisamment bon (bien qu'un peu prévisible) pour qu'il tienne sur ses deux jambes. Toutefois, ce sont surtout les personnages (protagonistes comme antagonistes) qui permettent à ce jeu de prendre son envol. Mention spéciale à Sophia et Zenkichi, qui sont admirablement écrits.

Le gameplay s'adresse à bien plus de joueurs que le scénario. Bien que beaucoup de mécaniques sont présentées en même temps et qu'il est difficile de maîtriser tous les personnages, les combats restent suffisamment lisibles pour que le joueur moyen ne se perd pas. Il est toujours possible d'arrêter le temps pour se soigner ou consulter les forces et faiblesses des ennemis les plus proches, permettent d'évaluer la meilleure stratégie à adopter. L'IA des partenaires est décente (reste en vie longtemps et fait des dégâts acceptables tout en aidant à quelques reprises avec des buffs et des soins) sans être extrêmement efficace. Il est également possible (et même recommandé) de jouer tous les personnages afin de profiter de la meilleure expérience de jeu. De plus, il est toujours possible de se replier à partir d'un point de sauvegarde pour souffler et prendre tout son temps dans quelques petites zones des différentes villes du jeu. Pour autant, ce jeu n'est pas facile et plusieurs phases (dont la plupart des boss) s'avèrent fortement coriaces.

Niveau musique, les amateurs de P5 restent en terrain connu, puisque de nombreuses musiques du jeu d'origine sont présentes, souvent remixés manière rock. C'est toujours une réussite, en particulier avec  "Blooming villain". Les nouvelles musiques, comme celles des nouvelles villes sont très belles. Coup de coeur au thème (et à ses variations) de Sophia "Heart of an IA".

Là où le bas blesse surtout, c'est niveau graphismes et portabilité. Le jeu n'est pas vraiment beau et nécessite sur des ordinateurs n'étant pas des bêtes de course de tourner au minimum. C'est juste mal optimisé. J'ai rencontré de nombreux ralentissement, crashs et autres problèmes de lancement, au point de devoir réinstaller le jeu en entier pour pouvoir y rejouer après un bug particulièrement coriace. Si en plus de ça vous comptez le fait que les joueurs de Switch ayant Smash/PS4 gamers ayant P5 ou P5R ont des bonus musicaux, vous comprendrez que le portage PC n'est pas franchement intéressant.

Bref, un très bon jeu, bien que s'adressant à un public restraint prêt à faire des compromis techniques. Je le recommande malgré tout sur PC.

author: 5fb4871551865d178bc03dcc8269410b
content:
[h1]光荣的无双系列经验成功帮助ATLUS尝试了一次的“加减法” [/h1]

 [h1]归来仍是那个风华正茂的少年 [/h1]
本来由于“无双”声名赫赫的原因，我对于剧情会如何走向仍是忧虑重重，光荣的历史剧群像一直不错，但却没啥青少年那种校园感，大蛇无双更是撕书不停，召唤的真·远吕智都能凑成一桌麻将。却不想此次剧情竟如此对味，搭配那首“life will change”，我点下发送预告信按钮，那熟悉的音乐伴随着永不改变的怪盗宗旨一起揭开每一个人内心的心灵创伤和背后的幕后黑手。这一刻，我仿佛回到了王道剧情之中，当我遭遇重重困阻，面临种种嘲讽，我不屑一笑，站起身来，仍旧那个风华正茂，中二十足的SP少年。

 [h1]我与P系列的巧合相遇  [/h1]
初尝persona系列是在PSP模拟器当中，当时朋友玩P3还有一个古诗文对话的选择，我就看它玩了这么一次，就被这个游戏给吸引住了。但苦于平台和多方面原因，在PC平台想要玩到P系列正统作品基本没戏。谁知去年峰回路转，先是P4G登录steam，玩了一阵感到无力和时间管理焦虑，遂弃坑。近日P5S上架，我又给了自己一次机会，在光荣和ATLUS的联手之下，我并未对本作“女神异闻录无双”的剧情或完成度有任何的期待，我仅仅觉得就算弃坑不玩，也能速度无双通关，不至于吃灰。可结果就是一玩就停不下来，实属过瘾。

 [h1]无双搭配ATLUS，一次成功的“加减法” [/h1]
在光荣的无双操作体系下，本作对比我玩过的P系列来说，做了一次大大的减法。首先便是回合制改成即时的无双act玩法，将回合制策略性高但是战斗和明雷接触敌人都需要大量时间的过程大幅度缩短，在保留了前作persona（人格面具）的合成改造系统之下，让玩家可以触发敌人后爽快的直接进行打击，加上召唤人格面具时的时间流速减缓功能，又保留了P系列针对敌人弱点打击和“大家一起上”功能，可以说是爽快和策略性同时存在，二者相辅相成，只会无双对于同级敌人只能“刮痧”，学会技能系统弱点打击则可以“更快的刮痧”。

 [h1]总结 [/h1]
总的来说，本次P5S可以说是出奇的保质保量，光荣虽然无双做的是各有各的想法，大哥跟二弟各种歪瓜裂枣，但本次的合作却不只是一加一，而是成倍提高的双赢策略，拥有了无双的经验减掉了回合制的过多繁琐过程，保留了面具和一定程度的养成系统，搭配仍旧校园、冒险、青春结合在一起的剧情，我只能说，棒。

author: 61d3932c840757de8640fcf538a96cd1
content:
[h1]P5S作为一部续作，虽然在玩法上转变为了光荣的拿手好戏——无双，但游戏的内核却一点也不失系列精髓。[/h1]

[h1]无双与系列内核的融合[/h1]
熟悉的音乐，依旧是一大卖点，配合战斗时爽快的打击手感，与战斗中的队友的语音对话，立体的交汇带来了别致的体验；延续了p5本篇精良的美术、UI风格，动态菜单页面更是随着选项与进一步分支选项的不同而发展，色调鲜明各异，变化流畅连贯。

为什么说游戏的内核一点也不失？因为无论是人格面具的掉落与合成，还是技能属性的克制与装备、药品的需求，游戏本篇的玩法与系统几乎可以说是一样也没少。

[h1]人格面具与技能[/h1]
通过第三只眼可以识别出敌人的强度，击败有名字的的强力敌人则会掉落人格面具。提升面具的等级可以学会新的技能，利用技能的克制达到控制的目的。虽然在玩法上是无双，但游戏的操作远没有割草那么简单。遭受负面状态技能十分影响战斗，转动遥感使角色清醒。合集技仍有，而show time现在则只要槽积满就可以随时发动，不过发动模式改变为了操作角色与人格面具的联手。你可以在四名角色中随时切换，因此在面对boss前将所有操作角色的show time槽积满不失为一个很好的选择。而面具合成结果现在也有了明显的提示，相比正传简单便捷了许多。

地图上遍布着各式各样的建筑与物体，因此利用地形可以体验到战斗时的另一种爽快。环绕路灯回转攻击，击爆脚下的汽车或者踩下灯具可以造成相当范围的可观伤害。偷袭扒下敌人的面具可以很大程度上减轻战斗难度，而骇客战的加入也使双叶终于踏上了正面战场。虽然仍不能直接编队操纵，但在骇客战中我们却需要在规定时间消灭一波波的敌人保护双叶解锁大门。

每名队员都有各自的大师技艺系统，各分四阶，多使用对应角色即可解锁新的招式。

[h1]殿堂与监狱[/h1]
迷宫仍带来了丰富的解密元素，与殿堂不同，除了按部就班的解锁一个个区域直至核心，在最后的大门前我们需先返回现实世界寻找“创伤之间”，从而击破最后区域封闭的锁。监狱在攻略完对应boss后也并不会坍塌，因此我们在之后也可以重复进入对应监狱完成任务。

在主世界中随时可以保存，而在一世界中则取消了安全房间的设定，取而代之的是一个个的存档点。存档点的数量总的来说还算合理，但游戏闪退情况也总会遇上那么几次，因此建议：[h1]能存档时就随手存档。[/h1]

[h1]请求任务与地方美食[/h1]
每一个地区都有限定的队友任务，一旦错过后续无法补回。同时，还可以通过部分请求任务解锁线上商店中新的武器、防具种类、料理配方与band技能等级上限。band技能提升了整体角色强度与体验；登录线上商店，在熟悉的bgm中，你还可以听见索菲亚轻哼的曲调。料理配方也是本作中的一大收集要素，在沿途的城市中品尝各类美食，领悟配方，之后可以购买原材料在房车中烹饪。当然错过的话也不必太担心，后续也可以在线上商店中购买，不过所花费的金钱就远超了之前。

[h1]P5S作为一部续作，我认为物有所值。[/h1]

author: 4c36103c60265f758a7a62fb07429157
content:
PS4已通關

雖然想稱讚繼P4G之後再上P5S
不過上P5S前卻沒有上P5R...
但願意上新作我覺得很可以

一直以來很多SEGA的新遊戲都不太會上PC
Atlus更是少數
如果之後都願意上PC就好了
不過考慮到全世界一起開玩為前提的話大概是要等到歐美版出來...

劇情跟基本概念對沒玩過這系列的人來說應該是看不懂
不過合成系統有因應遊玩方式作出簡化所以算是過得去
然後遊玩方式相對著重於「弱點攻擊」而不是流傳的無雙
對某些單純想玩爽的人來說應該不太友好
而且欠缺回避以外的防禦方式 不擅長動作遊戲的人玩起來大概會有點辛苦
中間可能會有一段陣痛期 至少我PS4初見中間有點痛苦 一直進進出出的補血補MP
而且進行面具合成 等級不會提高 有可能會出現面具等級跟不上的問題 而等級高的又不一定合用...
後面習慣了知道有什麼技巧才比較輕鬆 所以PC版還算玩得流暢
不過說到流暢不得不吐嘈過場3D動畫莫名其妙的LAG 我覺得不行

author: eb53f432de8251bbbf8c5414415914e6
content:
Edit après avoir fini le jeu(j'ai pas fait tout le contenu annexe mais il est vraiment minuscule). Les musiques étaient cool mais vraiment pour un truc qui se finit en moins de 25h bourré de scènes naratives qui ne sont bonnes qu'à être skippées c'est pas oufissime. Par contre le gameplay en combat est décent.

Ca peut sembler dur de mettre une mauvaise note après 7h à un jprg, mais sachez qu'en 7h j'ai fait garanti plus du tier de l'histoire(je sais pas exactement combien vu que je suis no spoil) et que j'ai une bonne vision de la profondeur de jeu et des gameplay loops.

En termes d'optimisation, le jeu ne rame ni ne bug sur mon PC, ma manette PS4 est bien mappée, bref tout roule.

En termes de gameplay, déjà ça n'a rien à voir avec un musou, c'est plus proche du rework de seiken dentstu 3 que d'un musou de base. Ce n'est pas parce qu'il y a parfois de la densité de petits monstres que c'est un musou. Le gameplay fonctionne, mais le jeu reste plutôt simple et lapidaire, pour l'instant je roule dessus (en normal).

En  termes d'esthétique, de character design et de storyline c'est très mitigé, l'UI est excellente, le reste est selon moi absolument à chier. C'est insultant envers les 10-17. Les cutscenes animées en mode 3 images par secondes c'est hyper cheap même si les storyboards sont bons.

En termes de gameplay loop, c'est selon moi là où c'est le plus problématique, c'est vraiment mou du grand et télégraphé, j'ai fait les 2 premiers "chapitres" et commencé le 3eme, c'est la même chose rince and repeat systématiquement. Je comprends qu'on puisse aimer avoir une structure de jeu hyper redondante, moi c'est vraiment pas mon délire, surtout pas dans un jeu non compétitif. On est téléguidés par un gros point d'exclamation et des espèces de mini cut scene à 2 balles entre les combats, eux-mêmes étant absolument trivialisés par j'imagine à peu près n'importe quoi parce qu'en jouant au pif tout se fait déboiter même les boss pour l'instant.

Bref, je regrette d'avoir acheté ce titre, étant donné que le gameplay est fonctionnel et que le jeu tourne bien je ne veux pas vous dissuader de l'essayer si il vous branche, cependant selon moi ça ne mérite pas plus de 20-25e.

author: f25476c94e935955bf4760dc28f987ad
content:
Persona 5 Strikers is an amazing game. 

Acting as a sequel to, and taking place during the summer after the events of Persona 5, you get to reunite with the members of the Phantom Thieves to travel across Japan, traversing "Jails" in order to save humanity. Unlike the turn-based combat style of the original Persona 5, Strikers has combat similar to the 1 vs many style of the Dynasty Warriors games, with fluid transitions between combat and traversing the Jails.
The game has a great story that builds upon the world of the original game, and I definitely welcomed new characters like Zenkichi and Sofia, but I would suggest not playing this game until you play Persona 5 first, because this game is a sequel and spends no time introducing people. 

Like other Persona games, the soundtrack is phenomenal and a joy to listen to. 

However, in regards to the PC version, I have had issues with the game crashing several times (only during loading screens), so remember to save often.

*Note: I would not advise completing all achievements for this game, mainly because you will need to max out all BOND Skills, which took me over 10 hours exclusively grinding one boss over and over again just to get enough EXP to complete the achievement.

author: 842c8cfc10b45d60981598d38bd3d282
content:
Ich würde so gerne ein ausführliches Review zu diesem Spiel geben, doch im ernst? Die passenden Worte fehlen mir dafür. Für die Persona 5 Reihe empfinde ich so viel Liebe. Alle 3 sind einfach großartige Spiele, welche mich von der ersten Minute an gefesselt haben. Wenn ich bedenke mit wie viel Skepsis ich damals an Persona ran getreten bin.. Und auf was für eine Reise mich es am Ende mitgenommen hat. All die Charaktere, seien es die Phantom Thieves oder andere Confidants, sind mir so an's Herz gewachsen. Ich habe Strikers ziemlich entgegen gefiebert!

Alles ab hier könnte jetzt Spoiler enthalten, daher warne ich euch hier explizit. 

Also, ein paar (hoffentlich) kurze Worte zu Strikers: Wer das übliche rundenbasierte Persona erwartet, vergesst es. Hier haben wir ein Echtzeit-Kampfsystem, wo du auf Horden einprügelst und öfters mal dein Leben aus den Augen verlierst, wenn du nicht jemanden der Heilen kann im Team hast. Heißt, kein unnötiges Panik schieben ob die SP reicht bis zum Ende, weil ohne kannst du dich schlecht heilen. Keine Items mehr dafür horten, was nicht heißt, dass sie ganz nutzlos jetzt sind. Du kannst verschiedene Angriffe starten, hast weiterhin mehrere Persona und kannst Gefängnisse erforschen. Von den guten alten Schlössern könnt ihr Abschied nehmen in dem Teil. 
Die Grafik ist genau das was wir gewöhnt sind, was auch gut so ist! Die Musik ähnelt sehr der Alten, wurde jedoch Stellenweise gut erneuert bzw etwas verändert. Allein wenn ich an die Musik im Okinawa Gefängnis denke.. Uff, Hallo Gänsehaut!
Das Zeitmanagement ist endlich kein Kampf mehr gegen das gefühlte taktische Denken. Was machst du jetzt? Stats verbessern, Confidants erhöhen oder doch ins Mementos gehen? Hier reist du einfach nur mit deinen Freunden, kannst zwischendurch mal Quest's für sie erledigen oder kleine Events mit ihnen machen. Dazu hast du so viel Zeit wie du willst für die Gefängnisse. Gehst du einmal raus, vergeht kein Tag automatisch. 
Die gesamte Story.. Sie ist großartig. Ich hatte so oft Gänsehaut und habe mitgefühlt. Man lernt viele Dinge dazu, andere Ansichten. Und so dumm es auch klingt, du hast jemanden an deiner Seite, der lernt was ein Herz eigentlich ist. Es gibt wieder verstecke Nachrichten in diesem Spiel, welche man wirklich gut verinnerlichen kann. 

Bisher habe ich Strikers auf der Ps4 durch gesuchtet. Mit 43 Stunden habe ich es beendet und bin noch dabei die 100% zu machen, welche mir hier auch noch bevor stehen. Es sind jetzt nicht unbedingt die knapp 80/90 Stunden die man sonst gewohnt ist, aber ich finde man kommt komplett auf seine Kosten bei diesem Teil. Ich denke Persona 5 hat für immer einen besonderen Platz in meinem Herzen und ich lasse mich überraschen ob nicht vielleicht noch etwas von den Phantom Thieves kommen wird. <3 Zumindest möchte ich noch keinen Abschied von der bunten Truppe nehmen.

author: 0b465a6ee14d5d9494374a335a0ad943
content:
[h1][b]前言：[/b][/h1]
《女神异闻录5》的衍生续作，表面看起来会有一种【换皮无双】的感觉。因为和以前的游戏玩法有巨大的差异性，另外一方面我个人觉得无双系列也很容易遭遇瓶颈，割久了总会让人会很犯困，达到不到很“爽”的一种感觉。
正式接触以后我才发现并没有那么简单，与其说无双割草，我觉得更像一部有趣[b]【番剧】[/b]或者ARPG游戏。
[b]（非persona系列粉丝考虑入手前提先确认自己是否能够接受日式RPG的玩法，其次还有无双割草~）[/b]

没有额外条件可以去看一下[b]《女神异闻录5》[/b]的动漫，这样会更容易理解P5S的整体剧情）
【对你有帮助不妨给我点个赞呗~】
[h1][quote=]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]　欢迎关注 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38287879]网易UU鉴赏家培养计划[/url][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]　来这里找优质游戏、开黑日友、白嫖UU时长卡　[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]　加速Steam社区、游戏记得用UU哦_(:з」∠)_　[/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]
[/quote][/h1]
[b]非常感谢网易UU提供的游戏【欢迎大家加入UU组嗷，U妹本人在群欢迎去撩】[/b]

[h1][b]其实并没那么无双[/b][/h1]
本人我在没玩P5s之前，通过看视频或者听人家说，基本能够感受到的两个字就是“无双”二字，亲身接触到P5s的游戏性以后，也就是它的战斗系统。说它是一款无双割草游戏，我觉得更像一款正经的ARPG游戏。
战斗环节中也并非像隔壁《真三国》那类游戏一样可以无脑的输出技能、在人群中疯狂割草之类。在P5s里面的每一种怪物都拥有自己独特的弱点和抗性，例如闪电技会有概率感电，某些怪物被打中会百分百必定感电眩晕、背后袭击会触发敌方怪物大范围眩晕等。几乎每个怪物都拥有技能，大型怪物具有霸体、强抗性、强力攻击等。冲上去直接当莽夫的话基本很容易被对面怪物打一个【狗吃⑩】的失败情况，本人我玩得是最低难度，最低难度有时候操作失误也会被某些精英怪物摁在地上疯狂摩擦。

和前作一样都是需要进入到另外一个空间（监狱）进行探索，白天的时候他们都是乖乖仔，跟日本高中生没什么区别（本身也就是）。到晚上就会化身成为无所不能的“偷心怪盗团”。敌人在地图上显示和前作几乎没差别，在潜行过程中可选择背后袭击或正面强攻，不过一般还是能偷袭就偷袭。偷袭掉一个敌人就他们就会变成大批怪物，BGM一响，割草部分正式开启~
战斗过程中利用“人格面具”释放不同属性的技能，为此游戏特意设计了技能释放系统，释放时刻会进入时间停止，这时候和回合制RPG一模一样，可以慢慢挑选对应克制的“人格面具”，选择最克制的技能，这样才能对敌方造成巨量的伤害。

值得注意是，释放技能是会消耗能量数值（游戏内叫SP值），在前期是战斗是非常容易空Sp数值的，全程可以自动补充血量，但并不能随时补充sp数值。基本5次以上，10次以下的割草战斗，Sp数值基本就空掉了，想要回复只能回到现实世界，一来一回也是非常占时间的。所以游戏中队Sp数值管理非常非常重要，技能克制取决了你能不能瞬间秒掉对方的可能性。战斗的时候也需要同时考虑对付敌人的策略，技能时间也是很讲究的。

[h1][b]爽快的连招动作风格[/b][/h1]
既然包含“无双”题材，那么肯定会有连招技的，无双游戏拥有特点的“C技”依然是最常见的普攻衔接手段，不过P5s在有C技的基础上，也同时包含具有动作游戏的机制。
每一位角色都有固定的C技，不同的人格面具的技能也会加入到C技的连招中。战斗中通过C技衔接释放“人格面具”的额外攻击，这个时候释放是不需要消耗Sp数值的，基本是最节约资源也是最好用的战斗手段，伤害高，清怪快，连招方便。
战斗前调整好队伍属性，根据操控的角色释放的C技也会不同，每一位角色的连段数技能也非常好多，角色不同战斗的连招风格也会非常不同，玩起来会让人感觉非常非常过瘾。

看似是乏味的“无双”游戏模式，其游戏难度并不是特别低，在上面我也提到过"我玩最低难度“都会被精英怪摁在地上暴打的结果。第一关的战斗环节基本是下酒菜，随便你乱杀。达到第二个以后，就算是最低难度，游戏的难度也开始大幅度的上升，霸体大型怪物增多、小型Boss也会非常频繁，玩法的爽快感程度上得到了提升，但对自己的操作、策略要求也进行了提高。不过游戏中也包含总攻击、追击攻击等攻击系统，战斗环节的爽快程度达到了进一步提升，不过开始新鲜瘾是有很多，久了还是挺枯燥的。

割草游戏我并不是很建议玩极高难度，高难度基本出现在在核心Boss上面，难度过高的情况下打每一个主线Boss,你的伤害基本就是刮痧。只能利用有限的Sp数值触发硬直或破甲倒地。Boss拥有的大范围攻击下也要用闪避技能迅速多开，就算是最低难度也无法硬抗伤害，被打中基本是必死无疑。很多时候都是边躲边打，利用属性相克技能进行快速强打输出。
[b]【Boss战玩起来非常舒服，全程紧张又刺激，用炫酷的招式把Boss打掉】[/b]

[h1][b]玩法变了，但味道没变[/b][/h1]
游戏整体画面、界面UI依旧保持了时尚的视觉体验，本作具有独特战斗风格外，也大部分保留了P5原有的那副模样。游戏中的音乐也是恰到好处，每一场战斗开始就会潮流风格的配乐突然穿插进来，打起来的时候整个人都有一种“M*，燃起来了！”

全新的大量剧情可以让人清晰感觉到在剧情上下了非常多的工夫，内容上并不比前作少，这次剧情设定主角团队的暑假生活，第二章开启坐着房车前往世界各地旅行、不同的风景、不同的特产、不同的“监狱”，内容上非常非常充足。
话又说回来，它是一款“无双”游戏，所以在这款游戏中没了AVG的内容，不用关注角色数值养成，也不用去提升自己和提升同伴的感情（当然是不能开后宫啦），也就是很单纯的根据剧情推动慢慢度过每一天就好。

游戏中的另外一个“等级”会随着剧情事件选择、战斗、探索提升，提升后会获得强化技能点，用来增加角色属性值、获得独特Buff加成、经验、金币加成等。辅助型系统。
人格面具养成系统也完全保留在本作中，合成、继承、强化等等，原汁原味的味道，基本P5有的玩意，P5S一样都有。

[h1][b]结语[/b][/h1]
本作我个人觉得，不管是粉丝向玩家，还是无双玩家，甚至你只喜欢玩ARPG游戏，入了是绝对不亏的。（当然目前的价格还是等便宜点吧2333）
[b]【雨宫莲依旧还是那么帅！】[/b]

Very fun combat system. I am fans of dynasty warrior game since on playstation 2, and this battle system with my favorite persona character is really awesome. especially every persona move has different specials! I play on easy mode since I am casual pleb and no time to grind exp/item, tried normal mode at early stage and I keep dying from the 1st boss til I find out I have to grind exp to create persona that allow me to deal weakness on the boss and it's all become so easy and just reading the boss move pattern. for now I am just focusing on completing the game, might be continue on normal mode after I finished. TLDR : 10/10 will recommend to everyone who likes musou game. and a must have for persona lover.

author: 484857fb9510565cb80c9f44f9a0357e
content:
(Written at Ver. 1.0.0, please verify accuracy on future versions.)
TO SUMMARIZE:
I really like this game as a sequel to Persona 5. Standalone, the most glaring thing is you're dropped straight in assuming you already understand Persona 5's plot. While I feel like you would enjoy the game regardless, I highly recommend visiting the first Persona 5 game. If you're in a pinch, watch a playthough or in the worst case scenario the anime (though not very well received.)


GAMEPLAY:
I have had numerous crashes since the early release day and to my knowledge there is no fix yet, which is a little off-putting. If you do decide to get this game for PC, please practice good saving habits if only for this reason. Save as often as possible, as this game does *not* autosave. While I still enjoyed the experience overall, the crash issue made me wish I got it for console instead. There are also a few game-breaking bugs which you will have to avoid. For example, you cannot play in fullscreen or borderless windowed modes or the game will go into a black screen if you trigger a cutscene. You must play in windowed mode as far as  my experience has shown me.

With that said, the gameplay combines aspects of Persona 5's JRPG elements and combat, with musou mechanics you're probably familiar with most "Warriors" games. While it has its flaws, I never found myself bored. Fights felt interesting, though sometimes downright easy playing on "Normal."

As a note to Atlus, you've got to be more timely with bug-fixes and more courteous to your PC audience if you want to keep going with this PC release approach. At the very least keep some sort of communication with the player base acknowledging the issues.

STORY:
Persona 5 Strikers takes place after the events of the original Persona 5. It does not take into consideration your past romance(s?) or confidants, nor can I say it makes any clear reference to the events of Persona 5 Royal. You may notice some themes being reused in the first few levels of the game that are similar to Persona 5's palace themes. I will say, however, that they are distinct enough to not feel like a rehash. The antagonists feel unique, and contrast heavily from the precursor of this game. 

Overall, without giving anything away, while the writing is definitely not as good as before it's pleasant for those already familiar with the first game, showing strong character growth in contrast and an interesting new evil to take on. I personally believe this is a worthy sequel story-wise.

THE VERDICT:
I'm hoping the glitches are resolved for the PC release at some point. That said, I can comfortably recommend this game to people who are itching for more of the Phantom Thieves adventures, those looking to beat up massive hordes of shadows, or even if you're really weird and want to get introduced to Persona 5 with this game! I'm giving the game a thumbs up, but begrudgingly so in light of the current state of the PC release. But for my purposes, this game was worth the occasional crash and being forced to play in Windowed mode.

author: e335ab9ff661551fb0aa358af053934a
content:
This game is great. I really enjoyed it.

It's getting a negative review from me after 20+ hours because the people who are being fucked over by the constant problems the game has deserve a voice.

This game has a ton of issues when it runs for many users; I had the issues up until I forced the game to run in Administrator mode, and that literally fixed all of my problems. I haven't had a crash since day 1; on Day 1, I had three crashes. I found the suggestion from a user who had tried making sure the game ran in Administrator and it fixed all of their issues.

I have friends suggesting that the Kyoto boss area is basically unwinnable right now, and it has a crash right after that you can't get past. I'm looking to try and see if that happens to me, as I'm a few in-game days away from that particular date.

This game is great, the port itself needs some tweaks, but apparently Atlus nor Koei Tecmo plan to do shit about it.

I've lost a lot of respect for Atlus, and now I'm not sure if they deserve any more of my money past this point; Persona 4 Golden was a beautiful port, and it was patched with the majority of its issues solved within days.

It's been almost two weeks from this game's release and not a fucking word of anything getting changed or improving. Dev's want to sweep this under the rug and get away with it.

If you can, and you also reviewed this game, swap it to negative and get this game noticed by the Dev's so they do something.

content:
I've earned the platinums on both standard and royal P5s so put a good few hundred hours into them and Strikers to me actually felt more like an evolution than a spin off, everything is slicker, more streamlined and traversal is an absolute blast in this game, That's not to say I want to lose the turn based systems from the main series, or the standard Persona game loop - this is just a nice pallet cleanser in prep for P6.

The story is a straight continuation from P5 but you don't have to play it to enjoy this one, in some ways it is a Fisher Price my first Persona but it really is fun to play.

Looks absolutely stunning compared to the PS4 versions of P5 and the increased framerate is definitely welcome.

This is a must buy title. 

C'mon Atlus, get Persona 5 Royal to PC - along with Strikers Royal...

author: 6f26d43f8bb8590f80087d521208c2d8
content:
So, how do I start with this review?
Half an hour ago, after 60 hours of playing I finally finished P5Strikers and I am blown away. I LOVED P5 on the PlayStation 4 (didn't play P5R yet, ATLUS, PLS BRING IT ON PC, I BEG YOU) and I do love P5Strikers even more, kinda. Although I couldn't build my romance-ship with Futaba, like in P5...

The gameplay is in my opinion not just like a normal ''Warriors''-Hack and Slash-kinda gameplay, it is basically a combination of using your Persona-Skills correctly or in the right situation and more or less just smashing your 2 attack-buttons. For those, who like the ''Warriors''-games, you will DEFINITELY love this piece of indescribable and beautiful art. The ''Hack and Slash''-Combat doesn't feel boring nor repetitive, like in the original ''Warriors''-series, which is because of the HUGE variety of Personas you can have (just like in the original P5) and how ATLUS/Koei Tecmo/Omega-Force integrated the usage of the Personas, is just awesome.

The story is just awesome. No worries, I won't say ANYTHING about the story. It plays half a year after the story of P5 and  has a lot of moments, where it brings you to almost crying, but it can INSTANTLY change your sad mood into a very happy mood, because of a sudden joke or such little things, which make the story, the characters and their bond just absolutely amazing and wonderful. Speaking of the characters, each of the already known Phantom Thieves and all of the new characters newly introduced to this story are completely well written, each has their own little ''story'' and ''highlight'' in this game - Atlus, you are just amazing in writing characters and stories for your games.

What else can I say? I am again cmpletely amazed because of an Atlus-game, which isn't anything special, because, as I've said, Atlus is absolutely A M A Z I N G in writing stories + characters.

Every city, that you will see is individually designed, nothing looks like the other, the Meta-Verse is truly amazing designed, the bosses all have great designs and I can not stop simping about this game (or Futaba, heh).

I hope for everyone, who will read this, that I could help you a little bit, if you have troubles, buying this game, because you needed a second opinion. <3

Oh, two things left....
1. FUTABA IS WAIFU, FUTABA FOR LAIFU <3

2. ATLUS - PLEASE - PERSONA 5 ROYAL FOR PC AND MAKE AGAIN A SEQUEL FOR THE BEST PHANTOM THIEVES ON THE EARTH!!!!!

P.S.: Sorry for my bad english, couldn't decide, if I should write this review on English or German, so yeah xD

Edit: I give this game a 10/10. Loved it. Always will love it. <3

author: 30b79fb54fc25393aa947c0ff8a29aaa
content:
This is not a cheap muosu games where you just slash everyone with no story or anything. I bought this game expecting the game to be like all the muosu games where there is a big roster and map and you just beat the crap out of everyone

first hour into the game I found it is completely different. The combat mechanics is the same but this is still a persona game with almost all the elements from the previous persona 5 game. there are still lovely conversations between the thieves and the side stories like dining out or going on a stroll . 

In the battles you can use the normal combat system from muosu games but also the persona skills. When in combat if you are any of the thieves you can use their personas skills to deal elemental or physical damage and if you are playing as the Joker, you can pick any persona you have and use their skills. You can obtain personas by chance if they drop a mask if you defeat them. You can also create personas by fusing other personas. 

Persona 5 had confidants level where you can increase their level by interacting with each person but in this game, they introduced bond level instead. Any interaction with the phantom thieves increases the bond bar. with every level you get 3 bond points that you can spend on any skill you would like. There are many skills t obtain and the skills itself can be leveled up so thats a great way if you want to focus on magic boosts or like healing bonuses and any different build you think of . 

if you enjoyed persona 5, you will enjoy this 100% . don't take this game as cheap muosu game, its another persona 5 game but with real time combat instead of turn base. I am currently 13 hours in the game and just finished the first chapter of the game and starting the second one. 50$ for this game is great price for what the game has to offer. 

100% recommend this game

author: e16fbab34d265d3e98a42b80622aeef8
content:
Think Person 5 if it were an ARPG with a ton more enemies per battle and you get this game.

I'd like to note that I'd recommend playing P5 before this as this story is basically a continuation of P5. For those wondering this game has a lot of dialogue so far, my first 2.5 hours were spent in dialogue, the rest in running around and fighting. 

The soundtrack is essentially the same, if not slightly tweaked and revamped from P5 which already had a kick-ass soundtrack. Controls are easy to get accustomed to (on an actual controller and not my KBM). 

Do be warned, from what I read before I purchased this game the default, out of the box AA sucks and it's best to use your GPU's settings to force a better AA. Also for those that have anything north of a 60hz monitor it won't do you any good, this game is capped at 60 FPS, but I don't think this game is too terribly difficult to run. My 5700XT/3600x with everything maxed out in-game, and in the GPU control panel I'm easily getting a constant 60 FPS. 

The combat is fluid, no hiccups, stutters, nada just hack away and have fun.

author: f1d7dbcc2ad851bba56c7ced7e4392cf
content:
Sadly I can't recommend this at present.

But first, before getting to the very specific reasons why, some of the many positives:
[list]
[*]It's by far the best Warriors-type game out there. The idea to just fully remove the big mass combat maps sounds crazy and like it would completely break such a game, but it turns out it does just the opposite, it makes the combat able to use far more abilities and intricacies because there's only 20-30 enemies now, not 400-1000.
[*]Persona 5 oozed style at every corner, and this carries the torch perfectly. Even the menus are - once again - overstylized to hell and back, the game is full of fancy animations, all fitting the theme.
[*]Speaking of theme, wow the audio is even better than P5 or P5R. It really raises the bar for such games.
[*]Combat is surprisingly challenging depending on difficulty chosen, because counters, interactions and avoidance have a lot of meaning and you can die in 2-3 hits if you use the wrong character at the wrong moment.
[*]The story - as far as I can tell yet - is quite good, and easily blows anything any Warriors game has done before out of the water.
[/list]

So, why no recommendation? Well, there's the problem that a significant amount of people experience quite frequent crashes to desktop. Sure, most games exhibit these for some hardware configurations but here it seems more that a majority see them, most people just rather rarely. And some people see them a lot. Also from reports around the web it seems those who have the accidentally released denuvoless version installed do [b]not[/b] suffer from these crashes. 

So what I'm trying to say is: You may want to hold off until they patch out Denuvo.

 잡은거 또잡고 또잡고 한무반복... 
이게 상당히 스트레스를 받는지라 크래시 수정 되지 않는 한 비추천이 추천으로 돌아갈 일은 없을 거 같다라는 종평.

author: c2679868ae635c9db97966b885741344
content:
You wanted to buy Persona 5 Royal?
You fool!

At the time I'm writing this review we don't even have an announcement, BUT we have Strikers.

First of all I want to clarify something, I played Persona 5 Royal and I know the story that brings our beloved group of Phantom Thieves to the events of this story but you don't need to play P5 to understand this story.
Actually many things change and in the game there are only some quotes that remind to Persona 5.
The only thing missing (for obvious reasons) is the developement of the characters that were already in Persona 5.

But after this introducion, how is the game?
Good I should say, at first it seems like the cheap copy of Persona 5 (at least to me) because of many small differences, but in reality this game has an identity of It's own and It's a pretty one.

The biggest thing that changes from P5 is the gameplay, It's not a Jrpg and It's not turn based, this is actually a mousou, so you have lot of action packed in large areas with inhuman quantities of enemies.

The combat is imo well structured and well made, this results in a very fun to play experience, not too easy not too difficult.
Speaking of difficulty and levels of it, they are more or less the same as P5, the game doesn't change but the damage you and your enemies deal changes, it means that sometimes to pass throught some areas or bosses you might need to tryhard, but it's doable and, as I said before, in a pretty fun way.

I won't get into the story but I really apprecitated Zenkichi and Sophie, they're pretty good characters :)
Overall I just enjoyed the story ^^


This thing is getting longer than I first thought so let's go very quickly.
The game runs wery well and It's not that demanding but I encountered 3 crashes so make sure to save a lot.
The ost is just incredible, every song comes at the right time and every song is so good imo (I kinda looped this ost for a while and It's so good).

So in the end, this is a very good game but it may be not worth 60€ for someone, if you like Persona and action stuff, I think you'll like this one.

Vote? Nah, It's just a very good game ^^

content:
Ok, first of all i give a thumb up just because there isn't a mixed option.
The game itself is really good, the gameplay is basically a Musou like any other but with a persona flavour to it, so if you're into that kind of gameplay it's your stuff (also if you're a fan of persona, then you'll enjoy the artwork, soundtrack and characters).
But there's a huge but coming from a long fan of the series: the whole social, life and dating sim part is totally missing, no romances, no socialing, nothing that literally made the Persona franchise what it is, i guess that the game also is named Strikers, but that doesn't mean that you should completely remove 50% of the game.
I'll give the game a 7 out of 10 just because of that!

author: e9fcc4f4faa259a4b84fef9dfd90ca49
content:
TLDR: Finished Persona 5?  Get this.  Never played Persona 5?  Probably not for you.

If you've played Persona 5 and are on the fence about this because of it being Dynasty Warriors combat, take the plunge.

The combat is actually way more Persona than I expected.  In fact, for difficult fights I spent way more time hitting the Persona button, exploiting weaknesses, switching characters to heal/buff, etc.  In any event, as someone who usually really doesn't care for DW, I found the combat in the game pretty enjoyable.  The dungeons were at least as interesting as anything P5 was doing, too.

Unlike typical DW games, the draw here is the story.  This one is a direct story sequel to the Persona 5.  If you liked that story and want to just hang out with the dudes again on a road trip around Japan doing Phantom Thieves stuff, then play this game.  You don't get the time management social game from the mainline Persona games, but you get a full-fledged, consistent with Persona 5, sort of on-rails story.  It's really solid.

One other thing that I didn't really expect, the general presentation of the game is also pretty consistent with the quality of Persona 5.  The wild animations, menus, punk rock aesthetic, the music, voice acting... it's all here and it's very much a continuation of what P5 had going on.

All that said, with how much time and energy is spent on a story that assumes you played Persona 5, even if you really dig the combat for it's own sake, this is only really for people who have played and finished P5.  The story here is good, but it does not at all stand on its own 2 feet.  Tons of references to the events of P5 and definitely an assumption that you're already familiar with the cast.

author: b85c3ad113f35ba594fcbcdcdf1b767a
content:
Wait for some stability updates to come to the game (if they come at all). The game's a lot of fun and breaks from a traditional musou title, story so far has been great, etc., but the port itself is awful.
-Loading times are inexcusably bad. It takes a minute and a half to actually get ingame, and pretty much every scene transition takes about ten seconds. I am playing this game on an RTX 3080 with an i9 10900k on an SSD, it's absolutely ridiculous that this doesn't load pretty much instantly.
-I've had the game crash to desktop with no error code/warning three times. First was at the very beginning of the game, but the other two crashes were after I had made significant progress in a Jail.
-Anti-Aliasing is of poor quality and causes the text to become blurry.
-Framerate is stuck at 60. Not sure if they tied game logic to framerate, but if it's possible to update it that'd be cool.

I'm really hoping that somebody at Atlus takes the time to fix these issues and this isn't a traditional quick PC port where they dump it on Steam and forget about it, because the game itself is great. And even if it doesn't matter in the grand scheme of things, I'll definitely update the game to recommend it if they at least fix the loading/crashing issues.

author: abf379b75ea955d095152439cdbdea36
content:
So right off the bat the game is great, solid 8 or 9 out of 10, and if you think you'll like it, or even if you're on the fence, I'd recommend picking it up at some point. 
It is quite rare for me to purchase a game at full price after a release, but I want this release to do incredibly well so that atlus, and by extension sony, will see the profit and bring games like persona 5 royal(please), God of War, Bloodborne, etc more quickly to pc. This being said I won't be softening any criticisms below whats here is a genuine face value of the game.

Animation, story, and interaction
-This game is purely more persona 5 with it's character interactions. Given there is no confidant system or romance options, so waifu wars don't work here, but if you enjoyed the casual phantom thief bits from persona 5 this is a treat.
-The music is purely high quality stuff, mostly all of the new tracks written for this game sound great. From the first prison's music to the final bosses it's all persona standards, and even if you aren't a fan of it, the game allows any persona music to be the main soundtrack.
-Most of the animations are pretty well done, primarily the new showtime special attacks are beautifully done, each character has their own unique animation matching their personality. Honestly Joker has the most basic sadly because of his many persona options.

The Gameplay    
 Perspective of a playthrough on hard first time using a ps4 controller via an xbox controller layout

Frankly I love the combat style of this game, it advertises itself as being a hack in slash, which by technicality is true. Coming from a hard difficulty perspective, I entirely believe that hard is the best way for this game to be experienced. 
Basic attacks and combos --- Basic attacking is unique to each character however they all share similarities. Combos are all simple at face value being either   X-Y    X-X-Y     or   X-X-X-Y                 but they can get depth from stringing them together, but what makes the combo system unique is how each of those inputs will cast a persona skill, whether it be a buff, debuff, or skill. These combos likewise use no precious sp, so in longer fights they are instrumental so that joker doesn't develop magic dysfunction as the boss pulls out a second health bar. 

More advanced unique movesets ---  each character has specially made attack animations and mechanics and I will attempt to list them here without any spoilers. Some overlap but that's to be expected
Joker- has a basic dagger gun moveset based around getting quick persona combos
Ryuji- focuses on charged hits that deal incredible damage, and can prevent staggering with a self buff
Ann- Can imbue her whip with fire that allows her to deal with an enemies weakness from basic attacks
Morgana- simple normal moveset, becomes car for special moveset. nuff said
Yusuke- Is based around unique combo counts, where Y activates a parry frame, and if successful he can add more hits to a combo counter
Haru- Purely aoe strength, her persona combo strikes are large and lingering and all of her hits are powerful
Makota-buffs her large combo attacks with nuclear, uses johana to ride down enemies with X-X-X-Y
Futaba has the same role to the point of redundancy. The largest change is the added support where she increases showtime gauges

Counterstrikes
Not only is this my favorite track in the game against japanese ironman lol, but it is a skill in the new bond system that I quite like. This skill means any last minute dodges allow the character to immediately retaliate with a persona attack. Get this skill immediately it is incredibly satisfying.

Thief dash aka area hopscotch 
-dash to a piece of scenery and interact with it dealing damage of a certain type. Honestly I really like this system, I like the little differences in character the interactions show, and it gives the player more control over the terrain. All bosses use the interaction really neatly as well with the least creative being the final boss who I won't spoil

Okay now time for the nitpicks
The slightly bad 

Spammed with tutorials at the beginning - LIKE DEAR GOD the first few hours of the game you won't escape these things. It's like they were stalking me waiting to pop out from a corner EXCUSE ME SIR WOULD YOU LIKE TO KNOW ABOUT BURN. Like they serve a purpose but if you already know how the status works from persona 5 you will get annoyed fast. Doesn't help that they give you messages about EVERY character when you switch to them, which playing all of them from the beginning, it gets irritating fast.

The game always has you fighting with 3 other ai controlled phantom thieves unless you take them off of your party, and I would discourage doing this. Usually the ai are protected from their own stupidity by generous I frames and resistance to attacks, and they seem to avoid using sp..........Unless they are healing
               
HOWEVER, some times the ai just get in your way, they will die like idiots and leave you fighting alone, just because the game didn't save them. Like for instance, and I'll avoid spoilers, but one boss creates stupid walls of lasers to hit you, and these things move incredibly slowly. I'd have to drop my controller on the floor to get hit by these things, but the ai will not avoid them. They don't understand that the back of the platform is the only safe spot so they stand there and get whacked. It's honestly infuriating.

-So this is a genuine problem but a strange one. So this game lacks all interaction with side characters who weren't phantom thieves, so there is no takemi or iwai in this game which is already pretty sad. Instead their shops are combined into a shop Sophie runs from wherever the thieves are at that moment. Now breaking the disbelief that sitting in the middle of an island a delivery could get there in a matter of moments, this shop seems like a good way to get the thieves items from anywhere. The problem lies in the amount you can buy, as the amount is always from 1-4 of an item, including healing(I think the most is a 120 heal later in the game which you can get 4 of at a time). Throughout the game this isn't an issue, it works well in fact to stop you from skyrim healing through every fight, BUT AT THE END, there is a gauntlet of tough refights with bosses as well as dangerous shadows for the postgame content. This practically requires decent health resources as well as sp items, but the only way to restock this dumb shop is by spending time in the metaverse, but not just that winning fights. That means you have to run through an area killing everything several times over to get the heath resources needed to beat some of this tough fights. The shop also contains incredibly rare cooking items, specifically that POS coffee bean that is never there but is needed for 2 post game special recipes, so get to grinding that last area. I swear if the enemies in that last area weren't pushovers to a grenade launcher I would have lost my sanity

-This game has no Satanael. None of the awakened personas from persona 5 are here, every single member of the main cast has their originals, Morgana still has gorro, Ryuji still has captain kid, Ann has Carmen, Haru, has M'lady etc. It's pretty mentally annoying especially since Morgana HAD to become max rank as a confidant, and thus had to have an evolved persona.

Okay THE REALLY BAD
-The game has a bug where it softlocks after a particular boss...... This did not affect me but it is worth noting
-There can be infinite loading screens........This did not affect me
-The game doesn't start for some people
- And finally the most annoying one, this thing crashes randomly in loading screens, and it's painful and this one did affect me. I had to live in fear half the time because I had made significant progress, and a visit to Lavenzia could outright delete that time spent. It was frankly awful and has not been patched as of this review.

author: 13ec6db700145a769b2f09b111e7137b
content:
Great music as always, with classic remixes and top tier new tracks. Story is a little better than expected out of a spinoff game, though the fact there are no mentions of Royal content whatsoever is disappointing. The core gameplay is actually really fun and not as much of a deviation from traditional combat as you'd think, and it really highlights how cool the Phantom Thieves are meant to look when moving and fighting simultaneously as a team. The Personas available feel very limiting (especially the late game ones) but fusion is relatively in depth and fun to play with. The "real life" exploration is also constricted but the different settings the game takes place in are charming and nice to have to make the game feel more like a mainline title.

My only major complaint is the crashing, which is a complete pain in the ass in a game without autosave. Save often! Other than that, there are only a few small annoying issues, such as shop items having incredibly low stock, money being a major bottleneck even after 80 hours + full completion, way too many BOND skills, and Persona stat changes feeling useless.
Overall, P5S is a fun game that Persona 5 fans will almost certainly have fun with.

author: ab929e20b4b05e35b4cc1c8588a9dcd2
content:
An amazing game through and through. I loved the story, the characters old and new, the English voice acting which I am so glad Atlus waited until the English cast finished their recording despite the pandemic (Taylor Harvey playing persona 5 strikers’s Sophie is such a great fit).  Finally the message Persona 5 strikers delivers. From the start I had worries of it being very slow pace due to how it set up. But once it kicks in. Oh it kicks in all right.  

As for the gameplay. For me personally the warriors style game play does get a bit repetitive during the ending just spamming magic and just using sp items to do more magic rinse and repeat but as a Dynasty Warriors fan. It’s just so much fun. I really enjoyed it and would recommend those who are fans of persona to try it out or those who are interested in the warriors famoula (just a warning might want to start on hard since normal feels far too easy). Sure it’s not your jrpg but for the plot and message it brings. Persona 5 Strikers is really worth the pick up. 

Finished it with all achievement done and would do it again. I might just come back for it for a merciless run but as of right now the show’s over 😊 highly recommend. Thanks, you Koei, Omega Force, Sega and Atlus for bringing such a masterpiece over to the west.  Now where is my persona 5 strikers 2 because I crave please, persona 4 or 3 strikers anyone?

One of the best games on Steam. 
- It is NOT a Musou. This is a Persona Action RPG, so think real time action, and then add all of the Persona unique systems such as Weakness, All-Out Actions, and Persona 5's gunplay. There are very light social elements and the focus is once again on the Phantom Thieves and antagonists' personal lives.

If you like Persona, you will like this. If you like action games as-well as Persona, you will LOVE this.

author: f818138a56fe56d18df3176dba2da17a
content:
Initial Thoughts/The Story: Firstly, let me say this game is absolutely incredible! It's a fantastic follow up to vanilla Persona 5. And if you haven't had the chance to play either Persona 5 or Persona 5 Royal then you can pretty much jump into this game semi-blind, there are a few things spoiled but nothing too major I'd say. I didn't think this game would be all that great when it was first announced but after playing it and beating it today, I can say it's a lot better than I anticipated. Especially as this is technically a spin-off. I can confidently say that this game is the best possible sequel to Persona 5 we could receive. Atlus and Koei Tecmo really out did themselves.

The combat/gameplay: Gone is the Confidant/Social Link system from previous main Persona games and in their stead comes a story progressed system. The game does not overload you with confidants and stats to raise (which in my opinion is a great thing!) as the game progresses with the story and doesn't move on until you're ready, so you can spend what would be considered two separate days in Persona 5 just grinding in the jails as Persona 5 Strikers will not move on until the next day until you're ready and have finished what you want for that day. Next are the Bond Skills. These essentially replace confidant abilities and offer so much variety in gameplay. You can invest your points into skills that: increase your health and sp (something I seriously recommend for later on in the game), allow you to crack open safes that contain decent loot, increase your physical and magical attacks, allow your allies to heal you from alignments, and more! These bond points are a welcomed feature in my eyes! Now for the big thing: the new combat system. I must say, I haven't played a warriors-styled game until now but I am pleasantly surprised with the results. Gone is the JRPG turn-based combat system. You now have to partake in essentially horde/wave battles, something I think fits the Persona series quite well. You get to wreak loads of havoc, unleashing powerful and swift attacks onto oncoming hoards of mindless shadows. I especially love how time freezes when you're using your personas, it gives you plenty of time to plan out your attacks and make sure you utilise the best skills possible. I really like the new combat system and honestly believe the Persona series should utilise this going forward. Showtime attacks are also a feature (I think I may prefer the Royal showtime attacks however), they don't do much damage initially to bosses later in the game, however there is a bond skill that increases the amount of damage that showtime attacks does (something I seriously recommend you invest your points in).

New Characters: I know for a fact I'm not the only one who wishes this game followed Royal's timeline rather than vanilla's, but the absence of Akechi and Sumire are made up for with the two new party members of this game: Sophia and Zenkichi. I can say without a doubt, these two characters are great additions, they're so comedic and powerful additions to the Phantom Thieves. If I'm being honest, I prefer how these two characters were handled and implemented into the story rather than how Atlus dropped the ball with Sumire in Royal. They flow really well into the story and their eventual arcs are intriguing all the way. Not to mention they provide a unique sense of freshness for the already established cast. All the characters work well off each other and you can tell they've grown even closer during Joker's six month absence. Sophia is a more cutesy addition whereas Zenkichi is the more comedic addition. As I have previously mentioned, both new characters are fantastic additions to the PT cast and I hope to see them return in an eventual Persona 5 Arena game or even another P5 related spin-off.

Cons: Unfortunately, no game is absolutely perfect, this game does have some striking (no pun intended) issues. The game crashed for me around three times in total, mainly during the end of the second jail, specifically when I had finished the trauma cell (so just be careful about that as you may experience this issue for yourself and lose some progress). Next is an issue where some of the keys decided to stop functioning. There is a simple fix for this issue: simply just press the windows key and go out the game and go right back in. Even though this was easy to fix, it was still a hindrance, especially as it happened during the final boss! Although this isn't an issue that has affected me, some people are reporting that some of the characters voice's differ in audio quality, I personally couldn't tell the difference and thought the audio sounded perfect for everyone. I do understand some people may be able to tell considering the voice lines were recorded at the actor's homes using a kit provided to them. But like I said, I couldn't tell the difference so it doesn't effect me.

Final Thoughts: Finally, I bought the digital deluxe edition of this game so I could play it early, and my playtime ended in a whopping 60:04 hours. It took me a little longer than maybe some other players as I decided to really focus on the side requests/activities. I fought many bosses multiple times to grind for money and xp (I recommend the Seth fight if you want to farm an easy 10k xp) and just really focused on the requests (something I never expected I'd do). I also spent a lot of my time going for most of the achievements, some are locked behind Post-Game and NG+. I managed to get most achievements I wanted and they were actually fun to get, none of them were too annoying and required a lot of patience to get. So I'm sure trophy hunters will be pleased to here this. The story is phenomenal and really is Persona 5 2, I cannot recommend this game enough to existing Persona fans and newcomers to the series, if you want to experience something P5 related but can't get any of the main games, GET THIS ONE! It's such a joy to play thought, the characters, the world, the gameplay, and especially the music! Lyn and Lotus Juice once again knock it out of the park with the amazing songs that are in this game. I am leaving this game with some of my favourite Persona songs: songs such as Daredevil and Counterstrike are just phenomenal. If you haven't heard them yet I suggest looking them up on Youtube. I love, love, love, love this game's OST and think it's one of the best in the series (mainline and spin-offs included). If you're debating on purchasing this game, then as I die-hard Persona fan, I say go for it. Take the leap and just play this game. It's a wonderful experience. And whilst it may not be as long and as intricate as vanilla P5/Royal, it's still a fantastic experience even though it's half as long as vanilla P5. Definitely pick this game up. And I hope many more Persona games make their way to Steam so newcomers have more games to try to further push themselves into this fantastic series.

Score: Pretty much expected if you've read all of my review so far but I'm going to give Persona 5 Strikers a perfect 10/10 (despite the cons I have previously listed). Please try this game if you ever get the chance it's an experience you do NOT want to miss. Thank you for reading my review and thank you to Atlus and Koei Tecmo for creating such a brilliant sequel to Persona 5.
