author: a4729b43aab05f7aae5acd568850f8c0
content:
I genuinely really like this game. It's significantly better than other Warriors styled games I've played in the past (though BOTW: Age of Calamity was just as good as this game, I'd say) and it manages to retain Persona 5's style really well despite being so different gameplay-wise. Once you get the hang of it, the battle mechanics of this game feel really fluid and satisfying to pull off, and while these types of games are known for being spammy, I think with the amount of variety between each playable character and the varied settings you encounter, the game does a really good job with not becoming stale. I think that the character interactions are fun and that the plot progression was more well developed than I was expecting out of a Warriors-type spin off. It really felt like I was playing Persona 5 and the only thing that was different was how I hit things.
The reason I'm currently not recommending this game (a reason I'm gladly willing to change my recommendation for if fixed in the future) is because it crashes and softlocks itself far often. I've made an obsessive habit of saving after literally every small action I take because every time this game has to load something in, there's an unnecessarily high possibility of it crashing. At the time of this review, I have about 35 hours in this game (end of the 5th jail) and I was having a really good time with it, until I reached a point after a boss fight where loading in from the metaverse softlocks the game. I know it hasn't crashed because the game still responds if the controller is disconnected, but I'm otherwise met with a black screen I cannot hope to progress from. From the research I did into this issue, it seems my computer isn't the only one softlocking at that exact point in the game.
I implore Atlus/ Koei-Tecmo to patch the game so that the PC port is actually functional, because I think it's a real shame they let this great game be released while this broken.

author: d7b710a8f2635443985907b33c2afa12
content:
Despite having some criticism of the game, overall I'm having a lot of fun playing it.

Going into the game I heard it was a cross between Dynasty Warriors and Persona. Playing it feels like neither.

Combat itself is similar to Dynasty Warriors but lacks the feeling of big epic battles. Instead of large scale battles you have fixed encounters as if you were exploring a palace in persona 5. The combat is supposed to be fast paced but a lot of the time you end up opening menus to cast spells or switch your persona.

A lot of what you'd expect in a Persona game is here but parts of it feel empty and missing. You have most the systems you'd except like fusing and elemental weakness and resistances however there are no social links. In fact there's not much socializing at all in this game.

There's a bond meter with the Phantom Thieves as you play through the game and clear side quests but that's about it. If you were hoping to see a large cast of returning characters it's a bit disappointing. All the Phantom Thieves are here and I did get to go for ramen with Ryuji but personally I always found the non-playable characters more interesting.

Overall the game feels very Persona lite, hits a lot of what I want but is unsatisfying in some ways. If you're looking for Persona 5-2 this is not that game. If you just want to hang out with the Phantom Thieves again this game scratches that itch.

author: 8a5d8b50058d589fb8ffe6bfcb64f7ab
content:
Can't speak on this port of the game as when it originally launched, I had frequent crashes. However, having since played the PS4 version of the game I can confidently say it is an incredible game. A true sequel to the base version of Persona 5, P5S is an absolute perfect blend of both Dynasty Warriors gameplay and Persona gameplay, in a way that I have not seen from any other "warriors" type cross over game to date. 

Though the combat system has changed entirely to a hack and slash action RPG style game, it still manages to maintain a lot of the systems that made Persona 5 what it is, such as the baton pass, Persona fusion, elemental weaknesses, one mores and even adding Showtime attacks which mimic their Persona 5 Royal counterparts. On top of this, you still have the typical Persona gameplay of wandering about various parts of Japan and spending time with your buds, as you would expect, but this time without the time constraints. 

Another aspect that thoroughly impressed me was the story, though it is "just a crossover game" it is not treated as such and given the full seriousness and treatment of a sequel to Persona 5. With a fully fleshed out story, two fantastic party members with their own story arc and all the character development from P5 that makes Morgana a bearable addition to the cast now! 

You get the full on Persona experience and the full on Dynasty Warriors experience with this game, the best of both worlds with no shortage on either of them. So if you're a fan of either game, I highly recommend this game. The only thing I will say is go play Persona 5 Royal first, as you will lose a lot if you haven't played that game first.

author: a6d55403ede45086b31765cd7b486e4a
content:
Persona 5 Strikers - это как долго не видеть лучшего друга, а потом отправиться с ним тусить весь день и всю ночь. Забавно в этом контексте, что я прошел игру за 25 часов. Почти сутки с одним из любимейших игро-друзей.

Фаната оригинальной пятерки, которым я являюсь, она заставляет визжать как абсолютнейшая фанбойная сучка. Тут тебе и знакомая музыка в ЛеБланке, и полюбившиеся раньше персонажи, и знакомые места в начале игры.... П5, какой бы долгой она ни была, оставляет после себя сильное желание срочно получить добавки, и вот она! Ничего лучше нет, чем со своей шайкой rebellious подростков (теперь не только подростков) колесить по Японии и менять сердца людей.
Если в прошлой части врагами были какие-то совсем уж черти, то в этот раз нарратив больше про травму и поиск своего места в жизни. Все это с обязательными разговорами про сердца, дружбу и поиск правильного пути. А в конце, конечно, драка с богом.
Старые персонажи раскрываются еще больше, а оба новых сначала раздражают, но у каждого есть момент, после которого смотришь на них и такой: "блин, вот они крутые, друганы мои".
Колесишь с друзьями из одного города в другой, ходишь за покупками, ешь вкусную еду, всячески тусишь, а попутно спасаешь судьбу всего мира. Идеальные летние каникулы, всем бы такие.

В плане геймплея даже забавно, как игра отошла от размеренной пошаговой боевки и метнулась в совершенно противоположное русло, в котором ты постоянно выкашиваешь целые толпы врагов. Ни разу еще не играл в жанр Musou, но знакомство прошло успешно, и новый стиль игре идет. В самых напряженных ситуациях бывает сложно вообще различить, что на экране происходит, пока тебе еще надо и уворачиваться и использовать скиллы персон, но в целом все весело и задорно. Хотя бывают странные моменты, когда бьешь босса, персонажи с ним о чем-то говорят, а их голоса заглушают звуки ударов и музыка с вокалом.
В целом все как и раньше: фьюз персон, закупка лечилок (теперь можно еще и еду готовить), расчет уязвимостей и резистов. Еще есть реквесты для метаверса, но интересно выполнять лишь те, что выдают тебе друзья, потому что остальные сводятся к гринду, хотя некоторые скиллы без них не получить.
Скучаю разве что по внесюжетным тусам с членами команды и романсам, но должно быть сложно в таком забитом графике вытащить рамен поесть кого-то отдельного, да и возможность сходить на одно свидание с Футабочкой все же есть.

Из минусов могу назвать разве что несколько вылетов ни с того ни с сего, и лично для меня то, что Ивай и Такеми куда-то тоже свалили на лето. Я бы с ними хоть на пару строчек диалогов повидался. С одним в оригинале сдружился, другую вообще романсил.

В общем идеальное лакомство для фаната, но если доступа к П5 не имеете, то тоже можете сыграть. Такого воодушевления не почувствуете, и пара сюжетных моментов мимо пройдет, но все еще очень веселый опыт. 10/10 боже дайте еще.
Тем более, как мне сказали в конце, "Until next time, Phantom Thieves".

author: fa31e970097b5dd0ac6096a6974fd80d
content: Ah, Persona 5 Strikers, where do I even begin. I love this game, I love the combat flow, the gameplay, the music, all of it. A non-turn-based Persona game is something I didn't know I wanted, but something I absolutely needed. Being able to just go nuts and fight through hordes of enemies is satisfying in a way. The Dire Shadows are a nice challenge to overcome, unless you're like me who forgot they existed until the final boss and cheesed most of them. The requests section is also a nice feature, just going after small goals for small or helpful rewards that you can just choose to completely ignore if you're on a time crunch or just hate having fun. I like being able to re-fight bosses but I am still upset that you can't re-fight Cognitive-Joker. Like every warriors game though, your AI party members suck ass, but that's to be completely expected. They do what they need to do so you can go ham on the enemies and not have to constantly worry about yourself. Until you get into late-game or are underlevelled/powered, then that's just on you. Love Zenkichi/Sophia and who knows if we'll ever see them again. Breaking News: Reserve Phantom Thieves found dead in Miami.

author: 55070e4ebf655fd8a4636a62b182ee34
content:
去年刚上架就原价买了，到现在才通关，回来补个评论。总的来说还是不错的，尤其是对P5粉丝来说，剧情设定从当下比较热门的AI入手，最后讨论的核心点和P5原作也十分相似，吐槽一下爷又又又和全人类为敌了，不会下一部续作还是这个结尾吧，多来几次就不新鲜了倒是。
战斗方面因人而异吧，刚开始玩的时候觉得很新鲜，但到后面发现鸡肋的地方其实也不少。最好玩的应该还是双手剑的善吉，可惜后面沦为加buff工具人了。面具合成老传统了，有的面具对某种伤害免疫，打特定的一些boss时候很好用。最后的BOSS战做的不错，全员都上场了，就是我从头到尾就练了4-5个角色，其他都是打酱油的，幸好球体不打克制也能打，不然我就报警了。全员最后的总攻击动画也很燃，总的来说演出很有P5那味。
多的就不说了，总之吹爆就完了，坐等P5/P5R上架。Shut up and take my money!

author: 523bf4c348ce5004a841b7e2a3c4629d
content:
I may be bias in this review because of my love for this series.

I am enjoying this installment far more than I realized I would. The combat system introduced is great. I really hope Atlus continues on this path for the Persona series. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy turn based as much as any fan of that combat system, but having free range of movement while also being able to still obtain new persona's, summon current persona's, has been a great way to enjoy combat scenarios. 

Like any JRPG there is some repetitiveness, but I don't mind that, and I honestly don't think any fan of JRPG's should, as this is something we've done for however many years we've (fans of JRPG's) been fans of this genre. I'm enjoying the story, and I've basically put every game on the shelf until I complete this. 

I won't go into depth detail, because frankly, I'm not great at that. What I can do is give you my recommendation for this game tho. I am not disappointed with my purchase, and I can't wait to see how it ends. So happy to have the Phantom Thieves back with a new game.

-Phantom Thief Shinya

author: 54c0ab5ce5715e999b68e18dd87fd2c6
content:
Persona 5 Strikers é uma sequência direta de Persona 5/Royal em termos de história, mas praticamente um outro jogo no quesito gameplay. As batalhas em turnos são substituídas por um misto de combate tático com o já tradicional Musou da série Dynasty Warriors, remetendo bastante ao combate de Final Fantasy VII Remake (e até superando-o, na minha opinião).
O level design dos Palácios, as dungeons de P5S, é um pouco mais aberto, mas acredito que perdeu um pouco da qualidade nesse processo. Há poucos puzzles, alguns Palácios são demasiadamente curtos, e também senti que o formato repetitivo acabou tornando a experiência um pouco cansativa.

Os outros aspectos tradicionais da franquia Persona ainda estão lá, tais como a captura e fusão de personas e o social sim, porém, de forma bastante adaptada para um jogo mais linear que seu antecessor. Ou seja, nada de planejamento, datas, encontros e estudos, o jogo segue um único roteiro do início até seu fim, mas também deixando uma boa margem para exploração e numerosas sidequests. 
Apesar de todo conteúdo, a história principal é consideravelmente mais curta que Persona 5/Royal, tendo aproximadamente 40h de duração. Longo, você diria? Para o padrão normal, sim, mas é válido ressaltar que Royal possui quase 130h apenas com o conteúdo principal. No entanto, acredito que a duração deste game é a ideal, principalmente pela forma na qual a narrativa é apresentada.

Falando em narrativa, sinto que P5 Strikers replica muitos dos arcos já apresentados em P5, mas em outros contextos; a história como um todo acaba parecendo um "repeteco" do original, e apenas brilha nos momentos mais autênticos, como no caso dos arcos que envolvem os dois novos personagens, Zenkichi e Sophia. No mais, trata-se de uma história que deixará o jogador estranho ao universo de P5 bastante perdido; recomendo jogar ou assistir um resumo do game anterior antes de partir para este.

Os diálogos, a dublagem e a trilha sonora continuam impecáveis como sempre, vale a pena conferir o game apenas por esses três aspectos!

Resumindo: 

Um game excelente e uma boa sequência para Persona 5/Royal. Recomendo cautela a quem não conhece os jogos anteriores.
Porém, é um MUST PLAY.

author: 8f31f27337a5565880725effcbcc73c4
content: The real time combat took me a bit to get used to but this is, in every way that matters, a full on sequel to Persona 5.  It continues the story of the Phantom Thieves in a manner perhaps even more stylish than the original game.  You get to bond with each of your team mates, engage in various side quests, go on excursions, fight to soul-stirring music (at 60FPS), and take on a threat to the world as you go on a road trip around Japan.  What's not to like?  Unfortunately, as of this writing (in early March 2021), the game is plagued by persistent crashing on my system accompanied by occasional random slowdowns.  I save every change I get so I won't lose progress.  Hopefully they'll get these kinks worked out because I love this game.

author: 4a8b9a4641b45fb68532903b4486a423
content:
Picks up right where Persona 5 left off, which as a returning player from the original Persona 5 feels great. The game will probably make less sense for people who aren't familiar with the original Persona 5, but the gameplay is still solid regardless. 

There are a lot of QoL changes made in Strikers that just weren't there in the original Persona 5, some to accommodate the new Dynasty-Warriors type combat, while others are just generally nice changes (such as no punishment for returning to the real world from the Metaverse). 

Overall if you've played the original Persona 5 and don't mind the switchup in the core combat loop, I highly recommend this game. If you haven't played the original Persona 5, you can still enjoy this game for what it's worth but you may miss out on references made to the original game.

author: bd40c9727c5559a98bbb617388a9210e
content:
I only have one question. WHY IS THIS IN THE P5 TIMELINE? I'm genuinely curious why P5R isn't the canonical timeline. If you wanna see your favorite gymnast waifu, and edgey the hedgey detective friend I'm sorry to disappoint. She doesn't exist, and he's still dead the end. Also, there's no social aspect to the game no stats, no confidants, nough problem? 
Now speed round
Story good, but ending is...similar to persona 5's end.
Combat is good, but easily broken with 99 luck and mudo/hama with a mudo/hama boost. At least for mobs.
No romance... HOW DARE YOU!!!
Character well Ryuji must have joined the navy because he's cursin like a sailor otherwise new characters are fine, and old characters are consistent.
Game overall? Well i think it's a  fun concept that needs more polish. I would enjoy seeing another game like this more in line with the classic confidant system, some better "levels/dungeons", and be a little more polished combat wise.
Should you buy this game? Yes, if you're fine with royal not being a thing, turn based combat being booted, and no confidant/social/romance system. It is a genuine good time, and i would recommend it.

author: 94d4a8e668a0557dbb136dee3e015f17
content:
First things first, do NOT get this game if u have't played/watched Persona 5(royal) becouse its a direct sequel and u will enjoy  the game alot less if u have no idea what they are talking about most of the time.


Story.
Set a Half year after the events of Persona 5(not Royal) the Phantom Thieves come together to plan their one month of summer vacation only to be dragged into another Metaverse adventure as they discover that someone is stealing the desires of people(AKA brainwashing) and with the help of a police detective they go on a adventure all around Japan stealing hearts and kicking ass!

Gameplay.
In one word: Mindblowing.
The switch to realtime is making this game one hell of a slugfest while at the same time keeping the parts what makes Persona games unique in it, like using Persona abilities pauses the game allowing u to aim in piece and it also helps u make sense of it all, couse it can be quite chaotic at times, wich is this game only downside.

Outside of combat u explore the area's u are in, visit shops to buy items or do Requests while in your Hideout(mainly your camper) u can get ready for another  metaverse expidition by Cooking meals that give nice buffs or heals or visit Sophie's shop to get geared up.

All in all the game will take u around 40-50 hours but with New game plus also unlockable as well as Reckless Difficulty u can test yourself to your limits.

Music.
this part deserves special mention since the soundtrack is just unbelieveble good with remixes of various P5 tracks like Rivers in the Desert and Last Suprise and new ones like Daredevil and Grind Your Axe to listen to at just the right times.
The PC version also gives u ALL the previous Persona battle themes all back to persona 1 that u can switch to if u need something new,and u get the Persona 5 and royal tracks when u complete the game as well :)

All in all, this game is a must play for Persona 5 fans and really wraps up their story while also introducing u to some great new ones, and never really gets bored.
So a 11 out of 10 from me!

author: f8364623bc47533ba976569d2c814d51
content:
This game is great, its very much a mini sequel to P5, the story and all the new characters are all really interesting and kept me looking forward to playing after work each day, I've played a lot of musou type games and this one is a great blend of Personas turn based combat made real time and dialled up to 11, each character has their own style of play and combos then keep it interesting. Baton passes, 1 more attacks and all out attacks are all still there, even fusing new personas and collecting them from combat.

Overall if you enjoyed Persona 5 and/or Persona 5 Royal (this is a sequel to just base 5 though i believe), its well worth a buy if you don't like musou style games maybe wait till it goes on sale and give it a try, I'm having a blast so far.

author: 374dd78a938a5eabab6e1004bfb672d2
content:
Persona 5 Strikers is an excellent sequel to Persona 5!
The plot is not as thorough as the original game, but it's still very rich and full with content.
The gameplay, particularly the combat, is very fun and dynamic. The Persona style translated very well into an action RPG hack-and-slash game and its numerous team compositions and individual character builds make the whole game's experience very exciting and worthwhile!
If you played Persona 5 or Persona 5 Royal, this game is a must-play. If you haven't played either of them, you should play Persona 5 Royal and then you can come play this game.

content:
Persona 5 Strikers is the game where you get to cruise around Japan with all of the homies from the vanilla Persona 5. In some ways, it's like Final Fantasy 15 but less brokey and more combat.

This game is incredibly similar to the original game when it comes to story structure. Unfortunately, this one manages to be even more predictable, but I still liked the story, even though it had some low-low moments. ( that bath scene was sad )

Unfortunately, if you haven't played the original persona 5 or the royal version of it, you will not understand why these characters are important. In addition, you will, of course, receive spoilers for the original game.

The combat is fun, but you won't find DMC 5 levels of depth to it. That's fine, but the problem lies with the fact that, the combat becomes boring halfway through.
Meaning that if the game was shorter it would fit better or if the game had more to its combat it would fit the length of the game better.

This PC port comes with a few problems that we've had since day one, the best example being the very first load screen.
Whatever the reason, it takes a very long time to load in and sometimes it never happens.


This game is fine, but wait for a sale, also I highly recommend you stay away from it if you never played the original game.

author: 8fca3e23f82858c1b3d2057b3e907dfc
content:
This game is not a spin-off , this is a direct sequel to the original Persona 5.A really good sequel at that.
The story and characters are better than vanilla Persona 5 story (not as good as Royal) in my opinion.
The gameplay surprisingly fits well more than traditional turn-based combat.People say this is like Warriors combat and although that is true , this feels more like a fast-paced Final Fantasy 7 Remake's combat than traditional Warriors game.
Soundtracks are great , combat is fun , bosses require strategy and understanding of the system , characters are fun and the story is really gripping.
But I would not recommend this game to people who haven't play vanilla Persona 5.Since this is a sequel , a lot of the references will be lost to you and you won't be invested in the story and characters as much as those who have played the vanilla.

author: 41c9bd6219bf500ab98c467e0763052b
content:
[h1]Persona 5 Strikers is a good game[/h1]
[h1]But wait for a sale[/h1]

[u]Pros:[/u]
- All original voices are back (at least in English).
- New characters are good and feel natural to the P5 world.
- Persona collecting somehow still works despite the change in the combat mechanics.
- New locations and dungeons look great.
- Story doesn't completely suck despite it being a spinoff game.
- Zenkichi is best girl

Overall, I enjoyed Strikers a lot. The characters talking with each other felt as natural as it did in 5/Royal. Having the gang travel Japan was also a good decision, as it meant not being stuck in Tokyo the entire time (which they could've very easily done if they wanted).

[u]Cons:[/u]
-From a story standpoint, Royal is never mentioned. At all. Also, all non-party confidants (except three) never appear in the game.
-Game reminds you of romances, but doesn't actually care what you chose.
-Game doesn't do a good job of encouraging you to switch up party members, but still forces some party members in some select fights.
-Game isn't difficult (especially if you find the right item/bond build that allows you to mow over anything in the game).
-Lack of combo depth.
-Music is mostly P5 ost remixes with some new stuff (and overall, not as good as the original).
-Where is Igor?
-Play with a controller.
-Story doesn't understand it's own universe's rules.

To expand upon the last point, there are two times the game contradicts their own rules. First, in the first dungeon, it's shown that, besides the party, people enter the Jails as their shadows. However, the game breaks this rule several times, and doesn't explain why.
The second major gaffe: Morgana mentions at the very end of the game that its the "surprise of receiving a calling card" that causes Desires to manifest, similar to Treasures. This is just a flat wrong explanation of how the calling cards work from both P5/Royal, as well as from the same game.

As to the other points, the combat is basic and easy, and there are ways to break it (hint: Two things break shields. weaknesses and criticals) which makes combat a joke. I used Yusuke the entire game and wasn't really punished for it, which shouldn't be ok in a game that emphasized elemental affinities.

If you can get over these somewhat minor gripes, the game is fun. I would only recommend it if it gets a price cut or sale though.

author: 42e2a8e1b58f50e1958949cb56389178
content:
After a whole playthrough of the game, I can say that I really enjoyed P5S. There were some flaws, of course, but for the most part, it was nice to see the Phantom Thieves back in action.

Here's some Pros/Cons

Pros:
-Remixed music, including new tracks with vocals by Lyn Inaizumi
-Dual Audio (It's there if you want it. I'll stick with muh English)
-Familiar stylish UI
-Personas' properties (weaknesses/strengths/etc) are the same
-The game is a sequel and makes references to P5 Vanilla (Royal's 3rd Semester was not canon)
-The "musou" combat is delegated to a per-encounter basis. Ambush/Get detected by a wandering shadow, then more shadows pop out in a closed off area. Defeat, then move on.
-Stealth in a musou game. Who'd a thunk it?
-This game is Persona first, Musou second.

Some things to note:
-Game has a tendency to crash on loading screens (possibly due to DRM)
-Due to it being a sequel, it will contain some spoilers for P5
-Since P5R was not canon, Kasumi is not playable
-Story can also seem a bit underwhelming compared to 5, and not as long
-The DLC Personas of 5 are, of course, missing (they were DLC, of course)
-No social links [Replaced by Bond System. This gives you access to an array of perks, kind of like talents]
-Must beat game first to unlock Persona 5 and Persona 5 Royal battle themes ("Last Surprise"/"Take Over"), unlike the methods for Switch/PS4
-The system for jumping to pillars, chandeliers, etc is a bit awkward and can catch you mid-combo
-If the English voice track feels blemished or sounds off, the VAs recorded out of studio during the pandemic. It sounded fine to me with headphones on.

That said, most of the Cons are mild gripes. Except the crashing, but I blame that more on the DRM than I do the game.

But if you really want to see what the Thieves are like in action combat (which was pretty fitting for the cast), give it a try.

author: 89f46a2f6b0851f3a9148e00d66c536e
content:
I would say an 8.5/10. Great game, but I've had my own wave of emotions playing it.

In my opinion, the game plays almost nothing like a normal musuo game. This is *very* Persona feeling, it's just not turned based. Taking advantage of elemental weakness is still EXTREMELY important (like every persona game) and I find myself rarely combo-ing normal enemies and only using it during bosses. Once you have SP items available the combat feels more like Persona 5 completely. Combo-ing becomes near useless.

My thoughts on the story and dungeon designs, I think the first half of the game is considerably better than the end half. There's some depth that is skipped for the last half of the game that makes me feel like things were rushed, or it felt like they had to piece things together in the middle, like they knew what they wanted but needed something there. Especially the final area, it felt SUPER short if you compared it to the first or second. It surprised me how fast I got to the final boss.

I don't know what people mean, I've only ever crashed once while playing the entire game. If you're crashing that often I honestly think your computer just can't handle the game? The game is well optimized in my opinion. The only other issue I had was my controller while playing registered A B and X all as the same input. I had to assign my controller on steam and that fixed it.

author: bc9adcfd505a579097e2d70b904d9622
content:
I would give this a neutral review if I could and rate it a generous 3/5. It isn't bad but it also does nothing good. This is a spin off of the original Persona 5 release and really only performs well at giving more screen time to the cast. You could play this without first playing Persona 5 but it would be pretty pointless. The story isn't that good and neither is the gameplay. You are here for the cast you wouldn't even know. This also does not follow Persona Royal and the new character from that version is not here.

None of the side characters from Persona 5 are in the game outside of Sojiro at the very start and end of the game. None of your favorites from the social links return at best you might get one line of internal monologue from Joker acknowledging their existence. One other character does show up for maybe 10 lines and that's it. 

Social links themselves do not exist. Bonding points are here which you can use to level up skills that unlock during the main story. It's basically just a bar that goes up from pretty much anything you do without the main reason we did social links in the first place. Romance does not happen here but there are two bonding points in the game. But they are quickly forgotten and never mentioned again. 

The story is average at best. Basically a rework of Persona 5 with more changing of hearts. If you've ever played a JRPG or watched anime you likely can see where it is going. Entirely forgettable and just an excuse to bring the cast back together. This could be more forgiven if the gameplay was great but...

The Shin Megami Tensei series perfected turn based combat many years ago with the Press Turn system. Persona 5 being an actual spin off of the main series uses a modified system of it. Strikers throws out all of that for an action system combined with musou elements. The main issue is it is incredibly repetitive and gets boring quickly. Each character has a few basic combos, their gun and their persona abilities. They also each learn 4 arts from continuing to use them further making them more useful and unique. But the kicker is you are now using all this up against the musou style of gameplay with tons of waves of enemies. It starts interesting but quickly overstays its welcome. Regular mobs are fairly weak but mini and especially bosses are HP sponges. The weakness abuse/critical hits/technical hits all carries over but it just isn't much fun. After the second jail I lowered the difficulty from hard to easy just so I could see the story.

There are two new characters joining the cast. Both fit in nicely and enjoyed their dialogue during the story. They are even better in combat though. I would say they might be to good and you might not want to leave them out in favor of your past favorites.

There is no time management in this game so you can freely leave the dungeon at any point. But it is like no one bothered to play test the game. You can leave from any checkpoint to restore your HP/SP and even warp back to that same point. So why not just make the checkpoint restore these things without wasting our time leaving and coming back? SP itself is scarce at the start of the game. The further you go in the main story the more bond skills you unlock to increase ways of restoring it. But it should just naturally recover from using normal attacks.

The voice acting (Japanese at least) is great and so is the music. Several music remixes and I look forward to getting the OST. The game is just as stylish as Persona 5 from menus to the actual combat.

The PC port is not that great. I myself had three crashes in my near 32 hours but I hear some people had it way worse. The graphical options are bugged and you'd need to tweak them outside of the game. Also the game is locked at a max 60 fps but the cutscenes run at 30 fps which is very noticeable.

author: 48f1346560f25254948e1ec0fd434cf6
content:
Game is good, first time I've found the musou genre vaguely compelling! Port is rubbish: 3 to 4 minutes to start the game every time (as in, staring at a black screen for said several minutes before even the LOADING ICON appears), long load times during the game proper (15 to 20 seconds), which according to some sites: apparently stem from having installed DLC and Digital Deluxe Content. So don't buy those if you want manageable load times. In my case though, loading is still exactly as slow even after removing the DLC and uninstalling from HDD reinstalling the game unto my SSD. 

On a whim, I heard that downgrading the drivers to your video card might help matters, so I decided to log into GeForce Experience; and before I started downgrading I started up the game and this time the game loaded in TEN SECONDS! Excited, I exited the game and started it again, hoping that solved the problem but nope. It was back up to 3 to 4 minutes of black screen before the game loaded again. What the hell? What the ACTUAL hell? Everything was literally the same when I started the game both those times in that short span of time. Why.

I'm not the only one with this problem, and there are many others with various issues regarding crashing after long dungeons and the like. These issues/bugs may be address by a patch in the future but for right now: literally play any other version of Persona 5 Strikers instead of this one.

author: 2769a5c6db8754a1bb7c02c4ee76fd0a
content:
A fantastic game, better than you'd think for a spinoff, and surprisingly touching at times. Truly worthy of being called a Persona 5 sequel. 

Unfortunately, that's utterly irrelevant when the PC port is in such a shotty state. The game will randomly freeze up with no pattern or apparent cause--usually it'll recover on its own but even then you'll often have to wait minutes. It didn't happen to me in the first 10 or so hours, but ever since it's been happening with increasing frequency to the point that it's unplayable now. Tragic.

There are also other minor issues like DS4 rumble not working, analog inputs being snapped to the cardinal directions, a 60 FPS cap, blurry fonts at 4k, and settings that don't work without a restart (with no indication). 

Save yourself the hastle and buy the PS4 version (the Switch version does not run well, but that's a review for another day).

author: 6255cac308f35394b8f6f8d9ffd7b8bb
content:
Persona 5 Strikers was the perfect sequel to Persona 5, and a great game overall! P5S prioritised the combat, rather then the social aspects of the game and broke the tradition of Persona by giving it an Hack n Slash styled combat system - and it worked well. It feels different in a good way but it still feels like Persona 5 with weapons and personas, fusions, items etc.

The story was just as good as Persona 5 and it was the perfect addition to the Persona 5 storyline.

To whether your an Persona 5 fan, or just starting the series, the game is for you but I highly recommend you play Persona 5 first anyway to understand the lore about the cognition, characters, etc.

author: 30019043719e50cb953c4a8d895f5bf6
content:
One word of caution: this game has crashed at least once for me, and the game does not autosave. Use every opportunity to save — save at every checkpoint, and save every time you have free time.

Other than that, this game is fantastic. I've only [i]watched[/i] a playthrough of Persona 5 since I never owned a PS4 so I can't speak for how the game feels compared to P5, but I'm enjoying the hell out of this one. It might be a spin-off or a side story, but it's a good one. Instead of the usual Persona-style combat, battles are replaced with fast paced, small-scale Dynasty Warrior fights, and the battle music has been remixed to match. For everything else: the characters, the music, the style, the writing; it's all there. 

Well, almost. It's still a spin-off. There's no social links for example; during the free time segments, all you really do is walk around, shop for items and maybe talk to some party members for some basic dialogue, but nothing like in the main Persona games. That said, it's still an amazing game in its own right, as long as you don't expect a [i]true[/i] sequel.

Of course, if you've never played or otherwise experienced Persona 5, this game will feel alienating as you're missing huge parts of the story and the characters. Here's hoping the success of this game will prompt a proper PC version of Persona 5 Royal so more people can enjoy this.

author: 46db21fd8bec5ee0bdf7cb062a9cf5e3
content:
PERSONA 5 STRIKERS after a year or so of waiting finally we got our hands on a persona that is not exclusive for ps4 and i can tell you i immediately bought it for the pc master race :D and i can say that the game is a blast to play in term of music and new spin on the gameplay but there are some problems

cons:

- the writing is very poor and everything is super predictable

- the gameplay although fun lacks at some key moments

- i don't know if that was a problem for everyone but the sp management in this game is terrible there are barely any sp potions and you run out of sp so quick and there is no rest options like in the vanilla persona 5  so you have to get to a checkpoint then exit the dungeon come back and only then you will have a full hp bar and sp bar which is a total bummer for me :/

-the final boss was really meh

- the real world was really lacking and there was barely any options of going around and talking with random people yes i know that its a spin off but still everyone around feels like a dead puppet

- some performance issues such as fps drops and one hard crash at the wonderland dungeon

- the side quests were really forced boring and not that fun so after the third dungeon i just stopped doing them because it just felt like a chore at that point

-the game is a bit short for persona standards took me 30 hours to finish it

- there are moments where the game intentionally prolongs the game play with tedious fetch quest /main objective and it just felt as if they doing it because they ran out of ideas but needed to put more hours in the game

pros:

- the music holy h@ll the music i was having so much fun listening to it and was just such a delight and i think one of the best things in the game is the music

- animations look a lot better everything just looks and goes super smooth

- the new characters are super awesome and i really enjoyed the new addition to the cast

- the dungeon design is just super beautiful and finally they have some depth to them

in conclusion yea i know there are more cons than pros but still the game was super enjoyable and it is a spin off game for all the non Playstation exclusive gamer's so of course it wont be as good as a normal persona game but for what it is PERSONA 5 STRIKERS is a cool game to play for over the top dynasty warriors game play but it does lack in the other departments so my final score to PERSONA 5 STRIKERS is a 7.5 out of 10

author: 6bae5909f91b5c32b9185c6693209ca7
content:
Only Fans of Persona 5 can truly enjoy this game.

Dodging and Parrying (Yuske) feels very inconsistent. The Gameplay overall is mostly button mashing and battle of Attrition when it comes to Mini Bosses and Bosses.

Easy Difficulty: Mostly walk in the Park with fancy attacks.

Normal Difficulty: HP Spongy Bosses 2-3x bigger HP bar than Easy, if not more, that do not really require much strategy but spamming the weakness, stuffing SP Food in your face, since your Combo Persona Attacks, while damaging the enemy Poise, they barely make a dent in Boss Shields.

Hard Difficulty: Why even? The gameplay is to unrefined and chaotic to be a "skill challenge".

The Gameplay is not the strong point of this game, since it gets very repetitive.

But the Friendship Simulation is great.

author: 3e4ca202a4fe5dfeac05051661125852
content:
[b][quote]欢迎订阅我的「个人鉴赏家[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/11123770/] DEV RULES [/url]」
以及 [url=https://space.bilibili.com/2898054/]游戏实况[/url] 来观看我的更多“偏见想法”
[spoiler]希望有天能厉害到你会跟别人说： DEV？那是我朋友诶！[/spoiler][/quote][/b]

对比主机版的狗牙、低帧和急死人的载入速度，PC 版有种「近视后头次戴上眼镜并健步如飞」的感动。由于是续作又是外包，所以很多功能、场景、角色等都大幅缩水，没有通关前作也很容易不知所云，另外无双玩法对我来说也比较遗憾，但最可怕的还是定价，比主机版还高。其他的就都不错，剧情虽说不上有多完美，但也可以看成原作的延续。

强烈推荐补下 P5R，当你习惯了被现实踩在脚下，体会一下拥有力量反抗是种什么感觉吧。


【简单说一下 P5 是个什么样的游戏】


高中生主角因为从醉酒政客男手中救出了女子，反被冤枉，只好转学「更生」，期间遇上了很多现实社会中也很常见的事件。他们有的因为漂亮被老师骚扰，有的被当成小混混欺压，有的才能被利用压榨。还有品学兼优的学生会长，害怕外界的黑客宅妹，缺少关爱的富家女等等，这么一群被贴上标签的人，在抛弃了别人的看法，认清并接受真正的自己时获得了力量，开始将那些扭曲统统矫正。

我最喜欢的就是他们的敌人甚至包含了不愿思考，只想施暴的「无辜群众」，像极了微博、贴吧、邻里、父辈、饭圈，甚至 Steam 评测区里这种人也非常常见，既深刻又真实。

而 P5S 讲述了他们后来在暑假时发生的事。


*我永远喜欢新岛冴，还有放下双马尾的高卷杏。

*P5R 也赶紧上 Steam 吧。

*我很讨厌饭圈、精神股东、无脑吹捧，但我觉得 P5 真的有被宠上天的资格。

*歌曲还是很好听，但我仍然觉得 Lyn 的声线不太适合。

*能遇上这个系列真好。

*感谢 SEGA 以及 ATLUS 。

author: 1affd0af12ef58d2a7e862d0bb241fab
content:
This game is absolutely phenomenal.

I will start by saying that the Persona series is one of my favorite game series of all time, so it's not super surprising that I love this game. I was concerned at first that it was going to be more musou than Persona (as in, mostly focused on the combat rather than the story), but thankfully those concerns were immediately alleviated upon booting up the game. I'm not a huge musou fan, and I don't think I've ever unlocked New Game+ in a game that required you to do a bunch of extra stuff before, but I loved this game so much that I did every single quest and every single thing to unlock New Game+. The story really draws you in, and seeing all of the characters I love so much again made me so incredibly happy. I absolutely cried during the ending credits. 

The only issue I have with this game is the crashing -- I noticed it always happens for me on loading screens, and it can be extremely frustrating. Make sure you save as often as possible. Other than that, I have zero complaints. I love all of the new characters, the story, the music, the locations, the aesthetics, the cutscenes, everything. In fact, I love it so much that I started a new game immediately after completing everything in my first run! If you love Persona 5, this sequel is absolutely worth it. If you don't like musous, you can play on easy mode so you can just experience the story!

Now PLEASE bring Persona 5 Royal to Steam, Atlus!!!

author: 938dec730a4c5397aaff63c20de834a2
content:
This game is amazing!
A must if you played the original Persona 5 or Royal. While I initially had my doubts and worried this would be just a Musou-kind cash grab, it feels a lot more like Persona 5-2 would be like. The quirky characters, the second to none soundtrack and having a peek at more cities in Japan are all super enjoyable. If you've been to Japan, you'll immediately recognize Kyoto, Osaka, Okinawa and many more locations!

The battle system can be a bit tricky in the beginning (and very lengthy towards later bosses), but it rewards skills and planning, which is an additional metric to perceive progress in the game.

During my playthrough, the game only crashed once. I lost 15 minutes of progress, so make sure you'll save at every opportunity you have just in case.

I only feel sorry that this is a game that can be only fully appreciated by gamers who played Persona 5, it's sad that there is no port available just yet. 

Definitely recommended!

author: 2bc2221490bf58649ad786ee86d28cdd
content:
The game isn't bad, but the port isn't amazing. Even if you don't care about the weird anti-aliasing, after the 5th dungeon's boss the game just stops loading. It seems to vary person by person what gets you passed it, and I've tried them all unsuccessfully. Running the game as admin, disabling fullscreen optimization, running in Windowed mode, setting the game to run in Ultra low-latency mode in the Nvidia Control panel, reverting all of the settings to "application controlled" in the Nvidia control panel, and uninstalling all of the DLC.

The soundtrack coming in a separate application (not MP3s I can actually load on my phone) was already a bummer, beating the 5th dungeon's boss 6 times in a row to try and get past a glitch with the game is just inexcusable. 

- I did get past the issue by using a separate computer. Keep an eye out for any patches that may have resolved this issue but if you don't want to fight to get the game to run properly I'd still hold out.

author: 29e9ef416c6d58f8886f543a41ab0c77
content: A great follow up to Persona 5, definitely worth full price. If you haven't played the base game, I'd recommend starting with that first (if you dont have a PS4, you can emulate the PS3 version just fine). Combat is a typical Warriors style game, but with Persona quirks thrown in to enhance the experience. Music is a banger as always, and the story continues from the base game seamlessly. I have only had one crash, but other than that, there aren't any bugs as to my knowledge. Definitely worth $60, easy recommend

author: 93cd20d76c5c5a34b0be6746fb76551b
content:
This is 100% fan service game. Only get it if you really like Persona 5/Royal. If you do, get the BGM DLC as well because Persona 1 soundtrack is very good.

I complete the game in normal difficulty with all "late game" personas unlocked all some of miscellaneous achievements in 37 hours. This might be the minimum if you want to enjoy fighting as health bar is very very long for no reasons. When you have the game figured out, gameplay pretty much just drags out forever. 

The highlight for the game has to be the final boss because that makes the Musou part of this game shines. There's not a lot of enemies and more than often just hitting them will be way more enjoyable than spamming affinity then having 30s of getting off the jail and joining back. It gets very repetitive. But the two last dungeons are when difficulty spikes and you must play the game the right way starting from there. I don't think upping the difficulty would make the game any more enjoyable.

The story is an advertisement for Japan tourism. Enough said. 

If you want the game to be a bit more fun, max Haru first because she will destroy two last jails.

author: e393b1ed7ae95781840239103004e8d4
content:
Persona 5 Strikers - Review

Holy crap.

Fast paced, 1v1000 battles, with the persona 5 cast is a interesting combination that, surprisingly works well for what it does. 

| THE GOOD

Now, if you want something pretty, I highly suggest you take your time to look around each Jail, examining each little nook and cranny. 

The music is PHENOMINAL. And if you have the extra music pack, that just ADDS more to it. 

The combat is fastpaced, and the difficulty of each encounter just becomes more fun.  (Despite... some issues)

The story in this game matches Persona 5's, as this spinoff follows the aftermath of P5S. 

| The Bad

The scaling of HP of basic trash mobs seems... excessively high. And that's just basically it. 

I am NOT a fan of how many skills that stop you from moving. Specifically, it feels like Bufu/Zio, and the certain debuffs that stun you, need to be nerfed in effectiveness. Also, FUCK YOUR COUCH, Sleep. 

And the biggest elephant in the room?
The crashing. 

Yeah, no. This game has a powerful crashing fetish. 
And the stutters become evident in the game...


|The Rating

While the game has it's flaws, the characters are charming, the combat is exciting, and in general the game feels difficult without being cheap. 

My rating is Four Stolen Desires out of five.

Although we can't get every aspect from Persona, i think this game has enough to satisfy me. The soundtracks are banger as usual, especially the new ones.
 
All in all, Persona 5 Strikers is a solid game. 9/10

author: 0f633c2cb3a553f681fe67e4b9c576a2
content:
[h1]双平台双预购玩家，PS4已经通关，steam有点小贵。。推荐大家还是打折入手，毕竟只是个无双游戏，但是P5S在我的心里无限逼近P5[/h1]
在P5后出了P5R，可惜加的料我并不是很喜欢，剧情没怎么改动洗白明智，学妹边缘化加故事不太行，最终BOSS有点那味可惜还是比不上狮童，所以在P5S我仿佛看到了P5真正续作的影子
P5S发生在P5故事的半年暑假后，全新的剧情无双的战斗方式，终于有多大那么看头，开头的监狱让人耳目一新，虽然故事的观赏性是在P5上的，但是会让人感觉“哇好棒”，开始几个故事分别对应了杏、狐狸和春，尤其是春线，补足了之前P5出场太晚人物了解不够魅力不足的缺点，饱满了人物的同时并且以春做了一系列的成长故事，这个监狱和故事我愿成为前面几个的最好。比较可惜的是并没有我想的跟P5一一对应，不过好在有个反派对应了夏亚
说说我最喜欢的地方就是俩个新加的人物，那简直吊起来打明智和学妹，善吉觉醒剧情的冲击力不亚于P5的任何一个人的觉醒，对我简直太惊讶了，索菲亚虽然是个机器人但是人物性格鲜明，有人说wolf对应的明智，但是wolf的手段比起明智来那明智也太弱智了（哪怕是最终BOSS的政客和明智对比的话明智也是傻逼）从过往的经历到如今面临的选择，再到后面的转变，善吉的境况交待得很清楚，情绪与节奏的把握也十分到位
 与其说《5S》是一款无双性质的游戏，倒不如说是将无双的战斗体系作为一种精美的调味剂加入进来的JRPG佳肴。《5S》在继承了《P5》一直以来的UI 场景 立绘 过场 音乐的同时，光荣靠着自己用心的制作力成功的做到了青出于蓝而胜于蓝的地步。

说下我不太满意的地方吧，大和田明明有着最终BOSS的B格，却硬是变成了过场（虽然近卫明超帅），P5S的反派都是受害者反而获得能力去过度报复，反而我觉得丸喜能去P5S里？不太无双的无双虽然过度完美了P5，但是容易使人腻，日常的剧情被砍仿佛P5的精华没了，但是和《P5》一样，《P5S》的美术表现张力十足，足够帅气
不过总的来说，P5R的让我失望对比，P5S已经很好了，补足了春、真的性格完善，整体观感比P5R这作品强点，台词也是十分有意思，在索菲亚线和善吉线各自给我的冲击足够让我喜欢上他们，近卫明的战斗太帅了，这部游戏我最喜欢的战斗，让我想起了无印的最好BOSS战夏亚战，单角色塑造来说，本作应该无愧是无印的续作，反正怎么样都比P5R那游戏好多了
 5S的流程大概是40小时左右，比起无印的100小时来说虽然稍短，但是足够让我心满意足了，各处的旅游战斗属实有趣
5S真的是一部很棒的续作或者番外，完善真春性格的同时俩个新人物也是特别的有魅力，战斗部分虽然难度有点高但是还是很爽，台词撰写也是十分的棒，剧情也比较好，推荐给各位无印的粉丝们
[b]毕竟本作比起R，才是真正的续作[/b]

author: b5748135d06d54acb4813036d535d884
content:
Let me start this off by saying: if you played Persona 5 Royal and are worried about continuity, there's almost no collusion with the story, If you played Persona 5 original then you're fine, if you haven't played either Persona 5 game, or any Persona game at all, Play Persona 5 Golden first.

This game really is Persona 5: 2, the writing and characters are still great atlus writing and have great story beats despite it being a spin off. I understand that other persona spin off games the spin offs can be quite iffy, but nothing in this game really stands out. I've never played a musou game before, but it was amazing, atleast how atlus handled it and incorporated it into the persona world, I have heard it being compared to FF7 Remake's system. While I prefer the turn based system, i definitely understand why people are now calling for this to be the main fighting system in the games. And while not having the day to day life simulator aspect, there are still social events and ways the game gives control to the player in the regular world. 

This deserves not to be a looked at as a sequel, but as a worthwhile 20+ hour dlc of an already 80+ hours amazing game. If your a fan of Persona games and you're reading this review, you should buy it to show Atlus that we want more of their games on PC.

author: aa7b8fc51d6d58839c29dd4d6c064329
content:
Its Persona!

This game has a very heartfelt spot to my life. Persona was honestly my first JRPG and is what got me hooked to other games of that genre ever since. I unfortunately started with Persona 4 Golden for the PS vita (wish I played this franchise earlier) which then got me to P5 for the PS4 and now P5S for the PC. I feel pretty fancy getting to play different persona games on different platforms.

Overall, if you like persona or JRPGs in general.. This is a must buy. However be warned, I do recommend playing P5 or P5R before diving into Strikers. It is an exact sequal to where P5 left off and rarely is a sequal that does benefit from playing the previous title. As P5 or P5R will introduce you to each character traditionally which makes the inside jokes and connection to each character that much more meaningful.

author: 93e30173d471522e955f7a92900c2d5c
content:
After eight hours of play I experienced my first crash. This reset *roughly* twenty minutes of dialogue / cutscenes but I figured this was a good time to detail my first impressions.

Everything from here on can contain a spoiler, read the TL;DR if you want.

If you have experience with FF: XIII or Kingdom Hearts, you'll feel right at home. The majority of the combat is face-paced, hack'n'slash gameplay that feels enjoyably intense. While not up to Devil May Cry levels of complexity, the fights are very fun. Team member selection is vital to not getting teamwiped, even at the early levels, typical for an Atlus game.

I think this game was designed for a controller in mind, if you have one: play with it. Otherwise, I highly recommend rebinding almost every default combat / interaction key in the game. While initially frustrating, like most games on PC, a good keybinding setup is the first skill in any game. 

If you're new to the genre or Atlus games, don't be afraid to play on easy. I don't claim to be an expert to these type of games but, as a very competitive individual, I did get sent back to the loading screen more than once before completing the first dungeon on normal. Don't expect to be a god at this game if you have limited to no experience w/ the combat of other Atlus games. As is usual of this brand: the skill ceiling is high, the floor is rock bottom. And, trust me, the game is trying to make you experience rock bottom.

As for sound, top notch. The music has caused me, more than once, to sit back in my chair and take my hands of the controls. Some tracks are nostalgic from P5; others completely new. Each it's own an experience worth noting. The voice acting is solid. It really helps engross you in the story that would, otherwise, be boring to read.

Graphics are what I expected: anime. The cutscenes are well done w/ a mix of 2D and 3D animation. I want to make a note: I am not a fan of 3D modeling / animation BUT it's done well. The combat feels fun and looks great.

TL;DR

Sound: 10/10 - The soundtrack is amazing, voice acting engrossing
Graphics: 9/10 - I don't have a problem w/ 60fps and graphics that come straight from PS4. Feels Persona 5, man.
Gameplay: 9/10 - High learning curve. Can be very punishing but rewards good strategy. Initial keybindings are T R A S H.

I experienced my first game crash an hour before writing this review. This game has bugs.
Regardless, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone that enjoys strategic, fast-paced hack'n'slash games.

Edit: 34 hours and still playing. Suffered another crash that reset me the final 1/3 of a dungeon. Another 30 minute setback; nothing major. Frustrating, but both of my game crashes occurred after extended sessions (6+ hours). Rereading my initial impressions: all of them still have merit. My gut tells me I'm entering the final stages of the story. I'll give my final thoughts when I finish.

content:
Absolutely worth playing through if you enjoyed Persona 5/Persona 5 Royal.

The Phantom Thieves are back with a new story that's like if you take the road trip part of FFXV with Dynasty Warriors gameplay.

It's not as long as a typical Persona game but it's long enough to have an entertaining story with a great characters. I like the way they blended Persona gameplay elements with Dynasty Warriors gameplay, it works really well so you can't just spam attack or just personas. They also encourage you to take your time and try out every party member and not use just Joker as there is no deadlines either.

I 100%ed the game and it took me about 44 hours to do so and I didn't rush through the game either so I'd say that's a good amount if you wanted more Persona 5 content.

author: 9483608f26465fc8ae6b389528f7ae27
content:
Having finished it now i feel safe to write a short review.

Short, if you like the Warrior Games and you like Persona, you will very likely enjoy this game.

The combat itself feels engaging. The enviroment is usable in fights (swinging from poles, dropping stuff on enemies), maybe too much. Some fights can be cheaped out this way, but for a majority its fine. The combat system feels very good, they managed to mix the ability system very well with the button mashing. All Strong attacks in some way connect with the current Persona (some cast their go-to spell, offers debuff after a 2 hit-combo with strong attack and so on) so its interesting to just test random ones to see if you like their abilites more. On that note be said, that not all Personas from PE5 made it into this game.

The full cast is playable and all of them feel unique enough to not be dull. All of them have their unique strengths though.

The story feels is okayish for a warriors spin off, there have been worse, but towards the ending [spoiler]it feels like they copied the persona 5 a little bit too much, but thats my personal opinion.[/spoiler] Seeing new places however and having more area to go around felt nice. The battlemusic is a really awesome remix thats even after the 20th battle still nice to hear. If you go deluxe edition you get basically every persona game OST covered in some way.

CONS
Some bosses felt like HP-Sponges, especially the optional ones. A lot of jumping around to not get 1-shotted by some aoe thing, while spending 15 minutes chipping down hp. I had the game crash at 3 different times in my play time, so im neutral to that (but i read there is people with massive crash problems, so idk, i guess i was lucky). And thats about it from me in that corner.

Would i recommend the game?
If you dont know persona 5, and you dont know the warrior games, this might be a bad game to jump in.
If you only know for example Dynasty Warriors, the story might be confusing, i would recommend looking into Persona 5 and figure out for yourself if you would enjoy that.
If you are just a Persona Fan, i would go for it if you like action rpgs atleast.

author: 3ef197f315ce5bd68fc425a87db34d21
content:
I am making an edit to my review because I said I wanted a mainline title with this game-play. While this game is fun, there are a few caveats:

* No matter what character you use, combat gets somewhat repetitive after a while. 

* This game is surprisingly long (at least, in my opinion).

* If you want more enjoyment out of the story, you need to have played any version of Persona 5 first.

However, this game has plenty of positives to warrant buying:

* Awesome soundtrack.

* Graphics are fantastic.

* Fantastic boss designs.

* RPG elements present (sort of like Final Fantasy 7 Remake).

* And many more to discover for yourself!


TLDR: A good game with shortcomings.

author: ca2a51b6f209535a880f52664f00b6bc
content:
As a fan of Persona 4 and 5, i cannot recommend this. Yes, it is more of a Persona game than just a musou slasher, it has lovable characters, some sort of a plot and the same world we all love.

But.
The game has a clunky combat system (And I MEAN IT, i cannot enjoy the combat after Honkai Impact, a mobile game), mediocre camera, always-tight-and-cramped combat areas, non-intiuitive dodge system that cannot guarantee a dodge, unlikeable healing system. DMG-sponge minibosses that WILL hit you back because dodge is broken.

What's happening on the screen looks like a mess. A magnitude of monsters on the screen, flashes and damage numbers everywhere... you cannot enjoy your characters or cool combat moves because you basically see anything. 

I do not like the way they handled "no time limit" design while trying to squeeze it into the old idea of having a calendar. Basically, you can visit the dungeon as many times in a row as you like. And you do not need to visit the shops or town activities because this time you buy stuff "online" and there's no social progression save for a generic "bond level" for the whole group that gives you skill points. So, my problem with the whole thing is it's ruining the world, your impression and your affection for the game. During the time you are playing through a dungeon, you leave it to replenish HP\SP, you appear in the Cafe with the old man Sakura standing and looking at you, then you immediately go back, manage your inventory via a menu, go to a dungeon, fight, leave, replenish, go to a dungeon, back to cafe.... all in the same day. Completely ruins the Persona mood for me.

And all the game is feeling like it's repetative and trying to waste your time. Yeah, you get "palaces" again, but this time with more of a free-roam. You get your main objective at point A but it's locked and you have to visit locations B,C,D to get some shining orb and fight a miniboss. But guess what, at objective D you need to unlock the last door by ... guess what? Pulling levers E,F,G in location D.

At this point i got bored. If you like this kind of games - give it a shot.

author: 59c6001929065e05982c7a7d0fc1c8b2
content:
This game isn't just some Dynasty Warriors reskin, it's not a Persona cashgrab, Persona 5 Strikers is a fully fledged sequel to the original Persona 5 with more than enough content to be thought of as a true persona game. After 100+ Hours in this game I can happily say this is another fantastic game by Atlus (and KT this time).

[h1] MINIMAL STORY SPOILERS AHEAD[/h1]

[b] Overview[/b]
The Phantom Thieves are back and they are prepared to journey across Japan. Strikers' world building feels great, even whist travelling from Tokyo to Sendai, Sapporo, Okinawa, Kyoto, Fu.kuoka and Osaka in the space of 1 month and exploring jails as they go. Each city looks fantastic and are all very lively, an improvement on Persona 5. Though the combat may look a little intimidating to long time Persona fans it feels more at home with the actual combat the Phantom Thieves would go through. The beginning, middle and end of the game is consistently great and Atlus & KT gave a masterpiece such as Persona 5 a sequel it deserved.

[b] Gameplay[/b]
This time around the Phantom Thieves are tasked at exploring Jails across Japan, city-sized palaces ruled by some of the most powerful people in Japan. To fit the combat of Strikers, Jails are much larger than Palaces found in Persona 5 but are still filled with small details the can really grab your eye. A lot of enjoyment can be gained from just running around these Jails and mopping up shadows just for fun. 
As I mentioned before the combat is rather different than your traditional SMT or Persona game, but the most pivotal mechanics are still used in Strikers. Every Phantom Thief has their original personas and skills but all have a unique playstyle for you to experience and decide on your 'main'. Joker still has his wildcard ability, but due to the lack of Igor in the velvet room he only has access to half the personas available in Persona 5. Their different weapons and guns make for a whole new experience depending on who you use, and their weapon actually changes in their hand if you buy a new one.
[list]
[*] [b] Joker[/b] - Access to all elements, fast attacks and an all-around beginners character
[*] [b] Ryuji[/b] - Electric user, Slower bat attacks but do much more damage, focus on Physical skills and tanking
[*] [b] Ann[/b] - Fire user, Fast whip attacks and fastest gun (Sub-Machine gun), focus on magic skills
[*] [b] Morgana[/b] - Wind user, Fast sword attacks with a lot or aerial usage, mainly a healer
[*] [b] Yusuke[/b] - Ice user, Normal sword attacks but with flurry combos, crit monster, focus on Physical attacks
[*] [b] Makoto[/b] - Nuclear user, Normal fist attacks, all around nuclear powerhouse, an all-around character
[*] [b] Futaba[/b] - Navigator, non-playable but can provide buffs, healing and protection for the team.
[*] [b] Haru[/b] - Psy user, Very slow axe attacks but with very high damage, focus on gun attacks and combo skills
[*] [b] Sophia[/b] - Bless user, Fast Yo-yo attacks with a Rhythm mechanic, high-skill based character but can be used as a healer[/list]

[b] Overworld[/b]
The lack of 'daily life' of this game may put off a few from picking this game up, but the amount of interaction in the overworld decently makes up for it's absence. Every city has many NPCs to interact with and all shopkeepers have their own dialogue (and there are a lot of shops). After progression in the story the Phantom Thieves may be standing around town with dialogue of their own [strike] unfortunately it is not voiced[/strike]. They may also hand you requests which furthers the level of interaction you get from your long time allies. Every city looks vastly different from the next with their very own top tier theme, which really helps set each city apart from another. 

[b] Music[/b]
C'mon, it's a Persona game, you should know by now that is has fantastic music, and this game is certainly no exception. From the opening theme all the way till the credits song, in my opinion there is no bad or even mediocre track in the entire soundtrack. Every song fits the theme it requires and makes you want to explore each area in depth just to listen to the smooth Jazz. Speaking of which, p5's Jazz theme has not disappeared, though there is a bit of a metal theme for the more intense battles, which fits the high paced combat perfectly. It's another fantastic job by Shoji Meguro, Lyn, and the whole Atlus sound team.

[b] Graphics and Performance[/b]
Strikers is a pretty good looking game, the art style of Persona 5 compliments the gameplay of Strikers, using the bold lines and bright colours doesn't get you lost in the fast-paced gameplay. The menu's are the best Persona has ever done, with smooth transitions and every character having a cameo in different sections of the menu. Unfortunately this game was also developed for the switch, which limited how far they could take the graphical aspect of the game. Also this PC port is not the greatest, the cause is unknown but on some systems certain cutscenes will crash the game if viewed in fullscreen. It isn't very well optimised either, enemies will lag out the game using Agidyne, and text looks grainy due to Anti-Aliasing. Overall this doesn't effect the experience too much but it is something to keep in mind if you are debating between buying Strikers on PC or PS4

[b] Story[/b]
This is where Persona 5 Strikers really surprised me, as a spinoff I expected a toned down story filled with fanservice to keep the players happy but no. Strikers has a very 'persona-like' story, without the social links. Without a need to build characters (except the few new introductions) Atlus was able to fully focus on the story and make it great from the beginning until the end. The story starts a little weak but really picks up and is definitely on the level of a mainline Persona game story. Each new character fits perfectly into the story and each have their own role to play.

[b] Characters[/b]
Since this is a sequel to Persona 5 and not Royal, this game does lack Kasumi and any mention of Maruki, but the rest of the Phantom Thieves make their appearance with a new ally - Sophia, a sketchy detective -Zenkichi Hasegawa and an upbeat woman of tech - Kuon Ichinose.
Sophia is 'Humanity's Companion,' an AI Joker discovers in the depths of a Jail. Her main derivative is to learn, as she lost her memory after being dumped into this jail. She accompanies the Phantom Thieves in their trip, inside Joker's phone.  She's bright and bubbly and quite similar to Aigis from Persona 3.
Zenkichi is an employee of Public Security and has been tasked in researching the 'change of heart' epidemic that has swept across Japan. He may be a friend or foe but one thing is for sure, he'll be on your tail this whole trip.
Ichinose is a quirky tech guru that just loves her coding. She just happens to come across the Phantom Thieves and is a HUGE fan. She happily starts working with them to find the true culprit changing these hearts.

[b] Final Thoughts[/b]
Persona 5 Strikers is a great game to pick up if you're a fan of Persona or hack n slash musou games in general. There is over 100 hours worth of gameplay (including postgame) and it never gets stale. Merciless provides a great challenge in New Game+ and lets you listen to the amazing soundtrack even more.

[h1] FINAL SCORE: 9.1/10[/h1]

author: 34c9ff88f77f57638f078a0bba8a4a24
content:
Dopo aver finito il gioco posso ora fare la mia recensione. Ciò che scrivo è solo il mio parere soggettivo, spero che serva a voi che leggete.
Persona 5 Strikers è un bello spin-off dell'originale:  hanno mescolato magistralmente il GDR ( nella crescita dei personaggi, nelle ricerche delle varie Pernsonae, etc.), ad un sistema di combattimento musou. Nel leggere in varie recensioni  che il combattimento usava quel formato mi ero preoccupato, ma qui è stato fatto in modo intelligente. In alcuni scontri i nemici sono tanti nello schermo, ma meno che in altri musou; poi avendo la possibilità di fare imboscate ed assalti rende lo scontro più leggero rispetto ai "warriors" dove si hanno ondate di nemici. 
La storia è ben sviluppata ma lineare: per esempio le risposte che date non cambiano la storia. Le musiche sono veramente qualcosa di speciale: vi "delizieranno" le orecchie. Ci sono degli effetti di luce che mi hanno infastidito in certi momenti, ma non era inficiante. La difficoltà è ben calibrata, se volete un pò di sfida basta giocare alla prima run su "difficile" e se non ne avete abbastanza la rigiocate in NG+ a difficoltà "Spietata" e sarete accontentati.
Sono state oltre 70 ore di divertimento, e intendo continuare: infatti prima di fare NG+ mi dedicherò a fare il post game.

author: f84457a0e50b515c9bffbed6b6f1a1be
content:
Cerberus is a good boy. 

Felt like a persona game, Long start up to build story with little gameplay, but once you dive in, it's fast paced and action packed.
Not a DW copy exactly. Shadows pop up in mob forms, and often mini bosses (strong shadows with health bars up top) come out to play, but hack n slashing won't get you far. You must use strategy to beat most enemies. Run n Gun with joker only got me to the 2nd jail (palace in this game). 

Overall it's fun, and aside from getting the deluxe edition to only allow me access to the bonus content on separate disk/download and can't install to my computer.

author: ef713b36e412591aade641a81bb38e8c
content: jogo mt bom, preço salgado pra krl porem so na historia você ja consegue ver que valeu apena, o jogo tem uma duração de 30-40 horas e umas 60 se você for fazer 100% (não sei exatamente quantas horas porque ainda não fiz 100% mas eu sinto que isso e uma estimativa realista) , por mais que eu so tenha comprado por causa do zenkichi os novos personagens são mt bons, em si o jogo e bem parecido com o original em torno de historia tendo uma diferenças por causa dos novos personagens e a nova mecânica de "Prisões" então quem jogou o persona 5 original vai sentir essa similaridades na cara, a musica e boa pra krl, meu único problema e o sistema de fusão e bond, o sistema de fusão foi feito em base na função de "search fusion" dos outros jogos da franquia, oque pode ficar meio chato pra quem se acostumou com o sistema antigo de combinar 2 ou mais personas de sua escolha, e o sistema de bond mesmo sendo legal no inicio fica meio chato se você quiser fazer 100%, você precisa grindar mt pra conseguir level 99 OU você joga o jogo no NG+ que e algo que eu recomendo porque e bem legal, e isso adeus.

author: 8dca1e42c5af502394de7657e06d6993
content:
本家のペルソナ５は未プレイでしたが遊んでみました。（エンディングまで）
ただし、予習のためにアニメをみました(dから始まるアニメ見放題サービスで全話視聴）
ほかのレビューと同じで、やはり原作をプレイしている前提のストーリだと感じました。
PSを持っていないのでペルソナ４しかやっていませんが、世界観や演出などすべて
ペルソナ！という状態で、無双シリーズにあるようなアクションを取り入れてます。
しかし、後日談（外伝）という位置づけの為、ボリューミーに感じませんでしたが
ストーリはしっかり大きく組み立ててあり満足でした。
なにより新規キャラを丁寧に作りこんでおり、後半の熱い展開だけでも
やる価値はあったのでペルソナが好きな方はぜひ購入することをお勧めします。
不満があるとしたらオートセーブ機能がないことですね。
ＰＣに移植する際は必ず実施してほしいです・・・
４０時間やって１度だけですがクラッシュで３０分ほどのデータが飛んだときは萎えました。

author: 5a64759d89365c27af377b53a9d8c2f5
content:
[h1]P5系列为何天下第一，请君听我一言！[/h1]
　　一款好玩的游戏，往往能够施展时间消失术，P5S也依然能够做到这一点！
　　P系列秉承了JRPG一贯以来的王道故事，以及带感[spoiler]中二[/spoiler]的设定内容。
　　P5S也同样，哪怕他是P系列中无双系类型的第一作，也依然能够算是JRPG中素质极高的作品，带来的体验非常到位。[spoiler]这点如龙7可惜了故事，叫个如龙6S多好！不行叫个如龙6 max pro也行啊！←拍飞[/spoiler]
　　那么我就来仔细讲讲[spoiler]夸一夸[/spoiler]P5这游戏到底好在哪里[spoiler]天下第一还用夸？默秒全快去下单！[/spoiler]


[h1]横跨20多年“不变”画风[/h1]
　　对，我没写错，这也非常妖，也让人赞叹不已，故事要从这20来年说起……
　　这20年来，女神异闻录对于自己玩家定位非常准确，就是瞄准高中生左右年龄层市场而去的。
　　所以每一代的画风，在这20年来一直都非常“酷”，而每一代staff中副岛成记几乎成为了不变的选择。这个74年的老男孩，带给我们P1-5这些系列的人设[spoiler]而且还有福利推箱子之流的《凯瑟琳》[/spoiler]能做出这样的设定真是非常惊艳，而且极具风格化。没有对最新的文化与画风理解，是不可能一直做得出这种“最前沿”感受的画风的。[spoiler]当然其实是《凯瑟琳》实在太大，哦不，功不可没了！[/spoiler]


[h1]奇怪的合作，意料之外的质量[/h1]
　　其实很难想象ω-Force与Persona Team合作竟然没有用战国/三国题材[spoiler]某一次采访中ω-Force说最开始的方案是Persona拥有者穿越到战国[/spoiler]，而是做了一个第四学期！故事竟然是师传P5的正统剧情[spoiler]但是少了学妹医生占卜师围棋妹等等岂可修[/spoiler]，并且剧情虽有瑕疵，但是其实并没有如同P5R最终崩坏[spoiler]喵喵喵？[/spoiler]的感觉。
　　两边的合作照理应该是挺奇怪的，系列销量/玩家最认可的就是回合制玩法，其次是音游系列[spoiler]喵喵喵*2？[/spoiler]无双这种准备战斗后开始刷刷刷之后结束，就算这一代做出来那股无双味儿肯定让人难以下咽……但是……出乎意外的是，这一代的无双，竟然并不是全无双味儿，而是P系列的RPG探索要素更重一些。虽然本质上也仍然是公式化的操作，到达新场景→收集线索→攻略迷宫→攻略钥匙→攻略BOSS→到达新场景。但是所有的过程都有一股解谜和探索的味道，不再是无双系列的那种咚咚哐哐哇哇啊啊[spoiler]敌羞吾去脱他衣[/spoiler]的过关方式了。


[h1]简化什么，增加什么，非常有B数[/h1]
　　无双么，讲究[spoiler]说学逗唱[/spoiler]爽快置敌，这一点在需要凹P的P系列非常要命，而现在一系列复杂的合成就直接被简化了，战斗虽然还是迷宫化，但是也非常简洁，解谜内容有趣而不重复。有公式化的痕迹，但是都做了比较巧妙的处理，至少十几小时下来并没有觉得腻味。当然这里剧情占据了非常大的空间，同时其他的各个系统并没有明显的拉胯，也有隐藏要素穿插其中，好评！
　　同时原本的日期设定也被简化成可以随意进出监狱而不会推进时间线，进而方便玩家更好的刷刷刷。说到刷刷刷，各种支线的补充也大大延长了游戏的游玩时间，支线的奖励也非常诱人。
　　增加的内容也是长项上的增补，新的剧情脉络，新的角色人物，新的BOSS化脸谱，都能够让人持续的推动游戏进程。
　　所以一个游戏，制作者非常清楚想要什么，不想要什么的时候，这个游戏就可以说距离成功非常接近了，游戏的主要美术量都花费在BOSS战，新的地图解锁后的过场CG，人物的服饰变化等等，所有一切都是为了剧情主线做的服务，并且在每一关让对应的主角团角色代入，并且阐述了一定的社会问题，中心简单而不失一定的深度[spoiler]我的中二病不能这么简单[/spoiler]总体非常清晰，内容果敢到位。


[h1]演出效果与音乐音效[/h1]
　　别的不说，光说UI，一股子骚劲扑面而来。3D最高质量表现2D菜单，这么评价一点都不过分。
　　通盘的演出效果也非常带感[spoiler]杏你的泳装实在是太大，哦不，太白……噗呲……[/spoiler]虽然所有的人格面具都是P5拿过来的，但是所有的场景还是实打实重新建模重新编排了关卡，非常良心。这一代作为P5系列的子代目还是非常用心的。
　　说到音乐音效，这一代主基调不变的情况下，因为主角团周游了日本，所以音乐风格也有很多的变化[spoiler]目黑大佬赛高[/spoiler]，音乐向来也是P系列甚至是P5系的骄傲，这一代同样也不会让你失望。


[h1]总结[/h1]
各位[spoiler]身缠百万还要在沙滩上捡贝壳的[/spoiler]团长，
知道主题曲《Wake Up, Get Up, Get Out There》的中文翻译吗？
有个接地气的翻译，我想你知道后就回不去了
[h1]睡你吗批起来嗨[/h1]
[spoiler]莫纳：你已经累了，早点睡吧！[/spoiler]
所以你不下单还在等什么？
[h1]包围→要钱→全给你了，再怎么数也不会多→还有吗→还有吗→还有吗→总攻击[/h1]

author: 388fc6cb139b5d7a89ce3e37d3dfcadf
content:
作为一部外传性质的作品，P5S无疑相当优秀：继承了P5本篇华丽皮相（副岛成记の美术+目黑将司の音乐）与扎实骨相（剧情+玩法）的亮点，同时尝试补充了本篇剧情与人设的不足。推荐给所有喜欢Persona系列的玩家。

如果说P5本篇有什么不足之处，也许就是相较于P4G，日常部分剧情过少的着墨、以及部分队友角色和反派角色塑造的乏力。

到了P5S，日本几大城市的暑假观光游丰富了日常部分，这一点非常棒；对于P5本篇塑造欠缺的角色如奥村春，也加强了戏份。遗憾的是这个角色的剧情刻画仍然较为平淡，以至于与她在游戏战斗过程中的强力表现形成了丝许割裂感。

反派塑造上，亮点可能集中于第一个boss柊爱丽丝，不过另外几个boss的形像塑造同样具有现实批判意义。总体而言P5S的反派塑造仍然未能达到P4G足立透的水准，但依旧不乏趣味。

最后希望世嘉和Atlus早日将更多的Persona系列作品（如P3P和P5R）搬上PC。同时也期待Persona 6能给我们带来更多惊喜。

author: 65546d741b24527fbc104349d841c982
content:
Review breve

Storia 9.5/10 totally a Persona, anche se breve, ma è uno spinoff e come tale va considerato, in ogni caso c'è tutto, anche se tutto un po troppo rushato e alcune cose sono troppo scontate
[hr][/hr]
Personaggi 6.5/10 non perché siano brutti, anzi, quelli nuovi sono veramente ben fatti come caratterizzazione, ma sempre perche essendo il gioco breve hai poco tempo per approfondire tutto a differenza dei persona mainline dove vai nel dettaglissimo con tutti
[hr][/hr]
Progressione e pressure 5/10, il time management non esiste, i giorni esistono son solo per continuità con il gioco originale ma sei sempre su un binario rigidissimo, finché non fai il goal il gioco non ti fa mollare in nessun modo, ma di nuovo, legit because è uno spinoff hack n slash
[hr][/hr]
Gameplay combattimento 9.5/10 non mi aspettavo che sarebbero riusciti a integrare perfettamente l'essenza del combat e le meccaniche di persona in un hack n slash musou, ma ci sono riusciti in modo spettacolare, da soddisfazione ed è totalmente diverso dal gioco normale ma dopo i primi 30 minuti ti abitui immediatamente, ti sembra comunque Persona a turni, ma non lo è 

Overall 8.5/10 too much water

On to the Platinum ora!

author: 9b937a5e79085b71a7219c076460bb03
content:
If you're already a fan of Persona 5 and you're itching for more, this title is worth your time.

This title oozes with the same style and poise that Persona 5 has. The Dynasty Warriors combat mechanics work surprisingly well with the Persona conventions you're used to, so adjusting to this gameplay style is easier than you think. Each character is interesting and fun to play with in their own way, and you're properly incentivized to use all of them in different compositions throughout the game.

Aside from the combat, the rest of the game is familiar territory: Good story, great voice acting and character dynamics, excellent new music (and fantastic mixes on existing tracks), and a few cool surprises. Despite its nature as a genre and studio crossover, this is a genuine Persona game.

If you're [i] not [/i] a Persona fan already, this one might be a difficult game to sell you on. It's a follow-up with a very involved story that demands knowledge of the original to fully understand. If you don't have access to Persona 5, I would greatly recommend holding off until you play that masterpiece (let's hope they port it to PC). This is a sequel and better experienced after the original; it is not a standalone game.

I don't really have much to criticize here. The only minor complaint I had at all was about the frequency of tutorial interrupts toward the beginning of the game. If you're already familiar with the Persona conventions, there should be an option to prevent or skip those kind of pop-ups and show only the ones relevant to new mechanics like the combat. Especially since the majority of players of this game are likely Persona vets.
